reviews:
(from old notes - 7/25/2022)  12oz bottle from Woodmans in Waukesha. Aroma is very smooth; sweet malts, roast, barrel, and coconut are all strong components, in a smooth meld. Taste is rougher. The blend of the components, as well as some berry, and some anise, is well done. Has a sweet and smooth finish. Enjoyed this! 16.7
(from old notes - 7/25/2022)  16oz can from Craft Beer Cellar in Pewaukee with no can date (yet a note to drink fresh?!), shared with GorjusGirl. Orange pinkish pour with little head. Aroma hits with huge fruit punch. Lots of pineapple, passionfruit and guava, with sweet fruits. Taste is almost as good; more of the sweetness comes through. Not deep, but very, very fruity. Sweet finish. Very nice and fuller than one would expect from the ABV. 14.9
Very good IPA. Aroma was good. Fresh hay, cut grass and a hint of grain. Pour was a light brown with a one finger head. Taste was delicious. Very malty (as the dark color suggested) but a nice crisp green hop backbone and bitter finish. Good carbonation. This tastes like an old school IPA before craft beer was a thing.
Can from the LCBO. Black pour, small white head. Aroma is roasty, semi sweet, dark coffee, milk chocolate. Thin mouth feel, lively carb. High bitterness, hitter cocoa, and dark roasty coffee finish.
Can from Tavour. Pours hazy grapefruit gold with a large foamy/creamy white head. Aroma of melon and citrus/pine. More than med body. It's juicy, but rather dry. More than moderately bitter. Flavor is passion fruit, green melon, juicy resin. Light caramel in support. Complicated stuff. Exquisite flavor.
(from old notes - 7/25/2022)  12oz can from ck1, thanks! 4 Unclear golden orange pour. Fairly hoppy with a nice mango component for a brew approaching 8 months from its can date -- yup, the timing didn't work. This is crushable with good bones. Unsure if the mildness is due to style or age of the hops. 13.6
Basically it's a fresh resident hop beer with a little bit of weed and subtle coconut at the end. Nice balance between sweet, bitter and tart. I don't think the coconut really adds anything. Serviceable beer.
(from old notes - 7/24/2022)  16oz can from Longtable in Middleton with a can date of 2 months ago. Hazy pour. Big hoppy grapefruit & citrus nose, with the standard Hop Butcher lightly sweet malty aroma. Taste has passionfruit and is grapefruity bittersweet, with light sweet malts. More citrusy rough than the nose. Fruity bittersweet finish. 14.6
the aroma: fruity, hoppy, hints of orange, mango, lychee, spruce, grapefruit, spicy herbs...
the taste: fruity, hoppy, notes of orange, mango, kumquat, spruce needles, lychee, spicy grasses...
the aftertaste: sweet, bitter, dry...
[Can (473ml)] Pours a slightly hazy yellow-gold with a large lasting frothy white head. Lots of lacing. Nice fruity hop aroma (7+) with mango, citrus and more. Flavour follows, with citrus and tropical fruit, along with a moderately bitter finish. Medium bodied. Quite nice.
9/20/20 - Little Rock, AR - Bullard's Liquors - 12 oz can. Sparkling, medium golden pour, bubbly off-white head clings to the edge of the glass. White grape juice, touch of spruce in the aroma. More of a malt-oriented iSA, light caramel sweetness, hint of citrus bitterness, pretty full-bodied for the style with a chewy mouthfeel.
Can.  Hazy milky straw yellow in color, thick foamy white head… Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruits, tangerines… Flavor is creamy with muted notes of tangerines, grapefruit, unripe citrus fruit, lime zest, low bitterness.  Delicious
Aroma is vanilla, citrus and nutty hops.  The flavor is similar to the aroma, with a mildly sweet/spicy hop finish.
Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of banana, clove, wheat. Lighter bodied, somewhat thin but decent enough.
Refrigerated tall skinny clear bottle poured into a glass.  Dark amber.  Aroma is rich apple.  , medium body, and syrupy texture.  Taste is rich apple and apple brandy barrel.
Pours black with a one finger, tan head. Aroma is molasses, roast, bourbon and wood.  Taste is brown sugar and raisin, moving to roast and wood.  Finish is brown sugar, bourbon and roast.
(from old notes - 7/24/2022)  On tap at the source in MKE, enjoyed with ck1, HelloKitty13, BeardedOCBrewerH, GorjusGirl, and SoonToBe21. Pours a lovely reddish pink with no head. Aroma leads with hibiscus, fruity, lightly hoppy, somewhat herbal. Smooth. Taste does not have as much depth as the nose. More tart than sour. Not sweet, but with light sweetness. Finishes sweet, juicy and herbal, with fruit. Yum! 15.2
Pours clear raspberry with a nice frothy and pinkish head. Aroma delivers tart and sweet passionfruit, dragonfruit (of course!) and honey. Flavor gives up zesty passionfruit and dragonfruit, dry honey notes. Texture produces decent body and peppy fizz. Gotta love dragons.
(from old notes - 7/24/2022)  On tap at the source in MKE, enjoyed with ck1, HelloKitty13, BeardedOCBrewerH, GorjusGirl, and WillBe21Soon. Hazy pour. Aroma has nice pear, with hops. Taste follows, without the depth or volume hoped for. Finishes sweet and a bit light. The pear is good but needed more. 13.4
473 ml can ordered online from Bevi Birra.  Pours a hazed golden  colour with modest-sized whiteish head that leaves very good lacing. Aroma is big on stone and tropical fruits with some biscuit. Flavour has creamed mango and peach, papaya, a touch of vanilla and biscuit. Creamy mouthfeel.
(from old notes - 7/24/2022)  On tap at the source in MKE, enjoyed along with ck1, Hellokitty13, BeardedOCBrewerH, GorgusGirl, and GonnaBe21Soon. Almost black pour with a brown/tan head. Aroma has ashes, sweet malts, and light hops. Taste is similar, adding some cherry. Still not much of a hop presence, but quite ashy. Finishes lightly sweet. Black IPAs are so hard to have in the good balance unless overwhelming with hops, and this one does not get there. 13.3
(from old notes - 7/23/2022)  16oz can from Craft Beer Cellar in Pewaukee. No visible can date. Hazy pour. Aroma hits immediately with big juniper. There also is lemon & lime, a bit more lime focused, with lactose. Taste is of big juniper, strong lime, with lactose and lemon. Nice representation of the cocktail - would swear there is gin in it. Very tart and bitter. Very hoppy. Also very lactic - to the net negative. Unneeded in this brew. Nicely bitter fruity finish. 13.8
(from old notes - 7/23/2022)  16oz can from Craft Beer Cellar in Pewaukee shared with Gorjusgirl. Thick orange smoothie pour, a bit surprising for style. Aroma leads with peach and sweet graham crackers. Taste is surprisingly sweet, with some tart peach. Not deep enough to balance the sweetness. 13.4
Pours a transparent gold with thin white head.  Lots of fruit on the nose.  Taste of apple, melon and straw.  Finishes with a mild bitterness.  Refreshing take on a Canadian ale.
(from old notes - 7/23/2022)  5oz pour from Craft Beer Cellar in Pewaukee - random decision to try after avoiding it years back around the Chicago area, and it being on tap here for several months. Pours very dark brown with a thin tan head. Aroma has interesting spices with a bit of smokiness. Taste has light sweet malts, spices, and smoke. Not thick or deep. Finishes a bit short but smoky. The smoke is solid but the remainder of this is a bit weird. 13.2
(from old notes - 7/22/2022)  16oz can from Craft Beer Cellar in Pewaukee with a can date of 2 1/2 months ago. Hazy pour, very pale. Aroma is hoppy fruity; grapefruit, lemon, apricot, and papaya. There also is light leather and pale malts. Big hop oils, in a very hazy presentation. Taste has a solid citrusy component, with grapefruit, papaya, lemon, and lime. Tangy, somewhat tart, and fruity. A solid juicy hazy brew. 14.2
(from old notes - 7/22/2022)  On tap at Champps in Brookfield. Pours a very dark brown with a brown head. Aroma has sweet malts, sweet cola, simple sugar, and barrel. Taste follows, getting sweeter and sweeter. Shrug? The base brew is underneath, so the floor is solidly high on this one, but the sugars and sweetness drag it down near that floor. 14.3
Varnish, bubblegum nose, volatile. Hazy amber, thin head. Bubblegum.. Medium body, easy carbonation. I would be shocked if there weren't artificial flavorings in this, but it really isn't bad.
Black pour with a thin foamy khaki head. Big bold hazelnut aroma with a rich roasty cocoa undertone with a little woods and char. Big roasty dark flavor with lots of hazelnut, charred oak, cocoa, and earthy boozy hazelnut finish.
Draft pour pint at Hop and Hound.  Thin oily head, muddy brown pour.  Really easy drinking porter, with gentle, but jammy raspberry notes blended well with soft milk chocolate. Slightly tart character to this.  Hints towards a sour brown.  Easy drinking, flavorful light porter.  Quite nice.
Draft at Screw & Brew. Deep golden pour, mild haze, spotty head. Malty aroma, caramel, sweetness. Taste adds a dollop of hops to the base, just enough bitterness to make this an easy drinking brew.
16 oz. can in a trade with tfontana. Thanks Buddy. Aroma is a bold amount of tart peach and baked white bread. Flavor is like lingering tart peach with a very light herbal hand in the finish. Pretty respectable brew.
Clear amber pour with a thin bubbly white head and thin stripes of lacing …. Aroma of toasted malts, caramel malts, light roasted malts and some biscuity malts …. Taste is of biscuity malts, caramel malts, toasted malts and roasted malts …. Finish is dry with light bitter floral hops, toasted malts, earthy flavors, biscuity malts and caramel …. Has some vienna malts on there .. decent little brew
Keg @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 20-09-22
In short: another hazy IPA
Did I enjoy it: yes
Another hazy IPA from Caleya, lupomax a tope. Tropical fruits, both in nose and flavour. Enjoyable, as usual.
the aroma: hoppy, fruity, hints of orange, tangerine, pine, grapefruit, spicy herbs...
the taste: hoppy, fruity, notes of orange, grapefruit, pine needles, pomelo, spicy grasses...
the aftertaste: sweet, bitter, dry...
I don’t know how to describe this beer. It’s amazing.  From the beautiful golden color to the multi layered hoppness.  Although there are floral tones this is dank bliss.
[Can (473ml)] Pours a deep reddish-orange with a large lasting frothy light-pink head. Aroma of cherries first followed by lime and bready malt. Slightly tart cherry and lime flavour. Average bodied. It’s as described, pretty good.
Bottle from Corti Bros. Pours clear gold with a large creamy white head. Aroma has a slight corn aspect. Some mild grass/spice. Med body. Flavor has a very slight corn aspect, otherwise bready, light grass/spice hop. Seems dry. Lightly bitter. Ok drink.
Can. Pours a slightly hazy orange with a thick white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits, grapefruit, mango, grassy hops. Flavor of earthy hops, grassy hops, grapefruit, citrus, tropical fruits, bitter hops. Pleasant and hoppy, citrusy, grassy.
7/4/8/4/15 (3.8/5)
Abv. 11.0%. A dark brown beer, a head is small and beige. Aroma is strong, raisin, caramel, barrel. Taste has dried fruits of strong raisin, caramel, richness of maltyness, light vanilla. Full bodied. Not totally balanced. Pretty nice.
12oz canned April 17, 2022, drunk 9/20/22.
Ebony, tan head, small, moderate retention.
Smells metallic.  Kind of like autolysis and oxidation.  Prune, raisin, caramel, cacao and dark roast coffee all hang rather heavily on the nose with the tawny port adding a lot of vinousness, extra oxidation and light alcohol.  Just too much grape, acidity, dark chocolate, prune, etc...
Very vinous in the mouth with huge port notes that are overdone and dominate the beer, despite tasting objectively excellent.  Grapey, pruney, raisiny, just way, way, way too much of that character.  That's basically all this beer is.  On the plus side, the texture is soft and sumptuous, malty and properly attenuated and there's no sign of the booze.  But sadly, the grape just utterly destroys this one.
The aromas are a berry mix and oddly, sour milk. Flavors are somewhat similar to nose, slightly more tart than sweet, lots of berry. Finish follows flavors. Not bad nor complex.
Almost clear golden blonde pour with a thin white head and some light lacing …. Aroma of grass, grains, straw, caramel malts and biscuits …. Taste is of grass, grains, caramel malts, light straw, light fruits, light biscuits ….. light brew with a bit of lemon …. Finish is of light grass, grains, straw and tart lemon …. Sessionable, crisp and clean ….. nice brew for the style
Tap to 750 ml. crowler. Clear, copper-brown with a creamy half-inch head. Aroma of spicy bread, coffee, and caramel. Tastes of spicy bread, earthy rye, and a touch of walnut shell. Light-medium mouthfeel with mid-level carbonation and a dry slant.
the aroma: fruity, hoppy, hints of orange, tangerine, pine, lychee, spicy herbs...
the taste: fruity, hoppy, notes of orange, tangerine, pine needles, kumquat, spicy grasses...
the aftertaste: sweet, bitter, dry...
Gold pour. Thin foam. Even lace. Lemongrass, malt, hay, and some wheat. Wheat and lemongrass palate. Light bodied and easy carbonation
16 ounce can from Blue Bottle in Hendersonville. A hazy like orange color with a lot of citrus to it. Pretty good.
A light hazed peachy pink red coloured pour with a loose pink head. Aroma is light sour apple, cherry, berries, mellow funk, white grape, floral petal notes. Flavour is composed of tart berries, raspberry, red berries, yogurt funk, crisp, cherry sweets, mellow funk. Palate is light tart, drying finish, highish carbonation.
Draft at Khyber Pass. Cloudy orange pour. No head or lace. Strongly sour. Hugely peach. Some orange and mango. Additional notes of strawberry, banana, and lime. Not as full or complex as the plum version but pretty good.
On tap. Very hazy almost milkshake pale orange beige.  Very hazy juicy citrusy hop character throughout.  Mild smooth and fresh.  Low bitterness.   Quite good
On tap  clear deep copper pour. Thin wispy off white head.. a little woody and ciders.  Smooth light toasted grains. Decently hopped for an amber
The aromas are classic pilsner, mainly pale malt with a little appropriate hops and a touch of yeast. Flavors are somewhat similar to nose, a little malty sweet up front and an easy bitter finish. Decent body and carbonation. Drinkable but nothing special.
From cask at The Dog & Bell, Deptford, London, with Sigmund, 20.09.22. Clear pale golden. Dense white head and lacing. Fine aroma and taste of marmalade, succade and sweet pale malt. Round and uncarbonated mouthfeel.
20.09.2022 - 1l plastic bottle from budweis, bb 12.08.2022. pours a hazy amber with some sediment. aroma of fruity hops, berries, blood oranges. flavour of blood oranges, spruce, minerals, herbal caramel. medium body, not too heavy or sweet for an ipa.
I like those berry/candy notes, nothing wrong with this beer, but something is missing in it for me.
On tap.  Black pour light tan head  lots of coffee and bitter chocolate aroma.  Kind of a dark soy sauce flavor at the end.
Draft at Khyber Pass. Very cloudy reddish orange pour. Slim foamy ring. Fairly tart. Acidic plums. Notes of sour cherry, nectarines, mulberries, and blackcurrant. Reasonably complex full sour.
Sample at Derry After Dark. 
Dark tawny brown with a fizzy off white head that dissipates quickly. 
Rich toasted toffee and faint caramel maltiness. Dark dried pitted fruits with some earthy hop and light warming alcohol to counter. Great body and medium thick mouthfeel. Very nice sipper
Can pours milky light-amber with a generous creme coloured head, retaining well. Aroma is not as strong as expected, but indeed hoppy, tropical fruits, plus some caramel. Taste is very fruity, medium sweet and only light bitter; retronasal the hoppyness is there. Mouthfeel is rather smooth, with a dangerously easy body, but still somewhat alcoholic. Nice brew, but a bit on the sweet side for an T-(NE)IPA; might need some more hop bitterness.
A couple of samples at Derry after dark
Hazy lemon yellow without much of a head.
Intense sweet and sour sauce vibe with pineapple playing off and almost cherry like sweetness. Tart lemony flavor and aroma reminds us its a sour. Tasty
Somewhat tinny hay and lemongrass nose. Clear amber, thin head. Sweet grain, cane sugar, grass. Light body, easy carbonation. Not bad, but a bit sweet for my taste.
(473ml can from L'Axe du Malt, Quebec City) Pours near-opaque yellow-gold with a decent white head and spotty lace. Aroma is dank catty mango with some funky over-ripeness backed by guava, papaya and floral lime with a little earthy pine in there for balance. Flavour is bright lemon-lime peel and pulp with pineapple with some not-so-sweet yellow mango, crackery oaty malt that is quite dry for a Hypa, bone dry finish with lime peel florals, light peppery citrus oil and conifer needle, soft bitterness. Fairly light body, soft tingling carbonation. Solid example, definitely less sweet than expected with a crisp refreshing nature and an unusually lime-forward presentation for this hop bill. Nice!
12 oz. bottle from Shaw's grocery store in South Portland, Maine. Pours a clear gold color with a white head and decent retention. Spotty lacing. Aroma of hops and light grapefruit. The taste follows the nose: Light hops flavor with light grapefruit bitterness. Light body. Slightly low carbonation. A session hazy light beer.
Draft at the Khyber. Hazy pale yellow amber pour with just a slim foamy ring. No lace. Full and juicy wheat beer with "autumn" spices. Cassia. Nutmeg. Allspice. Ginger. Some pumpkin/squash notes as well. Mango. Kumquat. Faint vanilla. Certainly meant to be a Pumpkin Spice wheat beer. Thankfully not sweet. Drinkable for what it is.
Sample at Derry after Dark
Lightly hazy deep yellow with a decent sized bubbly white head that slowly dissipates. Rich bready crackery maltiness with bits of spicy and floral hops to counter
Pours hazy pear into a nonic. White head quickly recedes to nothing. Dusty pineapple, papaya and lychee aromas. Medium bodied and dry with melon and pineapple front to back.  Abrupt lychee finish.
500ml bottle. Jet black colour with slightly late awakening, small, thick, creamy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, tan head. Sweet-ish, cookie fortified, dark malty aroma, notes of almond, almond cookies, dark chocolate, cocoa, amarettini, a touch of dark caramel. Taste is surprisingly dry, chocolately, again cookie fortified, dark malty, notes of amaretto, dry cocoa, almond, some caramel, amarettini, subtle sweetness, a light alcoholic touch; intense amaretto finish with a minimally warming, alcoholic touch.
Viscous testure, smooth, super soft, silky, minimally cloying palate, very fine, soft, creamy, still efficacious carbonation.
Immensely intense, harmonious, maybe a tad too much almond / amaretto dominated, excellent mouthfeel - goody.
Bottle. Sour aroma of vinegar, apples. Taste of vinegar, vine notes, apples, lemons, touch of caramel, light sweet, medium sour. Medium body, sweet and sour fruity finish. Ok.
the aroma: vegetable and floral, hints of tomato juice, pepper, garlic, spices...
the taste: vegetable and spicy, notes of tomato, pickled cucumber, pepper, garlic, spicy herbs...
the aftertaste: sour, spicy...
Pale golden pour with a thin white head and light lacing …. Aroma of grass, fruits, citrusy, earthy hops, lemon, orange, biscuits and melon notes ….. taste is of citrusy lemon, orange, grass, pepper, earthy hops, melon and cracker/biscuity malts ….. finish is earthy with melon, lemon, orange, biscuits and spicy pepper …. Tasty and decent sessionable Pilsner
From cask at The Dog & Bell, Deptford, London, with Sigmund 20.09.22. Translucent golden. White head and lacing. Fine taste of pale malt, pale crystal malt, marmalade, black currants and various sweet citrus. Well balanced with moderate bitterness. Appropriately uncarbonated. Full mouthfeel.
Draft at Khyber Pass. Hazy orange pour with a full cover of soft foam. Lots of lace. Big juicy tropical citrus. Unexpected brown sugar. Caramel kumquats. Bruised stone fruit. Hints of tea leaves and black pepper. Full body and pleasantly complex. Good show!
Pours clear copper into a stein. White soapy head with good retention recedes leaving spider lacing. Bread and caramel aromas. Medium bodied with caramel and brown bread upfront turning to rustic, fruity sourdough and citrus in the medium length finish.
Dark brown color, small beige head. Aromas of coconut, vanilla, chocolate, caramel and banana toffee. Very sweet taste with salted caramel, vanilla, tonka, alcohol, chocolate, coconut and toffee.
Bottle.
Super easy porter that masters to hide the voltage. That kinda makes it ultimate cold day choice whiteout a worry of quick pass out. Really nice
Amber color, small white head. Aromas of malt, citrus, hops and spruce. Taste of citrus, malt, grass, resin and hops.
Cask at The Wellington, Birmingham.  Pours deep brown towards black with a cream cap. Aroma: oats, roasted malts. Taste: light to moderate sweet & moderate bitter, smooth, oats, dark chocolate, trace of dark fruits. Light body with fine carbonation. Tidy.
Amber color, small beige head. Aromas of malt, caramel and slight syrup. Taste of malt, nuts and caramel.
12oz draft at brewery. Cloudy golden with a sparse head. Light grainy, biscuity aroma. Taste is malty, crisp with a nice little bitter bite at the finish. Nice body and feel.
Amber color, small beige head. Aromas of bread, citrus, apricot and syrup. Taste of malt, wort, herbs and citrus.
Pale golden color, large white head. Aromas of citrus, herbs and bread. Taste of malt, herbs, citrus and earth.
Golden color, large beige head. Aromas of grass, citrus, bread and earth. Taste of malt, earth, grass and herbs.
Golden color, large white head. Aromas of malt, hops and slight citrus. Taste of malt, grass and hops.
Draft at Khyber Pass. Foggy pale straw pour with slim foam. Grapefruit wheat beer. Notes of lemon, lime, and pineapple. Somewhat fuller than expected. Not exciting but works fine I suppose.
Medium gold with a big rocky white head. Nose is musty hops. Juicy, balanced taste, nutty notes and piney hops.
Hazy dark gold, big off-white head. Nose is pineapple, hops, malt. Good balance, taste typical of the style. Aromas - faint pineapple & citrusy hops.
BIAB at The Wellington, Birmingham. Pours light hazed straw with no head. Aroma: apple, apple skins, mere hints of funk. Taste: medium sweet apple, some floral notes. Medium body. Simple but fine.
Very solid tipa, enough to excite the palate and stimulate the senses. Not enjoyable if you don't downright love to get hoppy. Feelin froggy jump on this grenade of hop flavor. Imperial west cost ipa that delivers that stone taste and feel we all love good job stoner
Dark amber almost mahogany from the can.  Classic BW aroma and flavors.  Smells like aged malt, toffee, caramel, bread, deep malt yet quite hoppy.  A nice warming sipper.
Medium sized white head that drops out quickly. Clear, pretty red hued brew.  Mild nose, raspberry, some cherry, faint though. Light bodied, bit crisp, hint tart, gettin a little thinner. Raspberry and cherry flavors, mildly tart, cute, kinda reminds me of black cherry koolaid. Little tart finish. Quaint. 16oz can from Guy Miller. Thanks buddy!
It's a toasty beer that doesn't have an aftertase but it lacks much flavour
whote label 2022, Willet and 13%.  Dark fruit, tofee, vanilla, oak, bourbon.  So stinkin amooth, especially at this abv.  4.3+
One of a series of ciders I sampled with Matt R. in 2022. They were all pretty solid and this one stood out. Fresh and the coriander added a nice zest. Very pleasant.
Definitely my favourite Spanish beer. It is like English pale ale but not as harsh.
Keg at the Indian Brewery Taproom, Birmingham. Pours light hazed orange amber with a slim white cap. Aroma: honey dominates. Taste: moderate sweet & light bitter, malt, honey, a bit yeasty. Medium body with low carbonation. No balance to this, very average indeed.
From the Bottle at Dan's Brewery, 98 North Western Street, Manchester 24/06/2017 Some spiced aroma. Tiny beige head. Black smooth on the palate and strong in alcohol with a spicy ginger flavour. Slightly dry coffee roast finish. As Imperial Stout Malter Ego Ginger.
Man, give n that some of my favorite beers of all time are Speedways, this was a massive disappointment.  I've had some variations in the base beer over the years, but it's always been good.  Sometimes one of the best.  Of 38 previous Speedways I've never scored one below 4.0.  Of 122 other Alesmith beers, only two were under 3.5, and the lowest was 3.0 (key word was).  This tasted (and especially smelled) green...like bad coffee green pepper green, lacked the body and flavor I'm used to from the base, and vanilla and even cinnamon were lacking.  The can WAS ten  months old, but the best Speedway I've ever had was a year, so that is no excuse.  Hoping it's an anomaly, not a pattern.
Bottle 0.75l. Lightly cloudy, amber colored. AROMA- toasted malts, caramel, dark bread, strawberry jam, bubble gum, floral. FLAVOR- buttery texture, neutral, bitter, toasted, caramel, bread crusts, earthy, strawberry, plum. Medium bodied.
Drinkable.
Can shared with Sigmund at Jars Bar, Deptford, London, 20.09.22. Cloudy straw colour. Foamy, dense and persistent white head and lacing. Fine aroma and taste of papaya, mango, pineapple, various citrus and chives. Full mouthfeel. Good!
Draft at Khyber Pass. Cloudy yellow pour with slim soapy foam. Splashes of lace. Very juicy. Big orange/clementine. Fainter notes of mango, pineapple, and passionfruit. Mild pine. Feels pretty straightforward. Seems simple but it takes a lot of effort to make an IPA so effortlessly drinkable.
On tap @ Lupulo. Pours an opaque golden color with minimal white foam. Fairly tart and citric. A lot of peach, grapefruit, lemon, and lime. Juicy and fruit forward. A touch of oak, some white cake, and some tannic fruit skins. Has a touch of white pepper, some melon, and a light herbal quality on the finish. Light to medium carbonation with a pretty good body. Nice dry finish with a pleasant acidity. Solid offering.
Tap at the Munich Tap, 20th September 22.  Pours clear and golden.  Aroma is resinous pine and pith.  Taste is bitter, pith and lots of resinous pine.  Pretty decent west coast IPA
Diggin the slightly lighter abv and the smooth blend of oatmeal and russian stouts.  Dark brown from the bottle.  LOVE the roast that more than hints at coffee that isn't there.  A touch sweet for me, so I think the rest without the caramel would be elite, but still dang tasty as is.
Hazy yellow from the can.  Really expressive hops, especially on the nose, but a nice soft feel as well.  Well rounded palate is tangerine and pineapple gummy bear as advertised, just a hint of hop bite.
Can, 0.25l. Aroma of cardamom, wine, citrus and rubber. Pours clear amber color with medium sized soapy off-white head, fair lacing and sparkling appearance. Taste starts tart vinous
follows by cardamom, anise, cocoa and wood, mouthfeel is warm, while finish is mild bitter. Full body, oily texture and average carbonation in palate. Cocoa on spicy steroids…
Greenway draught, 9/20/22.
Dark root beer-looking.  Off-white head to ring quickly.
Hazelnut, caramel, chocolate and coffee give a traditional impression.  Low mineral, low hop, no alcohol or flaw.
Soft and malty, dry with the moderate roast and hazelnut helping see to that.  Vanilla, honey, light dark fruit, low mineral, slight herbal hop.  Medium bodied and crisp on the end with very high drinkability.  Clean, no alcohol noted.
On tap at The Beer Cellar-Glen Ellyn, IL. as a 9 oz. serving to a house snifter, showing a clear, golden hue, with a presentable layer of white froth that created a spray-like band on the glass. The nose was appropriately malty, citrusy grapefruit & orange, with slight pine. Medium bodied, the taste was as the aroma notes, with lively carbonation, and citrusy, rind-like, earthy, and slightly resinous bitterness. An excellent West Coaster.
Man...just as good maybe as the milk chocolate, which is the best NA brew to date.  flavors and aroma rich, spot on.  Thinner as expected, but it's good enough that it's hard to care.  Nose and flavor 8.5.
Keg at The Wolf, Birmingham. Pours clear yellow with a white cap. Aroma: paper, corn, white bread. Taste: light to moderate sweet & light bitter, crisp, grassy, white bread, corn, light dry finish. Light body  with foamy carbonation. It's not as terrible as I feared, light & chuggable if pushed.

Probably a 3.5 with a bump for being yet another nice NA from Untitled Art, who does them better than anyone.  Crisp and clean, slightly grassy and floral with a sweet malt bite.  Thinner as expected, but it works.
Pint at Lizardville in Copley, Ohio. Smell the citrus hops. Light bright yellow with big white head. Taste light hops, fruity, and some citrus. Light bodied and easy to drink. Light hop aftertaste. Good hazy. Cheers!
--Canned, from Systembolaget. -- Almost clear golden, mid sized  head. Generous aroma of dill and citrus. Mid dry with medium body and clean, rounded mouthfeel. Yuzu and dill, orange and grain. Low bitterness.
750ml wired cork bottle from Cat in the Glass. Opened with a pop. Hazy orange gold colour, big foamy white head that quickly dissipates away and aroma of tangy, apple, juicy, fruity, some caramel and funk. Taste is tart, tangy, apple, fruity, juicy, orchardy, funk, leather, woody, with a caramel hint and drying tannins. Medium bodied, spritzy carbonation, dry tannic finish. Very drinkable.
On tap at The Beer Cellar-Glen Ellyn, IL. as a 9 oz. serving to a house snifter, showing a clear, orangey/gold color, a decent layer of soft white froth that produced a thin ring, with ribbons & spots of lacing. The nose was strong tangerine, malt & vanilla, and candy sweetness, with orangey tanginess. Medium bodied, the taste was similar notes, but favorably less expressive, with lively, seltzer-like effervescence, light minerality, and a bit of earthiness to the finish. A somewhat overbearing intro that resulted in a rather refreshing ale.
Draft at Khyber Pass. Hazy deep gold with a full finger of foam. Lots of lace. Honey forward Tripel. Wildflowers. Caramel kumquats. Bruised oranges. Americanized Belgian florals. Feels more honey than honeysuckle. Peppery bite at the end. Definitely feels like some work went into this but not really enjoying it.
The last cheers to the Queen!
Bottle 0.75l from our archive, half and three years aged. Black, opaque. AROMA- some sour cherries, roasted, nuts, wood, pralines, pleasant alcohol. FLAVOR- neutral to dry, a bit sour, bitter, roasted, strong wood, a bit burnt, vanilla cigar. Medium to fuller bodied.
Another sourish imperial stout, really not the best one for Her Majesty. Oh, pity.
From tap at Jars Bar, Deptford, London, with Sigmund, 20.09.22. Cloudy pale straw colour. Dense and persistent white head and lacing. Fine aroma and taste of sweet grapefruit, lychee, pine shoots, pineapple and passion fruit. Well balanced with alcohol and grapefruit and pine bitterness.
Cask Handpump at Dan's Brewery, 98 North Western Street, Manchester 24/06/2017 Fruit hop aroma. Small white head. Dark coloured a little rich and smooth on the palate. Fruity and hoppy with a hint of bitterness in a creamy malt finish.
Can 0.5l. Cloudy, gold colored. AROMA- dog food at first, celaskon, peach, citrusy, pineapple, floral. FLAVOR- neutral to dry, lightly sour, moderately bitter, citrusy, pineapple, papaya, gooseberry, floral, grassy. Medium bodied. 
Not the best one from Sibeeria. Somewhat close to sour IPA.
Bottle pours at Arrogant Sour 2022. Hazy orange with white head. Fruity, some grapes, funk, citrus, honey, stone fruit, barrel. Quite complex. Very nice.
Large white head, good retention and lacing. Murky blond color. Bready yeasty nose, lil spicy. Med/light body with a soft carbo. Doughy malts, esthery yeast, grain and grass, hint of banana and overripe melon. Fruity dry finish. Nice to see a Saison done to style for a change. Nice quaff! Props to Guy Miller for the 16oz can. Thanks Guy!
440ml can. Hazy, yellow-ish, bright golden colour with average, frothy to creamy, moderately lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Citrusy fruity, minimally herbal-grassy hoppy and minimally earthy-grainy, pale malty aroma, hints of mandarine, orange, some lemon. Taste is zesty, bitter and citrusy fruity hoppy, minimally creamy, dry, pale malty basis without residual sweetness, hints of lemon, tangerine, orange, mandarine. 
Slightly creamy and oily, watery texture, dry palate, fine, prickly carbonation.
Rather slim, a bit monotonous - taken as concomitant: OK; not overly impressive if consumed deliberately. Nevertheless a tad more rich and complex than version #1.
This is a really nice hazy IIPA. Pours dark orangish yellow with a thick syrupy citrus aroma. Lots of tropical fruit in the flavor, a smooth mouthfeel. Tried courtesy of Andy in 2022 at Samuel's bday party.
--Sample, thanks oh6gdx! -- Hazy golden, mid sized head. Gingery nose with orange and marzipan. Mid dry with medium body and well rounded mouthfeel.  Yuzu and ginger, grass and marzipan. Mildly warming finish.
Can, from the brewery. Faintly cloudy dark orange-yellow with very small frothy off-white head, piney-coriander flavor, low carbonation, medium bitter lightly piney orange peel taste, thin body, long finish. Decent.
On tap at The Beer Cellar-Glen Ellyn, IL. as a 9 oz. serving to a house snifter, showing a hazed, orangey/gold color, with a presentable layer of soft white froth that reduced to a persistent ring, light film, and ribbons of lacing. The nose was soft malt, Belgian yeast spice, dried fruit, and a touch of sweetness. Medium bodied, the taste was as the aroma notes, detecting some phenols, citrusy tartness & tanginess, lively carbonation, and some grainy, fruity, and mildly earthy bitterness.
On tap @ Lupulo. Pours a cloudy golden color with a white head. Fairly dank up front with weed, onion, and garlic notes on the nose. Some grapefruit, pineapple, and mango. Some bread and cracker notes as far as the malt goes. A touch of bitterness from citrus rind, herbs, and onion. Decently fruity but a touch too heavy on the fuel and onion dank for me.
Can. Black pour. Aroma of nice smokey peat, dark chocolate, roasted malt, licorice, little caramel and coffee. Taste has creamy smokey peat, roasted malt, fruity coffee, caramel, dark chocolate, little vanilla, licorice and sorachi ace. Very nice, as expected.
--Sample, thanks oh6gdx! -- Hazy pale yellow, fizzy head. Perfumy grapefruit zest aroma. Sweetish with light body and clean mouthfeel. Grapefruit zest and Grape Tonic. Spritzy and flimsy. Piney lightly bitter finish.
16 oz. can, drunk from a can on a hike. The nose is orange peel, straw, spruce, coriander, and light bubblegum. Dry and dusty, with a good bitterness. Light to medium body, crisp, and bright. Clean, solid wheat beer.
Bottle from the brewery online shop. Pours clear dark brown with a thick beige head. Aromas of chocolate, toffee, burnt toast, dark berries. Taste is leather, chocolate, toffee, charcoal. Rich and complex for the abv.
Bottle at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels. Pours black with a slim beige tan cap. Aroma & taste: roasted malts, chocolate, Islay whisky barrel, peat smoke, dark fruits, coffee hints. Moderate sweet & bitter. Medium body with light carbonation.


16 oz. can, drunk from the can. The aroma is espresso, almond, honey, dark chocolate, and chalk. Sweet and malty, with a dusty bitterness. Heavy body, with a syrupy, grainy palate. Delicious and decadent.
On Tap at Manchester Brewing Company, 66 North Western Street, Manchester 24/06/2017 Big tropical fruit aroma. Small white head. Golden coloured cloudy in appearance and strong in alcohol with a fruity mango flavour. Very hoppy with a hint of dryness and some roast malt in a bitter pine and malt finish.
330ml can from the brewery. Poured a hazy rich golden colour with a lasting frothy white head and lots of bubbles. The aroma is malt, white chocolate. The flavour is moderate sweet, with a rich, grainy malt, earthy, light floral, dry coffee palate. Over medium bodied with lively carbonation.
Bottle from a Japanese market. Pours shocking dark green with a large foamy light green head, citrus-matcha aroma, adequate carbonation, mildly bitter matcha taste with citrus flavor, thin smooth body, long finish. Very interesting beer.
Draft at Khyber Pass. Dirty blonde pour with a lasting ring of foam. Huge and hop forward. Sticky citrus resins. Oranges. Bruised peaches. Varnish. High ABV not well hidden. Somewhat harsh and simple but pretty good.
Pint at Lizardville in Copley, Ohio. Light scent of citrus. Bright light pale yellow with white head. Taste light lemon. Leaning on light malt side. Easy to drink with light citrus fruit aftertaste. Very good. Very crushable. Cheers!
--Bottled, from Die Bierothek. -- Hazy orange colour, small head.Fruity nose with some spicy grass orange and paper. Mid sweet with light to medium body and clean mouthfeel. Spicy bread, some orange. Mid bitter finish.
Can, from the brewery. Pours hazy bright yellow-orange with foamy whitish head, citrus pineapple aroma, adequate carbonation., medium bitter citrus peel-pineapple taste, thin body, long bitter finish. Decent NEIPA.
16oz can pours a murky orange with a cap of white head.  Nose has both IPA and bock, soap and citrus, malt, yeast, soggy crackers.  Flavors follow.  Really blends the styles.  Off dry finish.  A clear blend.
Brewery draught, 9/20/22.
Turbid bronze-maize-orange juice.  Minimal head.
Mineral and light petrol with huge, freshly juiced, ripe oranges.  Raspberry notes and light honey and biscuit malts with no alcohol or flaw.
Soft and juicy, malty texture with plentiful citrus and honey-biscuit-like malt.  Lingering spice, perfume and lemon-orange with a pinch of bubble gum and heavy fruit ester.  Low bitterness, alcohol.  Meh, tastes like an overly yeast-forward EQ DIPA.  Pretty thick and with too much twangy melon/pine emerging on the finish as it warms.
Can from the brewery. 
Hazy orange, large white head. Loads of citrus oil, and zest, stone fruit juice. Medium bitter, zest, semi sweet, oily, full mouth feel. Dank finish.
Bottle from the brewery. Hazy yellow pour, with a large white head. Pungent, lactic nose, full of stone fruit, and sour apricots, and citrus zest. Funky, bright, crisp, and lively. Medium bitterness, and a medium to high tartness. Full of funky, fruity goodness.
Brewery draught, 9/20/22.
Clear amber.  Small, white head, low retention.
Spicy, sprucey nose with hints of honey and caramel. Clean and easygoing with no resin or booze or overabundance of specialty malt.
Perfumey spice, cherry and caramel and finally bread and pine.  I can definitely tell this was a thoughtfully made interpretation of a WCIPA but I still don't care for caramel, pine, perfume or breadiness in my IPAs.  Clean and well-done though.
Hoptropolis has a thick, off-white head and a slightly-hazy gold appearance, with some lacing. The aroma is of subdued piney hops and white bread crust. The flavor is of low bitterness, fruit, and white bread crust. Hoptropolis has a medium body and a mostly-dry finish. RJT
Aroma; roasted malts, barbeque, liquorice, wood, black syrup, whisky, prunes, black fudge, mocca coffee, black caramel fudge. Look; big orangeish beige head on pit black body. Taste; roasted malts, barbeque, liquorice, wood, black syrup, whisky, prunes, black fudge, mocca coffee, black caramel fudge, and finishes lingering roasted malted. Feel; good n dryish body and soft co². Overall; good moreish sipper. [from 33cl bottle, [email protected] FI for 7€50č].
Can, 7.8%. Hazy dark yellow with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop, citrus and stone fruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, citrus, stone fruit, medium sweet and a little bitter.
On Tap at Chorlton Brewing Company Limited, 69 North Western Street, Manchester 24/06/2017 Sour Fruity aroma. Small creamy head. Low carbonation. Mid brown red coloured fruity and slightly sour with a hint of sweetness on the palate. Crisp and slightly dry malt finish.
750ml Bottle - Golden with a foamy head. Lychees, passion fruit and hints of pine and grapefruit in the aroma. Hoppy and fairly bitter taste with grapefruit, pine, orange and some hop resins. Quite a dry finish.
Keg at The Colmore, Birmingham. Pours clear dark berry red with a slim white cap. Aroma: very light tartness, dark berries. The taste follows, any peppercorn note is very muted. Light body with light carbonation. Just your average fruity berry kettle sour.
Bottle pour at Arrogant Sour Festival, 2022. Cloudy orange with small white head. Nice funk and quote vinous, musty, grapes. Medium+ sourness. Soft texture. Quite interesting.
(Bottle) Reddish amber colour with frothy, tan head. Malty, hoppy nose with caramel, mango, orange peel, dried fruit, apricots, honey, resin and hints of peppercorns. Malty, hoppy taste with notes of mango, apricots, caramel, sponge cake, honey, orange peel, resin, some black pepper and a generous resiny bitterness in the finish. Almost full body, quite sweet. Rich and tasty, with a generous hop presence and lots of malt to balance. A bit warming. Very nice.
Aroma; spruces, herbs, hops, soap, spices, grain malts. Look; off white head on hazy dirty grumly amber body. Taste; spruces, herbs, leaves, tropucal notes, hops, soap, pepper, grain malts, and finishes sappy resiny. Feel; good body and normal co². Overall; strong neipa it was. [from a 44cl can
[email protected]]. . 
Draught @ the brewpub. Clear dark golden with a foamy large off-white head, faint malt aroma, bitter malty taste, thin body, long bitter finish. A lot of bitterness but not much flavor.
--Sample, thanks oh6gdx! -- Lightly hazy golden, small head. Aroma of pineapple and pink grapefruit. Mid sweet with light body and crisp, rounde mouthfeel. Corn flakes and pineapple, some apricot. Low bitterness.
Brewery draught, 9/20/22.
Heavily hazy, pale brass-golden.  Minimal head.
There's the Talus.  Coconut, perfume, light dank spice.  Honey like malts, fruity yeast, no resin, alcohol.
Soft and malty with an iodine-like smokiness from the hops.  Perfume, coconut, white pepper, curry.  Just wacky as shit.  Very succulent maltiness.  Low bitterness.
On tap at the Oktoberfest 2022. Standard golden colour, quite solid festbier, middle of the road but perfectly pleasant.
Aroma; chocolate malts, nuts, tart, liquorice, wood syrup, roasted malts. Look; tan head on dark brown body. Taste; chocolate malts, nuts, tart, liquorice, wood syrup, roasted malts, and finishes barky malted. Feel; good body and okay co². Overall; excellent brown ale. [from 33cl bottle, [email protected] FI for 4€50č].
Draft at the Source, 9/3/22.  Dark brown, creamy head.  Roast and toast.  Nutty.  A little sweet, nicely dry.  Packed with flavor and very drinkable with a nice, smooth feel.
On Tap at Track Brewing Company Limited, 5 Sheffield Street, Manchester 24/06/2017 Low carbonation. Roast aroma. Beige head. Mid brown coloured smooth and a little sweet on the palate with a vanilla flavour. A hint of dryness in a chocolaty roast malt finish.
Can. Pours cloudy lemon yellow with a small foamy off-white head, citrus peel aroma, adequate carbonation, medium bitter citrus zest taste, thin body, long citrusy finish. Refreshingly citrusy.
Bottle pour at Arrogant Sour Festival 2022. Hazy yellow with small white head. Juicy and refreshing. Apples and quince. Medium carbonation and body.
Brewery draught, 9/20/22.
Clear brass-gold. Very little, white head.
Malty with bread and light honey.  Basic pine and spicy mosaic without the scallion. Rather light. But clean with no booze/resin.
Centennial and mosaic work fine together with lots of spice and pine but no big bitterness.  Soft, maybe slightly mushy malt texture with fine attenuation.  Earthy, biscuity, lightly piney finish.
Very light lemon aroma, tons of carbonation and a foam head. Light sweet malt with slight lemongrass taste. Very fizzy mouthfeel with light lemon aftertaste.
Can from Biervana. Intense cloudy amber, offwhite lace. Fresh grassy, gooseberry, citrus, herbal aromatics. Medium full dry body, triple yeast lightly sticky fruitiness, fruit salad, certainly strong, but quite drinkable despite the fruit sirup notes.
Keg at The Colmore, Birmingham. Pours light hazed gold with a cream cap. Light NS notes of gooseberry & white grape, grassy. Towards dry. Light to moderate sweet & bitter. Medium body with soft carbonation. Nelson hops seem a bit tame nowadays. This was nice enough though.

Aroma; peaches, leaves, citrus, some malts. Look; off white one inch head on misty straw golden body. Taste; peaches, lemon, nectarines, tart, nut, malt, and finishes dryish. Feel; okay body and normal co². Overall; sour dryish it was. [33cl short bottle
[email protected]]. . 
Bottle pour at Arrogant Sour Festival 2022. Cloudy orange with small white head. Intensive fruit, juicy, vinous, somewhat lively carbonation. Medium sourness and body.
12 oz can from Athletic, via mail, 9/20/22.  Citrus and grain.  Caramel and wheat bread.  Slight buttery note to it.  Finish is slightly off and watery.  My least favorite of the Athletic beers I have tried thus far.
440ml can. Hazy, yellow-ish, bright golden colour with small to average, frothy to creamy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Citrusy fruity, hoppy and minimally earthy-grainy, pale malty aroma, hints of lemon, lemon juice. Taste is bitter, juicy, citrusy fruity hoppy, dry, pale malty and minimally earthy grainy basis without residual sweetness, notes of lemon, lemon juice.
Watery texture, dry palate, medium, prickly carbonation.
Quite dry, rather light bodied, a bit monotonous - OK.
Bottle pours at Arrogant Festival 2022. Cloudy golden with white head. Nice funk, somewhat juicy, stone fruit, grapes, musty. Medium sourness and body.
Short 0,33 l bottle from a mixed 6er, purchased at Bauernladen, Meran. Cloudy golden, one finger head in the glass. Fruity floweresque hoppy smell. Taste starts with a hop bitterness, more like a Pale Ale than a Blonde Ale. Dry pale grainy. Low carbonation. Nice but not a Blonde.
Cask Stillage at Mouselow Farm Brewery 4th Anniversary Celebrations, Dinting 24/06/2017 Floral hop aroma. Golden coloured hoppy and slightly citrus flavoured with a hint of dryness in a crisp lasting malt finish.
Keg at Sommar Bar, Birmingham. Pours pale straw yellow with a white cap. Aroma: grains, slight corn, grassy. Taste: moderate sweet & light bitter, grains, light bread, grassy finish. Light body with soft carbonation.
9.9.2022: From tap at Zürich Beer Festival, 8% ABV. Very hazy dark yellow color with a white head. The aroma is hoppy and fruity with lots of stone fruits, peach, citrus fruits and white grapes - not complex but nice smell. Medium body with a light to medium sweetness and a light bitterness. The flavor is hoppy and fruity with some fruity yeast esters, stone fruits, ripe citrus fruits, orange, blood orange, some mango and some white grapes. Finishes with a light residual sweetness and a light bitterness.

Aroma: 8
Appearance: 4 
Taste: 7
Palate: 4
Overall: 13
Aroma; hops, grass, herbs, tropical fruits, grain malts. Look; off white head head on hazy ochre orange body. Taste; hops, grass, herbs, tropical fruits, grain malts, and finishes sappy hopped. Feel; okay body and okay co². Overall; ipa it was. [from 33cl can, B @ Alko FI for 4€35č].
500ml Can - Golden with a very large head. Pepper, citrus and a hint of banana in the aroma. Spice, bubblegum, lemon peel, pepper and faint hints of ginger in the taste.
16 oz can shared by Brendan, 9/15/22.  Fully hazed.  Strong juicy aroma.  Rather sweet juice hop flavor.  Bit of bitterness to the close.  Pretty good.
# 3209; 9/2022. 
Aroma of biscuit and tropical fruits, citrus. Cloudy gold body; white head. Tropical fruits, citrus, biscuit, zesty. Well balanced golden ale. 0,5 l, bottle, shop, East Lyton (North England, UK).
9.9.2022: From tap at Zürich Beer Festival, 4.5% ABV. Straw yellow color with a white head. Th aroma is medium hoppy and lightly to medium malty with quiet some manure, rice, hay, rotting hay, grass, wet straw and some grains - distinct and pleasant smell. Medium body with a very light sweetness and a medium-light to medium bitterness. Finishes with a medium-light to medium hoppy bitterness, grains and rice. Flavor of grains, herbs, grass, bitter herbs and some rice. Distinct and unique character, however, I do not particularly like it.

Aroma: 6
Appearance: 4 
Taste: 7
Palate: 3
Overall: 11
Taster.  Pours a lightly translucent black with fizzy dark beige head that steadily dissipates into lacing.  Smells and tastes malty with notes of cocoa, dark fruit, oak, molasses, and coffee.  A little earthy as Brad described.  Mouthfeel is fill-bodied and moderately bitter & warming.  You can definitely notice the Dark Lord influence.  An enjoyable sipper.
Dark blond colour with thin head. Dry and woody notes come through well. Sweetish. Some vanilla, cognac. Nice dry finish.
Aroma; strawberries, lemon, nuts, bread. Look; pinkish white head on hazy rosé body. Taste; sour strawberries, leaves, lemon, almond, malt, and finishes fruity. Feel; okay body and normal co². Overall; okay sour. [33cl can
[email protected]].
Pours a hazy, orange juice color, with minimal head. Aroma is bright citrus and tropical fruit. Flavor follows. Moderately bitter, hoppy finish. Mouthfeel is soft, though maybe a bit on the thin side.
Cask Handpump at Mouselow Farm Brewery 4th Anniversary Celebrations, Dinting 24/06/2017 Fruit and hop aromas. White head. Golden coloured smooth on the palate floral and fruity with a hint of citrus flavour. A little dryness in a malt finish.
Bottle pour at Arrogant Sour Festival. Almost clear deep orange with quickly diminishing white head. Funky, musty, grapes, oak, white wine. Intensive sourness. Juicy.
Brewery draught, 9/20/22.
Heavily hazy, bronze-brass, little, white head.
Pineapple, coconut, spicy mosaic-like character, though not scalliony.  Sparse malt and heavily fruity yeast with no alcohol or resin.
Lots of malt depth and flavor for its size.  Unusual flavors with some mineral and light white wine from the Mo, but very strange spice, pineapple-coconut from the Talus.  Not sure I'm too crazy about Talus, though at least it's different/interesting.  Almost a touch of butter on the finish with bready, lightly honey-touched malts.  Low bitterness though lingering perfume and spice.
Light hazy golden with a white head - Herbal hop aroma - Malt body with a herbal hop flavour with bitterness - The herbal hop bitterness goes into a dry bitter finish - This was good
Keg at Beer Central Festival, Tea Works, Birmingham 17/09/2022. Pours very light hazed golden with a white cap. Aroma: grains, light fruity, yeasty, herbal, grassy. Taste: light to moderate sweet and light bitter, clean, light bready, grassy finish. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Not bad.
Aroma; caramel, cacao, dark syrup, mocca coffee, roasted malts. Look; tan head head on very dark brown body. Taste; caramel, cacao, dark syrup, vanilla, mocca coffee, dark bread roasted malts, and finishes sweet n malted. Feel; okay body and okay co². Overall; nice. [from 33cl bottle, B @ Alko FI for 4€70č].
Bottle. Color: Hazy red amber, very thin beige head. Aroma: Malty, caramel and Cognac notes, boozy hints. Taste: Malty, caramel, toffee hints, Sweetish, fruity (grape), bit spicy and boozy Cognac. Over medium to full body, low carbonation. Moderate to over moderate sweet, light going to moderate bitterness. Nice, but I keep thinking about the potential this barrel would have had on a nice Stout. A bit unbalanced now, the Red Ale is pushed away by the Cognac in my opinion.
Aroma; spruce, caramel, potato, herbs, resin, malts. Look; big dense fawn head on unclear amber body. Taste; thick strawy hops, caramel, herbs, grain,  malt, and finishes balanced with herbs n malts. Feel; okay body and normal co². Overall; tasty, flirts with india lager style.  [33cl bottle 
[email protected]].
16 oz can from BBP delivery, 9/20/22.  Hazy yellowish color with a white head.  Nice aroma of orange, lemon, mango, papaya, and grapefruit.  Flavor is similar, slightly thin, but still pretty good.  Good beer.
Cask Stillage at Mouselow Farm Brewery 4th AnniversaryCelebrations, Dinting 24/06/2017 Fruit and some roast aromas. Tiny beige head. Mid brown coloured fruity and smooth on the palate with a little citrus hop flavour. A hint of bitterness in the finish.
Can shared by Brendan, thanks, 9/15/22.  Hazy pour.  Citrus and tropical hops.  Fairly balanced leaning sweet.  Good beer.
Pours black with mahogany lasting, lacing foam head. Aroma is sweet toast and vanilla. Taste is vanilla, bitterness (mwah) chocolate and toast. Thick beer. (Velp 2209)
Aroma; citrus, grass, ananas, nectarines, hops, mild malts. Look; off white head head on opaque dark orange body. Taste; citric hops, peaches, ananas, grass, grain, pale malts, and finishes juicy hopped. Feel; okay body and okay co². Overall; another neipa. [from 33cl can, B @ Alko FI for 4€35č].
Don't know much about this beer - sample at festival - but it was terrific, and a wonderful representation of this style
Cask Handpump at Mouselow Farm Brewery 4th Anniversary Celebrations, Dinting 24/06/2017 Fruity aroma. Thick beige head. Dark brown coloured smooth on the palate and fruity with a hint of dryness in a lasting roast finish.
Pours clear black with mahogany foam head. aroma is hoppy, Taste nice bitter with some fruit tones. (Arnhem 2209)
sampled at beer festival.  Lovely Lavender Cream Ale - easy to drink, very tasty
Pours hazy golden with white foam head. Drink is too cold. Aroma is spicy, yeasty, malty. Taste grass, spicy and malt. Good. (Arnhem 2209)
Bottle pour at Beer Central Festival, Tea Works, Birmingham 17/09/2022. Pours black with a tan cap. Aroma: chocolate, praline, hazelnuts, sugar. The taste follows, more praline, chocolate, demerara. Smooth mouthfeel. Moderate to heavy sweet. Medium to full body with light carbonation. One for the sweet-toothed pastry boys



Pours clear yellow/orange with white lacing (leaving drinking rings) foam head. Aroma is malty, bit sweet. Taste is grassy, lemony, but mainly grassy. (Arnhem 2209)
16oz can pours a clear, burnt orange with some creamy white head.  Nose is old school, pithy, orange, soap, C hops.  Flavor is malty, oranges, soap.  Grist.  A touch stale now.  Finishes bitter.  Off dry.
Pours clear dark red brown with off-white foam head. Aroma is caramel and sweet raisins. Taste fruit, some bitterness. (Velp 2209)
Fläschla: Golden, hazy to cloudy, stable creamy (off-) white head - leaving rings on the glass, moderate honeyish and sweet-malty nose, delicate "rural" and fruity-hoppy traces included; moderate sweet and mildly bitter flavour, medium bodied and very soft; lingering - slightly drier - honeyish and herbal-hoppy finish. Archetypal Märzen, well balanced...
440ml can. Opalescent, yellow-ish golden colour with average, frothy, moderately lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Piney, grassy and citrusy fruity, slightly resinous, hoppy aroma, pale malty background, notes of pine, lemon, some grapefruit, a touch of pineapple with slight jelly bear aspects, herbal whiffs of lemon balm and woodruff. Taste is crisp, bitter hoppy, piney and slightly citrusy fruity, pale malty basis without residual sweetness, resinous notes of pine, some lemon, herbal-grassy overtones, low-key tropical fruity basic layer with a touch of passion fruit. 
Oily texture, smooth and soft, simultaneously dry and minimally greasy palate, fine, mildly prickly carbonation.
Clean and focussed - good.
Pours little hazy amber, white foam head. Aroma is hoppy and sweet. Taste is little spicy, sweet and bit bitter. (Velp 2209)
Pours opaque golden with small lacing white foam head. Aroma is malty bit of a banana aroma. Taste is spicy, creamy. Nice. (Arnhem 2209)
Pale blond colour with light haze. Grassy, dry hop bitterness is quite dominant. Really grainy too. Can also taste the Saison yeast. Quite bitter but to my taste.
Aroma: Coffee, vanilla, chocolate. Classic stout.

Appearance: Dark brown with good beige head.

Taste: Acidic with some bitterness. More on the dry side.

Palate: Watery, rather low carbonation.

Overall: Aroma is good, a proper stout, but the beer is watery and strangely sour.
440ml can. Hazy golden, white head. Aroma is citrusy, grapefruit, lemon, pine. Taste is much the same, very citrusy, grapefruit, lemon, quite piney/woody notes coming through, decent bitterness at the end. Really nice.
Pours black with big creamy foam head. Lacing & lasting - or I don't know how to pour a beer. Aroma is citrus and hoppy, taste is bitter. (Arnhem 2209)
Keg at Beer Central Festival, Tea Works, Brummy 17/09/2022. Pours clear pale gold with a wahite cap. Bright, clean, bread, biscuit, slight lemon, grassy finish. Light to medium body with average carbonation. Good one,
Can, 4.5%. Hazy yellow with medium white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop, little citrus and a little tropical fruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, citrus, little sweet, little dry and medium bitter.
(bottle 0,33l) Overall: Soft, light, refreshing. Ok Witbier.
 Aroma: Sweet, coriander, wheat malt.
 Appearance: Light hazy, pale yellow. Minimal, white head.
 Taste: Light sweet, light citrusy-sourish, coriander, wheat malt.
 Palate: Medium body. Dry, light bitter finish.
Vom Fass ( als Maibock (!), 6/8/2022 Landwinkl-Bräu, Siechenstraße, Bamberg): Deep Golden, a bit unclear, big firm and stable white head, moderate sweetish-bitter aroma of pale malt with a strong fruity and "woody" background, orangey-yeasty traces like in a belgian ale; moderate sweet-bitter flavour, medium bodied, soft; lingering sweet fruity and " woody " finish. Weird stuff...
37,5cl bottle from the brewery.
F: medium, white, quick gone.
C: gold, hazy.
A: citrus, funky, gooseberries, woody, brett touch.
T: medium malty base, citrus, brett touch, funky, rotten apples, woody, gooseberries, bit puckering but not so sour, medium carbonation, nice, enjoyed for sure.
16oz can. Poured a deeper amber color with a thin sized off white head. Thinner all the way around and somewhat watery ... some caramel and chocolates, but really blah.
16oz can. Poured a black color with a thin sized tan head. Toasted nuttiness, caramel, some dark fruits, and getting some tart berries in the finish. No where near 16% perceptible.
Hazy straw colour pour, lively, frothy head. Juicy fruit aroma, tropical pineapple and mango, a little thin however.
44cl can from Alko, Helsinki. Pours slightly hazy straw coloured with a moderate, white head. Mild hoppy and malty aroma with light citrus and hints of ripe fruits and grass. Moderate sweet with relatively low flavour intensity, but a pleasant bitterness.
Keg at the Cock Tavern - Hackney. Pours hazed gold with a creamy, white topping. Light-medium sweet flavour, pretty dank, nice pine, mango, citrus, cat pee, orange rind. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Dank finish, plump mango, papaya, tangerine, mellow piney bitterness. Loads of character for the ABV. Exceptional.
Keg @ The Boot, Wellington. Deep dark hazed purple appearance, good smooth blackcurrant profile to taste, juicy and a touch creamy with mild ribena moments.
(Keg at Juova, 20220920) The beer poured pale mahogny coloured and clear. Its head was medium sized, nearly white and it lasted long. Aroma had grass, caramel, toffee and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were grass, malts, caramel, toffee, toasted notes and bitterness. Aftertaste had toffee, malts and bitterness. A clean and tasty malty brew with good bitter finish.
16 oz. can. Pours a slightly hazy, amber color, with a medium, foamy, beige head. The aroma is brown bread, orange zest, cardamom, and hay. Sweet and malty, with a bracing, pleasant bitterness. Medium body, with a crisp, bready feel. Solid, enjoyable lager.
Cask @ The Boot, Wellington. Pours dark brown, thin off-cream head. Aroma brings chocolate and hazelnut with a distinctly nutella-like character to taste, smooth and full-bodied. Lovely stuff.
Warwickshire Duck Soup 4.2%. Chestnut brown, coffee and dark malt aroma, medium bodied, dark malt, chocolate, coffee, treacle, spices. Lovely Best from Cubbington, Warwickshire 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿
Purple 2$ can from Giant in Lanctaster PA. Smells like sweet perfume hops. First taste is terribly on style IPA; you know, super bitter hops IPA bastardized beer. Pour is big white head on a pale hazy beer, of course, perfect for its name. It even has an almost milque-shake attitude on the eye. Just a little co2 on the palate to cover up and distract from some of its extreme rudeness. Quite difficult to enjoy, one sided like most IPA. Nasty nellie negativity-o-gram. Yea, its fricken happy BS like any other IPA. So many out there and they all practically taste the same, but at least some smell like BO and some others smell like diesel, heheeh.
Bottle online from Beers Of Europe. 
Pours a deep ruby colour with a medium sized creamy beige head. Aromas of dark fruits, berries, caramel, nuts and toasted malts. Taste has more of the same notes from the aroma, caramel, red fruits, berries and nuts. Malty with a roasty, toasty and earthy bitterness on the finish. Medium to full body, hardly any carbonation and very smooth mouthfeel. Really liking this beer. Excellent.
Cask at the Cock Tavern - Hackney. Pours crystal clear honey-gold with a slight, foamy white head. Lightly sweet, pleasant citrusy notes, tangerine, white grape, mild pale bread, subtle bitter rind. Light bodied with fine carbonation; decent condition.  Alan Ed finish, more citrus fruits. Tasty one.
12oz bottle. Poured a black color with a smaller sized tan head. Chocolate, roasted coffee, vanilla, bourbon, and nice and warming.
Pours dark brown with a moderate head. The flavour is strong. Sweet, red fruits, rich dark chocolate and toffee flavours, vanilla, biscuit, coffee, mild spiced notes. Finishes with strong dark, roasted malts and chocolate, with a mild sourness at the end. More bitter than most ruby ales I've tried, but it balances the sweetness well. Very carbonated, light bodied.
Pours dark amber, not quite 'ruby', with a small head. Toffee malts, dark fruits/berries, slightly sour, and brown bread notes. Finishes with dried fruit more bread. Oily, sickly texture, fairly high carbonation, full-bodied. It's a downgrade from the old Purple Panther. Just like Aldi downgraded their Ruby Red ale too.
Can from the Beer Cave. 
Appearance - murky yellow to orange with  a creamy white head. 
Nose - grass, orange and mango skin. 
Taste - creamy mango and melon. Still lightly grassy resin, but not too intrusive. 
Palate - medium bodied, creamy middle and balanced bitterness on the finish. 
Overall - quite good.
33cl bottle from the brewery.
F: big, tan, good retention.
C: brown, hazy.
A: malty, caramel, bready, bit nutty, dried fruits touch.
T: medium malty base, light bready, bit caramel, dried fruits, herbal touch, medium carbonation, bit watery yet ok for the style, enjoyed.
9.9.2022: From tap at Zürich Beer Festival, 6% ABV. Nearly clear light golden color with a white head. The aroma is hoppy, resinous and dank - sweet resin, pine, grapefruit, sweet grapefruit, stone fruits, nectarines, vineyard peaches. Medium body with a light sweetness and a medium-light to medium bitterness. The flavor is hoppy with resin, lightly sweet resin, grapefruit, stone fruits, some bready malt, hints of caramel and lemon. Becomes more bitter towards finish. Finishes dry with a medium hoppy bitterness.

Aroma: 7
Appearance: 4 
Taste: 8
Palate: 4
Overall: 14
Tight white head on a well carbonated golden coloured body.
Grain, cereal & malt aroma.
Medium bodied, sharp with a smoother finish.
Malt, cereals, biscuit & bready tastes with a lightly hopped fruity finish.
And this completes all 124 RB beer styles for me.
16oz can. Poured a black color with a medium sized tan head. Chocolate, vanilla, some bourbon, wood, and roasted coffee
Bottle. Color: Slightly hazy red copper, beige head. Aroma: Sweetish, rye, caramel, vinous hints. Taste: Sweetish, caramel, toffee, spicy rye notes, wood, subtle red wine notes, hints of vanilla. Over moderate sweet, moderate bitterness. Just over medium body, just under average carbonation. Bit boozy. Dry. Bit sticky. Ok, but I was hoping for some more BA effects.
9.9.2022: From tap at Zürich Beer Festival, 5% ABV. Lightly hazy straw yellow color with a white head. The aroma is medium hoppy with earthy and spicy hop notes, grains, hay, grass, rice and cooked rice. Medium body with a light sweetness and a light to medium-light bitterness. Flavor of grains, some cereals, hints of cardboard, earthy and light spicy hop notes and hints of bread. Finishes with a medium-light to medium hop bitterness.

Aroma: 6
Appearance: 4 
Taste: 7
Palate: 4
Overall: 12
0.33 l bottle from 'Bierothek', best before May 2023. Almost clear, orangeish amber with a medium large, frothy, stable, white head. Sweetish, quite fruity, moderately resiny aroma of orange jam, mango, tangerine and traces of pine. Quite sweet, malty, moderately bitter, rather fruity and a little resiny taste of orange jam, mango, tangerine and light pine, followed by a short, gently bitter finish. Medium to full body, smooth and slightly creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation. Nice DIPA as always, nothing earth-shaking but ticks all the boxes. Probably the best version so far.
Keg pour at Halton & Turner Taproom in Brum on 17/09/2022 poured by the vevet jacketed maestro himself. Lots going on here. Chocolate, sour orange, vinous, funky. Lots of brett. Light to medium body with light carbonation. Dry tangy finish. A really interesting flavour journey
Cask at the Cock Tavern - Hackney. Pours black with a bubbly tan head. Lightly sweet with sturdy roast, bitter ash, some baking cocoa, a faint rubbery note, earth, old raisins. Light bodied with fine carbonation; decent condition. Bittersweet finish, further ashy roast. Toothy. Not bad.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy golden color with a medium sized head. Citrus, juicy, melons and fruity.
9.9.2022: From tap at Zürich Beer Festival, 12% ABV. Very dark mahogany color with a tan colored head. The aroma is lightly peaty with medicinal peat, sweet spirit notes, some rum, spicy and medicinal whisky, fruity spirit, pear, light metallic notes, cocoa and chocolate. Full body with a medium sweetness and a light to medium roasty bitterness. Flavor of roasted malt, chocolate, cocoa, some fruity yeast notes, hints of pear, fruity spirit notes, raisins, dates, mild smoke, mild peat, mild medicinal notes, some caramel and some nuts. Finishes with a light residual sweetness, a light to medium roasty bitterness, light barrel notes and some smoke.

Aroma: 8

Taster at the brewery. Pours an unclear, brown color, with a small, beige head. The aroma is brown bread, honey, almond, coriander, and rye. Sweet and malty, with a mild, crisp bitterness. Medium to heavy body, syrupy, and grainy. Solid, balanced brown.
Cask at the Cock Tavern - Hackney. Pours clear honey-gold with a frothy, mostly white head. Light to medium sweet with nice bready pale malts, a little British yeast, crust, light pale grains, dirty hay, citrus hints. Light bodied with fine carbonation; good condition. Clean, balanced finish.
Weekend Lager has a thick, spongy head and a cloudy (even more so, after the "swish & pour"), bubbly, gold appearance, with some lacing. The aroma is of faint biscuit malt. The flavor is of cracker, hop spice, some bitterness, and some grass. Weekend Lager has a medium body and a dry finish. RJT

Taster at the brewery. Pours a murky, orange color, with a small, off-white head. The aroma is grass, walnut, pine sap, and light grapefruit. Sweet and sugary, with a sticky, clingy bitterness. Medium body. Fun, bold, and pretty tasty.
Cask handpull at the Adelphi.  Slightly hazy pale yellow color, dense white head. Light lemon aroma. Taste is light black pepper and mixed citrus, lightly bitter peppery finish. Refreshing
9.9.2022: From tap at Zürich Beer Festival, 6% ABV. Hazy dark yellow color with a white head. The aroma is hoppy and dank with sweet onions, blueberry, melon, white grapes, tangerine, mango, bubble gum and some underlying notes of biscuity malt. Medium pillowy body with a light to medium sweetness and a light hoppy bitterness. The flavor is hoppy and fruity with some fruity yeast esters, overripe tangerine, overripe orange, some grapefruit, some mango, biscuity malt and some peach.

Aroma: 8
Appearance: 4

33cl bottle from the brewery.
F: medium, white, average retention.
C: blonde, hazy.
A: malty, wheat, banana, floral, spicy.
T: medium malty/wheat base, banana, bit herbal, spicy, citrus touch, floral, medium carbonation, bit more yeasty but ok, enjoyed.
Half pour at the brewery. Pours an opaque, yellow color, with a small, white head. The aroma is peach, grapefruit, lavender, cut grass, a bit of oak, and vanilla. Sweet and citrusy, with a big, sticky bitterness. Medium body, a bit acidic, and juicy. Solid, interesting hazy IPA.
500ml bottle. Poured a black with brown edges and a smaller sized light brown head. Strawberry & chocolate stronger than the vanilla, with some roasted coffee.
(Keg at Juova, 20220920) The beer amber and cloudy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had tangerine, passion fruit and pine. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were pine, passion fruit, spiciness, ripe fruits, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was fruity, spicy and bitter. A tasty hoppy brew with piny and spicy notes.
Can online from Cork & Cask, Edinburgh. Pours opaque yeelow orange with a white cap. Aroma: lime, orange, bread. Taste: sharp citrus,  lime, grapefruit, zesty, tangy. Medium body with fine carbonation. 
.
9.9.2022: From tap at Zürich Beer Festival, 6.2% ABV. Hazy dark yellow color with a white head. Aroma of bubble gum, overripe tangerine, sweet wheat, sweet pear and hints of manure. Medium body with a light to medium-light sweetness and a light bitterness. The flavor is medium hoppy with citrus fruits, grapefruit, some tangerines, wheat and bitter herbs. Finishes with a light to medium-light hop bitterness.

33cl bottle. A hazy orange golden beer with a off white head. Aroma of caramelized malt, bread, mild sourness. Taste of caramelized malt, grains, bread, mild bitterness.
Can from Athletic, via mail order, 9/19/22.  Clear gold, foamy head.  Mint, melon, and lime.  Flavorful stuff.  On the sweet side, but the mint keeps it from being too sweet.  None of the NA wateriness.  Impressive.  One of the best NA beers I've ever had.
Taster at the brewery. Pours a clear, straw color, with a medium, foamy, white head. The aroma is lavender, green banana, hay, resin, and rose. Sweet and malty, with a light, dank bitterness. Light and sticky. Fair.
Taster at the brewery. Pours a clear, bronze color, with a small, off-white head. The aroma is toffee, pumpernickel, raw grains, pecan, and spruce. Sweet and sugary, with an off, abrasive bitterness. Light to medium body, smooth, and clean. Reasonable.
33cl can. A hazy yellow golden beer with a white head. Aroma of pale malt, straw, some fruity hops. Taste of mild sweet fruity hops, citrus, pale malt.
Can from the Beer Cave. 
Appearance - murky yellow to orange. Big creamy white head. 
Nose - big mango and pineapple notes. Light grassy resin 
Taste - again resinous but ripe melon and orange coming through nicely. 
Palate - creamy in texture and close to medium bodied. Lightly bitter finish.
Overall - pretty good.
33cl can. A clear yellow golden beer with a white head. Aroma of mild grassy and spicy hops, pale malt. Taste of pale malt, spicy hops, moderate to long bitter finish.
33cl can. A hazy golden beer with a white head. Aroma of mild grassy hops, citrus, some wheat. Taste of mild juicy hops, grassy hops, citrus.
44cl can. A murky golden beer with a white head. Aroma of juicy hops, orange fruits, tangerine, wheat. Taste of sweet juicy hops, orange fruits, tangerine, apricot.
Smell of caramel, dark bread. Bronze colour, beige head. Aroma of plum, burnt sugar, generic fruity sweetness. Wild carbon. Sweet. Light body.
44cl can. A murky yellow golden beer with a white. Aroma of juicy hops, mango, pineapple, citra. Taste of juicy hops, wheat malt, yeast, citrusy hops, mango.
16 oz can from BBP, 9/20/22.  Fully hazed yellowish color with a nice white head on top.  Aroma of pineapple, peach, lemon, lime, grapefruit, melon, and a little pine. Lots going on here, but I like the mix.  Not too sweet.  Very drinkable.  Bitterness is fairly low here.  Pretty good overall, and I love the description - we had a little bit of a bunch of hops, none of them enough for a beer by themselves, so we threw them all into this beer and Voilà!
0.33 l bottle from 'Bierothek', 6.5% abv, best before June 2023. Hazy, golden amber with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, white head. Gently sweet, quite yeasty, gently spicy and slightly fruity-floral taste of banana, clove, coriander, nutmeg, some grains and light lemon peel. Gently sweet, moderately bitter, fairly yeasty, gently fruity and a little fruity-floral taste of banana, clove, nutmeg, coriander, some grains and hints of lemon peel, followed by a short, moderately bitter, gently dry finish. Medium body, gently effervescent mouthfeel, average to lively carbonation. Very solid Belgian Ale, somewhere between a Blond and a Witbier, typically yeasty, no gimmicks.
500ml Bottle - Golden with haze and a fairly foamy head. Grain, bread and some slightly floral notes in the aroma. Floral hops, bread, citrus and some hints of aniseed in the taste.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy golden color with an averaged sized head. Dank citrus, fruity, tropical, and some floral notes.
Very good. A nice clean pour, look and feel all around nice and malty with a bit of nuttiness and caramel. No bitterness but smooth with a creamy head. Great session
Bottle. Color: Slightly hazy golden, white head. Aroma:  Tart, fruity notes, hoppy and funky. Taste: Moderate to over moderate tart, fruity notes of citrus and gooseberry. Some green apple, hay, horse blanket wild yeast funk. Combined with a nice amount of hop and light to moderate bitterness. Dry-ish mouthfeel. Medium body, just below average carbonation. Very nice until some subtle metallic-like notes come in at the finish. Still nice overall.
Can at Proving Ground, 9/16/22.  Sweet blueberry and apple, pomegranate is subtle.  Decent overall.
Tap at Slunce ve Skle. Hazy yellow body, white head. Tropical aroma, big watermelon, some citric notes. Beautifully citric and tropical taste, lean, nice, fresh, simply a very, very good NEIPA - I mean, would've been glad to try Nectar in this form and this boosted version doesn't detract any. Great job Zichovec!
.5l pours a murky yellow, lacey white head.  Nice nose, soft, melon, tropicals, floral, mild lactose.  Flavor is melon and pineapple curd and passion fruit.  Easy finish, lightly creamy.
Tap at Slunce ve Skle. Paaaale golden body. Malty, very lightly citric aroma. Light citrusy notes in the taste however, some hoppy notes - wild herbs. Clean, interesting and boring at the same time. Eh, okay.
16oz can. Poured a murky golden / yellow color with a medium sized head. Citrus, tropical fruits, juicy, creamy and sweetness hides the alcohol.
Can from AE, 9/19/22.  Canned 9/13/22.  Hazy yellowish color, white head.  Juicy aroma of peach, melon, white grape, pineapple, and papaya.  Drinks on the sweet side, decent, lighter bitterness to the finish.  Lots of flavor.  Smooth feel.  Nice beer.  

Tap at Slunce ve Skle. Golden body, white head. Sweetish aroma, cleanly malty, somewhat citric. Sweetish malty taste, clean maltiness, citric notes, lean, light herbal touches. Okay beer overall.
(Keg at Juova, 20220920) The beer poured pale amber and cloudy. Its head was small and white. Aroma had grapefruit, spiciness and peach. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were grapefruit, spiciness, ripe fruits, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was fruity, malty, spicy and bitter. A delicious fruity brew with nice malty notes and good bitter finish.
330ml Bottle - Golden with a foamy head. Malty and slightly floral aroma with hints of honey and citrus. Moderately bitter taste with notes of citrus, floral hops, grain and honey. Slight sweetness in the finish.
Can from Craftbeersdelivered.com. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt and moderate hoppy - pine. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 200922
Tap at Slunce ve Skle. Golden body, white head. Dry malty, slightly bready aroma, very light DMS perhaps. Malty, dry taste, light herbal notes. Quite okay overall. Doesn't thrill, but does its job fine.
Beer without big claims, one of the lightest bodies an IPA can offer, good for the thirsty and who does not appreciate the full blown IPA character.
Keg at BrewDog Canary Wharf - London. Pours unclear orange-good with a fleeting, white cream head. Light-medium sweet flavour with pleasant tart and fleshy mango, peach, lemon, low acidity, pear. Medium bodied with spritzy carbonation. Pretty clean to finish, jammy tropical fruits, citric bite. Tasty and drinkable.
Bottle purchased at RHS Wisley. Pours a golden amber colour with a thin white head. Floral aroma with notes of lemon peel. The taste is orange and lemon peel with hints of grapefruit. Very nice, gentle malt flavour. Subtle and really tasty. Natural carbonation and pleasant mouthfeel. A nice bitter with an extra bit of tang from American hops.
Bottle online from Beers Of Europe. 
Pours an almost clear light golden colour with a medium sized foamy white head. Aromas of citrus, floral and white bread. Taste is again bready with more notes of citrus lemon and floral. Light herbal notes, peppery spice with more citrus pith on the hoppy finish. Thin to medium body, low carbonation and smooth oily mouthfeel. Very decent thirst quenching beer with good flavour for the low abv.
On Tap at Station Buffet, Stalybridge 24/06/2017 Massive fruit and hop aromas. Low carbonation. Golden coloured cloudy in appearance and very hoppy with mango and citrus flavours. Strong in alcohol with a hint of bitterness in a pine and malt finish.
Draft at Proving Ground, 9/16/22.  Hazy yellowish color, white head.  Peach, citrus, and a grass.  On the sweet side.  Drinks decently enough.  Solid beer.
440ml can from Vine and Grain, Beverley. Clear deep amber appearance, good off-white head. Typical trad brewery can offering. Assumed it to be an IPA with 'double hopped' on the label but it's not. Old school in every regard. Caramel malt, oily, bitter close. Ok overall.
Fruity flavors are well blended together.  Very smooth.  For a supermarket beer this is fine.  Alcohol is well hidden.
440ml can from We Brought Beer, Tooting.  Hazy yellow.  Aroma of peach, melon and citrus.  Quite a nice, zingy fruity flavour, like cooked peach.  Nice fruity linger.
Can from Tidens Farver @ Home. Pours hazy yellow with a white head, lacings. Aorma of malt, rich fruity hops, tropical fruit, citrus. Flavor is sweet light bitter, malt, fruity hops, tropical fruit, mango, citrus, some alcohol. Medium body, average carbonation, sweet light bitter finish. 200922
Cask Handpump at Penny Black, Northwich 09/06/2017 Floral aroma. Small white head. Golden coloured hoppy and fruity with hints of dryness and bitterness in a malt finish.
Quite nice for the no abv. Slightly bittered, ipa-like, but balanced by a nice round relatively full body. Albert heijn ams
