12 oz can from Total Wine and More in Short Pump, VA  The ale poured a clear light gold color with a white foamy head and lacing.  The aroma of citrus and pineapple greets you.  For a hazy IPA this can is very clear!  The taste had more hints of citrus with pine resin and pineapple.  The ale has a medium body with average-soft carbonation. Nicely done!

Cask Handpump at Penny Black, Northwich 09/06/2017 Big hop aroma. Tiny white head. Light golden coloured hazy in appearance and hoppy with grapefruit and olive flavours. A hint of bitterness in a slightly dry lasting hop finish.
Cask Handpump at Penny Black, Northwich 09/06/2017 Fruit and hop aromas. Small white head. Clear golden coloured hoppy pale and citrus flavoured with a hint of dryness in a crisp and slightly creamy malt finish.
33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 29.06.2023

Lots of foam when pouring. Aroma has licorice, ash, mild sourness. Flavour has ash, some tobacco, licorice and pot coffee. Ashy finish. Palate is a bit too high on CO2. The CO2 amount and taste do tell me that something is not right here.
[email protected], Copenhagen (20/09/2022) - pours black with a ringed thin beige dissipating head. Dark sweet and roasted malty, rich opulent chocolate, sweet maple and caramel, full bodied, layers of bourbon, vanilla and coconut into the warming malty finish. Gorgeous.
[email protected], Copenhagen (20/09/2022) - black with a beige head. Sweet dark malty with sweet maple, caramel, chocolate, medium plus body, not sure what it is but rather too sweet and slightly unbalanced on the maple for me. Expected more.
[email protected], Copenhagen (20/09/2022) - black with a beige head. Dark sweet malty with lots of chocolate and nice sweet strawberry, dark berry fruity, full body, dark sweet vanilla and strawberry laced malty finish.
Black with a frothy, dirty beige head. Aroma a mix of coffee and coffee grounds with the faintest hint of chocolate underneath. Taste is bitter and heavy on the coffee. A hint of sourness at the finish. Finishes the same with lingering coffee grounds. Medium to full-bodied, moderate to mild carbonation. A bit of a one-trick pony named java.
330ml bottle. Very clear gold with a good frothy white head. Aroma is a little hard to pin down.. buttery rotting veg perhaps? Taste brings assorted bittery flavours, none veering into the fruity spectrum unfortunately.. mixed veg, malt and again that exceptionally bitter side coming in boldly on the finish. I expect this will be tweaked somewhat in future batches.
bottle, with many thanks to kappldav123! Golden with a small head. Malty, fragrant fruity hoppy hints with some apricot and peach.
bottle, with many thanks to kappldav123! Hazy amber brown with a small off-white head. Smoky nose. Full-bodied, malty with a pleasant sweetness supporting the smoky flavours, shy yeasty fruity background.
bottle, with many thanks to kappldav123! Golden with a mid-sized head. Malty start, citrusy hops with shy honey hints, resulting in a bitter-sweet character.
Can from Tidens Farver @ Home. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of light malt, rich fruity hops, a touch herbal, little mint, tropical fruit, citrus. Flavor is light bitter, light malt, fruit, little herbal, hint of mint, tropical fruit, citrus. Medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish. 200922
bottle, with many thanks to kappldav123! Golden with a small white head. Hoppy nose with citrus hints. Malty start, citreusy and orangey hops with very shy tropcial fuits.
bottle, with many thanks to kappldav123! Goden with a small white head. Malty with citrusy hops and pleasantly dry hoppy finish.
bottle, with many thanks to kappldav123! Golden with mid-sized head. Malty start, slightly grainy, with perfumy lemony hints.
Pours a lightly hazed amber colour with a small frothy off-white head that settled. The aroma is malty, caramel with some light fruit and spicy hop notes. A moderately sweet malty taste, cereal grain,  malt and caramel flavours with some fruit and  a medium-light bitterness.
bottle, with many thanks to kappldav123! Golden with a mid-sized whiote head. Malty start, grassy and herbal hoppy flavours, smooth on the palate, with a shy fruity finish.
Cask Handpump at Penny Black, Northwich 09/06/2017 Fruit hop aroma. White head. Clear golden coloured floral and hoppy with a citrus lemon flavour. A hint of dryness in a crisp and creamy finish.
bottle from local ZG Raiffeisen. Deep golden brown with a tall off-white head. Full-bodied, malty, slightly grainy with a pleasant sweetness, some dried fruit, raisins, prunes and earthy hops in the warming finish.
bottle from a mixed multipack. Deep golden colour, tall white head. Solid malty background supporting the intense hops, citrusy, resiny with some tropcial fruit.
bottle. Hazy golden with tall head. Malty start, slightly grainy, with citrusy hops in the lingering finish.
bottle. Golden colour, tall head. Intense hop aroma with tropcial and citrus fruit. Full-bodied, grainy malty base, citrusy hops with resiny hints and shy hints of mango.
bottle, donated by a friend. Golden yellow, tall white head. Malty start, pleasant citrusy hops throghout, with a nice bitter hoppy punch in the finish.
On Tap at Salty Dog, Northwich 09/06/2017 Floral hop aroma. Low carbonation. Clear golden coloured smooth on the palate hoppy and floral with a zesty citrus flavour. A hint of dryness in the finish.
(Keg at Juova, 20220920) The beer poured golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had pine, resin, ripe fruits, and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were pine, resin, grass, ripe fruits, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy and bitter. A tasty hoppy and balanced hoppy brew with good bitter finish.
[email protected], Copenhagen (20/09/2022) - opaque yellow with a white head. Juicy fruity with bright vibrant notes of white grape and gooseberry, red grapefruit, peach and mango notes, sweet creamy malts, nice mouthfeel and body, piney balanced light bitter hoppy close. Very nice.
16 oz can from Total Wine and More in Short Pump, VA  the ale poured a hazy-murky light amber with a white foamy head and lacing.  The aroma of citrus and tropical fruit greets you. Nicely balanced NEIPA.  the taste explodes with pineapple and oranges.  Moderate to light hop bitterness. The ale has a medium body and soft carbonation.


Pale gold with a frothy white head. A mix of citrus, apricots, and lemon peel. Moderate bitterness throughout. Body to the light side of medium, moderate watery texture. Lingering resin. Ok.
On Tap at Salty Dog, Northwich 09/06/2017 Medium carbonation. Small creamy head. Dark coloured and a little rich on the palate with fruit and treacle flavours. A hint of dryness in a liquorice and yeasty malt finish.
[email protected], Copenhagen (20/09/2022) - hazed up yellow with a white head. Medium sweet fruity and malty with lots of citrus and exotic fruit in play, getting some cantaloupe and tangelo, grapefruit, malty backing, piney light bitter hoppy close. Tasty gear.
Can tasted
Cloudy amber with a little white head.
Caramel and fudge to the nose
Caramel malts with somo chocolate and citrus hops notes.

Medium bodied with medium carbonation with roasty finish.  Lean aftertaste
Bottle. Cloudy golden, white lacing foam. Perfumed, flowery, light resiny hop aroma. Medium body, straight, sparkly. Dry on the front of the palates, mango nectar middle, quick citrus, apricot finish. Mineral and resin aftertste.
Nice strong smell of cinnamon and fallness lol taste is smooth, malty, perfectly bold flavor without being too much....mouthfeel just a bit empty... Cereally with light hops.... Good... Had at home with Liz after I took off of work after the bills-titans game (41-7) last night at B's
A fantastic lager, a little stronger and fresher than a Yuengling.  Beautiful color and goes down smooth.
Half pint on cask at the Hallcross.  
Mediubncreamy white head.  Clear golden pour.  Light citrus bitterness.
Third of a pint on cask at the Doncaster brewpub.
Medium creamy beige head.  Clear  almost black pour.  Lots of coffee and chocolate.
Had on draft at the brewery. Pours a clear amber copper color with a reasonable head of amber tinged foam.Aroma is malty. Medium light mouthfeel, flavor is malty with a very nice dry ish finish. Fantastic session beer. One of the best session beers I’ve had the privilege of drinking,
Cask Handpump at Salty Dog, Northwich 09/06/2017 Fruity hop aroma. Creamy head. Dark coloured a little rich on the palate fruity and hoppy with an orange flavour. A hint of dryness in a slight roast finish.
Don't judge the book by its cover.  The lemon grass may sound a little off-putting but this is a fantastic, unique flavor.   Maybe similar to Helles?  Very smooth and refreshing, I was pleasantly surprised by this fantastic beer
330ml bottle brewed in Belgium at 8.5%. Opaque ruddy conker-brown with a neat, good-duration head. Light baking spice, clove and cinnamon, separated by a herbal tinge and banana hint from mellow toffee and chocolate malts. Moderate carbonation, solid yet refreshing body. Initial sprightly chocolate and banoffee, with some juicy red fruit - redcurrant and perhaps red cherry. Hints of chocolate, banana and hedgerow in the aftertaste. Hints - the barest hints - of clove and cinnamon arrive with warmth. Dupont curtails the sweetness well in a finish whose bitterness itself is understated. A little focussed, perhaps; a little short on the palate, maybe - possibly even too airy and mellow for those seeking a truly opulent Dubbel. But boy is it good to drink, remarkably refreshing, with not a sign of that 8.5% ABV.
Above average Saison with an earthy and peppery note. Crisp hops presence. Light.
Can from the brewery. Murky yellow color with medium off-white head. Aroma has caramel, yeast, citrus and grass. Taste is fruity with long quite bitter and a bit sweet aftertaste. Flavors of grapefruit, grass, caramel and malt.
Had the brewpub. Good coffee aroma with a grain and cereal flavor followed by roasted malt and bean.
Golden colour with thin head. Some touches of caramel malts. Also bitter citrus pith. Some orange and a bit of caramelised pineapple.
Cask Handpump at Park Tavern, Macclesfield 06/06/2017 Spicy aroma. White head. Clear golden coloured smooth on the palate and hoppy with a ginger flavour. Crisp and slightly dry in the finish.
Good simple Pilsner true to the style. Pale malt with a slight cereal sweetness. Light.
Cask at 73 Enid Street, 16/09/22.
Almost clear golden with a well presented lasting just off white head.
Nose is soft malts, light grass, tangerine, melon, papaya.
Taste comprises orange zest, corn bread, melon, soft malts, papaya, tangerine.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, semi drying close splashed with mellow hop bitterness.
Decent enough cask pale if a touch pedestrian in places.
At the brewpub. Good hoppy and earthy nose. Some funk and fruit esters. Balanced.
Cask Handpump at Snow Goose Cafe Bar, Macclesfield 06/06/2017 Fruit hop aroma. Tiny white head. Golden coloured and fruity with a blackcurrant flavour. A hint of bitterness in a crisp malt finish. As Storm Dexter.
Solid session IPA with balanced bitterness. Light body and golden. Simple but has enough complexity.
Keg at Craft Beer Junction, Bermondsey, 16/09/22. Hazed golden yellow with an off white cap that dissipates to a swirl. Nose is bitter citric flesh, grass, ripe melon, papaya. Taste comprises tangerine, ripe melon, grass, light pine dusting. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close splashed with balanced juicy come grassy hop bitterness. Decent enough sessionable pale.
Keg at Craft Beer Junction, Bermondsey, 16/09/22. Hazed golden yellow with an off white cap that dissipates to a swirl. Nose is bitter citric flesh, grass, ripe melon, papaya. Taste comprises tangerine, ripe melon, grass, light pine dusting. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close splashed with balanced juicy come grassy hop bitterness. Decent enough sessionable pale.
A 500ml bottle with no clear bottled on or best before date. Poured into a 3 Fonteinen gueuze glass. It was a clear golden orange colour with a one finger white head that dissipated fairly quickly to a nice fluffy cap while leaving some nice lacing. Aromas funky, musty, damp wood, oak, vanilla, with notes of orange, and citrus zest. Tastes lightly sour, tart, apricot, orange, funky, musty, damp wood, oak, with light citrus zesty sweetness. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall it was enjoyable while being oak and funk forward.
Good balanced IPA with a big odor and piney notes. Some honey sweetness. Medium weight.
Another solid IPA with a nice alcohol balance. Citrus and grapefruit notes. Slightly sweet.
Keg at Craft Beer Junction, Bermondsey, 16/09/22. Hazed golden yellow with an off white head that thins to a swirl. Nose is grass, pine needle, dank nip, orange pith, ripe melon, light hop spice. Taste comprises tangerine, ripe melon, grass, airy malts, hint of grapefruit, pine needle. Medium bodied, fine carbonation,  drying close spiked with juicy come grassy hop bitterness with a light dank edge. Tidy.
Solid IPA. Good dank and juicy aroma. Tropical and pine notes. Medium weight.
Cask Handpump at Treacle Tap, Macclesfield 06/06/2017 Hoppy aroma. White head. Clear golden coloured smooth on the palate hoppy and citrus flavoured with some alcohol present. A hint of bitterness in a crisp and dry malt finish. ABV 5.0%
Cask Handpump at Treacle Tap, Macclesfield 06/06/2017 Big hop aroma. White head. Golden coloured hazy in appearance and very hoppy with citrus and grapefruit flavours. Hints of dryness and toasted malt in a crisp and slightly pale finish.
Bottle, 6.5%. Good refreshing yeasty and fruity aroma. Cloudy copper colour. Big stable rocky white head. The flavour is also fruity and yeasty. Low to medium bitterness.  Quite high carbonation.
Keg at Craft Beer Junction, Bermondsey, 16/09/22. Hazed golden orange with an off white cap that veers to a swirl. Nose is bitter orange, grass, light dank chimes, pine needle, hint of weed, melon. Taste comprises orange pith, ripe melon, floral notes, lychee, grass, grapefruit. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close spiked with balanced juicy hop bitterness. Good stuff.
Polish pastry stout, tasted from tap at Barboteur in Schaarbeek (Brussels).  Creamy, yellowish beige, membrane-like lacing, dense head, black robe with hazy burgundy edges.  Aroma of Suzy waffles, Pim’s cakes, chocolate liqueur, latté macchiato, caramel sauce, hazelnut cream, boudoir cookies, touch of soy sauce.  Very sweet onset but somehow not overly cloying either, candied dates under a thin layer of teriyaki, soft carb, very full and oily body; thickly toffeeish, chocolatey and hazelnutty backbone with obvious lactose sweetness, slick and smooth, adding retronasal aroma’s of Pim’s cakes and chocolate truffles with a solid layer of biscuit underneath, before shifting to warming, rum-like booze, a tad coconutty even.  Some spicy effects pass by but very mildly so; chocolate liqueur, rum and caramel linger.  Very well-designed pastry stout, not too hard to pour down – in other words, maintaining a fair amount of drinkability in a style not known for being very drinkable, to say the least.  Well-made for sure – though I still prefer an old school, roasted bitter imperial stout without frills over this.
Keg - The Belgian Monk, Norwich. Clear golden amber with a fine yet lasting white head. Aromas of citrus, wheat, banana, clove white pepper and coriander. Mid-weight, medium carbonation and a lingering spicy, estery finish.
Can from Lokal Penny. Very hazy pale straw yellow, tall white head. Aroma of tropical fruit. Light to medium-bodied with a good malty base with lots of good, fresh aromatic hops, tropical fruit, hints of banana and mint. Smooth palate.
Cask at the George IV, lightly hazy dark gold with a loose foam, fresh hoppy nose with hints of orange juice and citrus pith, firmly bitter over a soft and light malty-sweet body, the bitterness lingering on the finish. It pains me to say, but it might go better through a sparkler!
Dark blond colour with light haze and thin head.  Really oily texture for the style. There's a sweetish malty background note. Also floral hops giving low to medium bitterness.
Nice malt profile, but a little too much hops. I like a good IRA, not a NW IRA. If they cut back on the hops this would be a great beer, and if you like NW IRA's them I'm sure you'll like this one. It pours a nice copper color with a medium head and pretty easy drinking. 2016
This definitely is an IPA. It has a nice hop profile with a medium malt profile. It pours a nice medium bodied hoppy IPA with a medium head.
[Cask at the Hope Tap (JDW), Reading.] A straw coloured pour with a thin white head; weak grassy aroma; grassy taste with a sharp lemon zest bitterness; and a bready finish. A rather average summer ale.
Another decent beer, though my wife liked it more than I did. I'm not a coffee drinker so this one is a little off for me, but it is full bodied and has a little sweetness. Aroma is coffee and chocolate.
Had this beer way back in 2016. It was a nice Red ale with a nice malt profile and minimal hop notes. When poured it has a small off-white head and good malt aroma.
Cask Handpump at Society Rooms, Macclesfield 02/05/2017 Hoppy aroma. White head. Light golden coloured and a little hazy in appearance. Hoppy with pine and citrus flavours. Slightly pale with a hint of bitterness in a malt finish.
Pale yellow hazy with medium white head. Hoppy aroma. Good hoppy bitterness with fruity notes, quite watery.
Of course a brewery focusing on German style beers (unique for Belgium at least in a contemporary craft beer context!) cannot ignore the one style that indirectly gave rise to a global flood of – often fruited – kettle sours: the old Berliner Weisse, once almost extinct, now very alive and kicking (also in Berlin, see Schneeeule and others).  This Mule interpretation had a snow white, moussy, creamy, slowly breaking head and milky pale straw blonde robe with greenish tinge.  Aroma of overripe cucumber, kefir, raw gherkin, wood sorrel, sourdough, green pear, sweaty socks somewhere, chalk, white soap, sugared white celery.  Crisp sour onset with lime, sorrel and green apple associations, hint of cucumber too, medium carbonated with slick, light but rounded mouthfeel; sourdoughy lactic acidity dominates the finish with a gentle wheat sourishness clearly underneath, all remaining crisp and fresh, with growing wheat soapiness towards the end and lingering lime and cucumber ‘greenness’ next to notes of celery and – very classic in a Berliner Weisse – chalk.  Solid and very quenching, a bit ‘off’ perhaps in comparison with the historical standards of the style but this typifies (and, frankly, graces) Mule’s house style I guess.  In spite of this odd character, still very credible as a Berliner Weisse, ticking all the boxes.  Better than expected, even.
This Schaarbeek microbrewery took it upon itself to tackle all the traditional German beer styles – and that includes, of course, the oldest of the Bavarian Weissbier variants.  Pale greyish white, moussy, stable, shred-lacing head, misty caramelly bronze-brown robe with mahogany glow.  Aroma of hard caramel, ground hazelnuts, a smoky accent (smoked bacon even!), dried medlar, clove, tea, hints of cigar leaf and unripe banana.  Sourish and sweetish onset, medlar and banana with a dash of apple peel but not as fruity as I would expect from the style; fizzy carb, slick mouthfeel.  ‘Deep’ wheaty sourishness and smoothness, caramelly barley on the edges quickly turning gently toasted-bitterish and showing again this smoky aspect which has nothing to do with real Dunkelweizen, but somehow fits in well.  Light tea- and clove-like spicy elements in the end too, caramelly maltiness and wheaty sourishness remaining the backbone of it all.  Bit odd due to that smoky element, but strangely – I guess the wheat does this – I still had the feeling I was drinking a Dunkelweizen somehow.  Solid and easily drinkable, as intended – good one.
This sympathetic new brewery in Schaarbeek specializes in exploring German beer traditions so a Kölsch comes as no surprise – and even if Mule is not the first Belgian brewery to tackle this old regional style, I do expect them to do it right, considering their business plan…  Snow white, stable, moussy, membrane-like lacing head, misty deep and pure ‘old’ golden robe.  Aroma of raw potatoes, green banana, old bread, a sulfuric touch, grass, raw cereals, green tree leaves, mugwort, vague hint of matcha tea.  Clean, crisp onset, sharply and very minerally carbonated; slick cereally malt body, restrained white-bready and grainy sweetishness with lingering minerality, in the end bittered by grassy, floral and slightly peppery hops while that sulfuric aspect returns retronasally.  Moderately long, dryish, quenching finish maintaining a good balance between malts and hops.  Easygoing, pleasant and indeed credible enough as a Kölsch, or at least no less so than the few other Belgian examples I had (including two by Dok Brewing Company in Ghent).
Pale lager brewed with Vienna malt, from tap at the brewery during Jens Skrubbe’s reception there.  Snow white, creamy, membrane-lacing, stable head on a clear yellow-glowing golden beer with visible sparkling.  Aroma of white bread slices, field flowers, dry cereals, minerals, dry hay, freshly cut grass, unripe banana, raw potato and a vague sulfuric touch.  Clean, crisp onset, hints of unripe banana and hard green pear, minerally carbonation, slick mouthfeel; cereally and white-bready pale maltiness, grassy hop bitterness gently and very gradually growing, floral and peppery in the end and quite long-lasting – as long as a vague green apple-like sourish aspect keeping things interesting till the last drop.  Well-made Lager as is to be expected from a Lager specialist – but I would personally come up with another name, as I got very confused at the beginning and though I was going to receive a Wiener style Lager (amber-coloured and much more malt-forward); the classification of this beer here as a Wiener is therefore to be seen as a classification by default.
Black body, tall beige head. Aroma is roasty, cookies, some chocolate. Mild hoppy taste. Dry and hoppy finish. Light body, soft carbonation, watery texture.
This beer pours a dark reddish/orange, almost like an amber ale. The head is medium and taste is sweet malt and hop. It definitely tastes like a 56 IBU beer, but not a real strong bite. The taste is closer to a NW Red than an IPA. But there are subtle differences that you can tell it's an IPA.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy / dirty golden color with a medium sized head. Citrus, fruity, and herbal. Sweet and tart finish.
[Cask at the Alehouse, Reading.] A slightly hazy pale amber pour with a thin white head;  grainy aroma with some traces of herbs, perhaps mint; full bodied with a fruity taste, some gooseberry tartness, but also rather sweet and jammy; then a dry finish with more fruit and a long herbal bitterness. Complex, yet very drinkable.
Can from Tidens Farver @ Home. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of light malt, rich fruity hops, tropical fruit, peach, citrus. Flavor is sweet, light bitter, light malt, rich fruity hops, juicy tropical fruit, citrus. Medium body, average carbonation, sweet and light bitter finish. 190922
Golden colour with lasting head. It's a solid Pilsener. Decent bitterness in the finish makes it easy to drink.
16oz can. Poured a thick looking banana color with a thin sized head. Bananas really come through with light passionfruit and tart finish. All about the bananas in this one.
bomber - picked up at Fresh Market.  Been trying to get one of these for some time now.  Heavy carbonation - lovely spice notes to compliment it.  Big fan
Can from Tidens Farver @ Home. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of light malt, rich fruity hops, tropical fruit, citrus. Flavor is light bitter, little malt, tropical fruit, citrus, grapefruit. Medium body, aveerage carbonation, light bitter finish. 190922
440ml can. Hazy yellow color. Sweet, sugary, lactose, fruity, juicy, porridge in aroma/taste.
16oz can. Poured a ruby color with a smaller sized pink head. Berries, vanilla, citrus, lighter coconuts, and tart finish.
Cask Handpump at White Lion, Macclesfield 02/05/2017 Malt aroma. Creamy head. Mid brown coloured smooth on the palate and slightly fruity with a little sweetness. A hint of chocolate in a crisp malt finish.
Aroma is alcohol and sweetness. It pours a dark brown with almost no head. Taste is sweet malt and alcohol. No noticeable hop flavor, though I'm sure there is a little bit. This is definitely a winter sipping beer. I like strong beers, but this is a little too much, MAYBE!
Tap at Hopdog, Munich, 19th September 22.  Pours a light slightly milky straw colour.  Aroma is straw and hay.  Taste follows.  Not bad
16oz can. Poured a thicker reddish (red currant) color with a medium sized pink head. Currants, tart fruits, and puckering finish.
Bottle. Red with a brief pale pink head. Aroma of damson, raisins, gentle barnyard funk, some twigs. Medium bodied, lowish carbonation. Quite sour (but no vinegar) with a bit of a slippery texture and an odd woody sensation on the roof of the mouth that I guess is fruit pit related. Nice fading summer feel to the fruit as it gradually fades away into wood. Very good.
[Cask at the Alehouse, Reading] A murky amber pour with a scummy looking white head; tropical fruit aroma; rather soapy in the mouth with a full on tropical fruit taste;  then a bitter finish with sharp citrus zest and some underlying pine resin. Tastes better than it looks!
Can, local store. Hazy orange golden, sizeable and pretty lasting creamy white head. Gentle yeasty nose, some spices and hints of bananas, pretty dusty. Mild bitterness, some sweetness, hints of spiciness. A bit citric. Gentle afteratste. Light body. Not too bad.
16oz can. Poured a deep purple color with a medium sized pink head. Berries, sweet and tart, some funkiness, and some jamminess.
16oz can. Poured a lighter hazy yellow color with an averaged sized head. Citrus, some lighter funkiness, fruity, and for 3.8% nice.
Bottle  - slightly hazy medium amber only thin white libe for head though retention round glass. Malt but mainly caramel aroma. OK mouthfeel- fairly sweet with the caramel, touch of flowers. Easy drinking.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy / murky golden / orange color with a medium sized head. Mangoes, juicy, fruity, oranges, citrus, and crushable.
Can 44 cl. Seriously expanded top of can as if threatening to burst. Super fizzy pour with ahuge, fluffy, rough white head. Beer is hazy, pale yellow. Lovely tropical nose, almost perfumy. Light body, annoyingly fizzy mouthfeel, a dry, tropical fruitiness and solid coconut imprints of the Sabro hops. Next to no bitterness. Looks like crap and the fizz is annoying, but otherwise a lovely quencher. SAbr saves everything.....200922
16oz can. Poured a cloudy / dirty deep yellow with a medium sized head. Citrus, limes, orange rinds, and not really blending.
Special edition of De Ranke’s classic ‘versnijbier’ Cuvée De Ranke, made for this year’s BXL Beerfest; explained by the brewer as a blend of old stock ale and lambic, it remains completely obscure to me where the difference with classic Cuvée De Ranke, in existence for fifteen years now, exactly lies…  Is there a difference in the aged ‘base’ beer, is it the lambic which comes from another producer, is it the ratio of both, or still something else?  I would love to find out.  Anyway, rating from the 75 cl bottle from the BXL Beerfest pack, shared with Craftmember.  Thick, egg-white, cobweb-lacing, dense and stable head, clear pale orange ‘old golden’ robe, turning misty with sediment.  Aroma of green apple, unripe peach, wood sorrel, old dry sherry, fresh mugwort leaf, dust, wet wood, dry hay, grape skin, plum peel, sow thistle.  Astringent, tart onset but not in a vinegary way, lots of juiciness reminiscent of both red and green apples, hints of pear and unripe stonefruit, softish carb with somewhat oily, rounded mouthfeel.  Bread-crusty malt core dried by lactic tartness, woody tannins and ongoing sour fruit notes, ranging from green apple to unripe plum; a pronounced ‘old’ hop bitterness raises its head in the finishing stage, hayish, drying and even wormwoody, eventually becoming quite pronounced, but keeping pace with the dryness of the lactic acidity and wood effects.  Everything merges well in the end; I had a Cuvée De Ranke the day after this one and even though it is hard to put my finger on it, there is certainly a difference, with the latter being a bit less bitter and mellower in general but certainly not less sour, as if more ‘malse’ lambic was used than in the BXL version.  I will stop guessing what the exact difference between both is now and grant Cuvée BXL a high score because like the original Cuvée De Ranke, it is a top notch ‘versnijbier’ of blonde and lambic, without any doubt.
Can 44 cl. Can expanded massively on the top side, seriously threatening to burst. Extremely fizzy pour. Hazy, pale yellow wit a huge, fizzy head with an amazing retention. Spicy, citrusy nose. Body is very light, quite sweet and fruity with a slight bitterness. It really behaves like a drama queen, but it's really quenching and pleasant. 200922
The second embodiment of Angerik’s new and so far very limited lambic project, a blend of honey-flavoured fermented raspberry juice and lambic, aged on wine barrels.  One of only a thousand bottles made, indeed with hard-to-remove wax and in the same elegant style as the first Kluysbosch.  Medium thick, moussy, pinkish-tinged off-white, quite stable head on a hazy ‘brownish’ peach blonde beer with ‘dirty amber’ glow; lots of free-floating yeast and protein, making the whole turn into a murky, muddy brown in the end, and lots of ‘grit’ from the raspberries as well – maybe filtering would have been a good option here, because as the Dutch saying goes, “they eye wants something too”…  Rather odd aroma of clear raspberry juice but not so much those typical tomato-like associations normally linked to this fruit apart from some sweet ripe cherry tomato perhaps, wet oak wood, red wine, weird and persistent off-flavours best compared with rotting Camembert or even rancid yoghurt, bread crust, nectarine, hint of wet cardboard.  Crisp, tart, juicy onset, indeed obvious raspberry juice with a touch of sour tomato and even an impression of blood orange, fizzy but very fine effervescence, vinous mouthfeel; bread-pulp-ish core soaked in the raspberry ‘cider’ effect with little real acidity as in ‘normal’ framboise, more a very yoghurty lactic tartness, remaining soft and mild.  Retronasal aspects of pink grapefruit or blood orange and some woody notes but limited tannins; red wine does pop up in the finish, accentuating the fruitiness of the whole, continuing in parallel with the raspberry juice flavour into a juicy finish.  Too bad for all that grit, dirty looks and those ‘spoiled diary’-like off-flavours, which unfortunately remained from the first drop till the last, but certainly an ambitious idea which might well work; the only thing lacking here is a more sleek, controlled and sophisticated execution.  Too bad, the obvious technical flaws here were a bit of a letdown after that spectacular first Kluysbosch variant (the whisky-aged lambic).
Tap at Sommar Waterloo Street. Poured a hazy golden colour with a lasting frothy white head and some clingy lace. The aroma is grainy malt, stone fruits. The flavour is moderate bitter, light sweet, with a fresh, crisp, earthy, mineral, light citrus, light herbal, woody hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.
Draft at The Craft Beer Co. Covent Garden. Dark brown black with a beige head. Aroma of soy sauce, chocolate, alcohol. Sweets, warming, dark chocolate, roasted malt, umami, cocoa, bitter finish. Full-bodied, oily.
Cask. Pours a hazy pale gold colour with a thin white head, light citrus aroma, the taste is medium bitterness with a soft bitter finish.
Draft at The Craft Beer Co. Covent Garden. Hazy orange, creamy head. Fruity, citric hops aromas. Sweetish, bitter, resinous, fruity, grapefruit, lemon zest. Medium-bodied.
Can from the brewery. Big, fresh aroma of citrusy hops, herbs, spicy saison yeast, wheat, crackery malt. Hazy bright gold with a medium to tall head. creamy, fabulous citrus, wheat comes though nice and fruity, saltine crackers. Spicy, bitter finish. Very creamy and smooth. Eminently drinkable. not huge in flavor, but smooth and tasty.
Can. Wit-like appearance with a fading loose white head. Aroma of mandarin, pineapple, crackers, coconut. A bit watery. Fruity with a bit of a void beneath the hops before a moderately bitter finish. Decent dustcutter.
[Can (473ml)] Pours a very dark brown, almost black, with an average size semi-lasting frothy light-brown head. Minimal to no lacing. Aroma (7+) of roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla and yes, coconut. Also some notes of coffee and dark fruit. Slightly watery, malty and chocolaty flavour, along with coffee, coconut and vanilla. Slight bitter finish. Alcohol is well hidden. Average bodied. A bit thin but still a pretty good beer.
Can.  Pours a clear gold colour with a tight white head, plenty of hops and fruit in the aroma, the taste is medium bitterness with a dry fruity bitter finish.
25cl pours a cola brown, no head.  Nose has malt and earth and smoke and grain.  Flavors follow.  Medium bodied, dry finish.  Solid.  7 2 8 3 13
Draft at Craft Beer Co. Covent Garden. Hazy yellow orange, creamy head. Fruity hops, notes of pine and coconut. Sweetish, mild bitterness, fruity, toasted malt, coconut, peach. Medium-bodied, smooth.
Tap at Sommar, Waterloo Street. Poured a murky golden yellow colour with a lasting frothy white head. The aroma is grainy malt, big tropical citrus. The flavour is moderate bitter and sweet, with a crisp, fresh, piney, grassy, resin, tart citrus, floral hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average to soft carbonation.
.5l at a beer garten in Munich.  Pours a cola brown with a huge cap of frothy, off white head.  Nose has malt and wheat, carob, yeast, some Tootsie Roll.  Flavor has some cola and carob, burnt wheat, yeast, heavy yeast, malty.  Off dry finish.  Solidly made.
Liter at the Hacker-Pschorr tent in Munich pours a clear gold with a ring of white head.  Nose has honey and grain and grist, some yeast, a little floral.  Flavor is simple, grist, grain, honey, flowers.  Some light dough.  Sweet dough.  Finishes off dry, not quite medium bodied.
0,335l bottle at Oluthuone Leskinen, Oulu. Pours hazy red with visible yeast. White lacing. Raspberries, funk. Some wheat too. Quite intense sourness.
Bottle 33 cl. Pours a cloudy, opaque, dark golden with an off-white head. Spicy hop aroma, somewhat tropical, but not exactly overwhelming. Sweet, rich, fruity body with a lowish carbonation and plenty of tropical hop accents. A slight hop bitterness. The promised hop bonanza was mainly in the flavor. 200922
Bottle. Pours a dark gold colour with a thin white head, light hop aroma with some citrus, the taste is medium bitterness with a dry bitter finish.
Shaker pint draft at Crooked Ewe Brewery in South Bend, Indiana. The pour is a slightly hazed amber orange with a small off white head. The aroma is floral, lemon citrus, a bit of pine and a nice biscuit malt backbone. The taste is a nice balance between the citrus, floral and pine hop with the clean and fresh softly sweet malt. The palate is medium bodied, soft natural carbonation, and a softly bitter finish. Solid IPA.
Can 33 cl. Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Sweet fruity nose, green appleas with a hint of wood. Medium body, a very dry fruitiness, Belgian yeast esters and again plenty of green apples with subtle woody tannins. Subdued bitterness. Not really an impressive barrel impact. 200922
Shaker pint draft at Crooked Ewe Brewery in South Bend, Indiana. The pour is clear golden yellow with a smaller white head. The aroma is baked bread, grass and a hint of mineral. The taste is the bread malt, grass and floral hop and clean malt faint mineral finish. The palate is light to medium bodied, active carbonation and the floral softly mineral finish. Easy drinking beer, nice to sip while overlooking the river.
On tap at Oluthuone Leskinen, Oulu. Pours bright golden. Lots of mango and passionfruit, with a hint of licorice in the back. Super good balance. Pretty intense sourness too. Very good.
Bottle. Pours a hazy orange colour with a tight white head, light wheat aroma, the taste is medium bitterness with the wheat coming through,  to a dry bitter finish.
Can 33 cl. Pours a clear golden with a white head. Fruity, estery, slightly yeasty nose. Medium ody, a very dry hoppiness, very Belgian yeast acents and a hoppy finish. A modern take on the style, totally devoid of nasty phenols. 200922
Tap at Gustav Kitchen & Bar, Rovaniemi. Slightly hazy golden. Citrus, resin, caramel malt. Nicely bitter.
0,44l can at Paha Kurki Rockhouse in Rovaniemi. Pours slightly hazy golden with white lacing. Citrus, spruce. Softish mouthfeel. Dryish and bitter. Not bad.
Draft. A hazy golden beer with a lazing yellowish head. The aroma has notes of hops, citrus fruits, pine needles, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of hops, spices, citrus fruits, and malt, leading to a bitter finish.
0,33l bottle at Rovaniemen Oluthuone. Pours cloudy amber with medium sized white head. Smokiness mostly, some malts to go. Bit sharp in my opinion.
0,33l bottle at Rovaniemen Oluthuone. Pours hazy and golden with big white head. Wheat, softish mouthfeel. Citrus, coriander, mild spices. Some bitterness to go.
Can from last 6 months ago.  Rich nose, coffee, nuts, vanilla, chocolate, grape juice fruitiness. Black with a pretty brown, rocky head. Fruity, chocolatey, coffee, macadamia nuts, complex and balanced. Bitter roasted finish. Neither too sweet not too heavy. Nice one from a new brewery.
3rd August 2022GBBF Day 2. Can, thanks to Matt. Very cloudy ripe banana colour beer, no real head. Smooth banana foam sweets, pretty sweet and with quite the juxtaposition with tart passion fruit. Loud and clear cheesecake on the back end. Light semi dry finish. Wow. Quite the dessert beer, does feel like liquidised cheesecake.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. A light haze on this amber beer, small pale cream colour head. Smooth malts, cream and caramel. Spicy Centennial. Orange and tangerine fruits, some peel.  A light crisp dry finish. Fine
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Keg. Hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Light crisp palate, mildly dry, good fine minerally carbonation. Smooth malts a light creamy sweetness. Good crisp Simcoe hops. Floral marmalade, floral tangerine. Touch of peel. Pretty drinkable.
Can poured a hazy yellow with a small lasting white head. Aromas of biscuit, fruitiness and a hint of citrus. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of biscuit and light fruitiness with a crisp dry moderately bitter finish.
Bottle poured a hazy gold with a lasting white head. Aromas of wheat, yeast, clove and bubblegum. Palate was light bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of wheat, yeast and citrus with a smooth dry lingering citrus wheat finish.
Pounder can poured a hazy gold with a small lasting white head. Aromas of graham cracker, lime and light vanilla. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of graham cracker, lime and light vanilla with a crisp dry tart lingering lime pie finish.
Buying this bottle at the Alcampo, Sevilla, during the last spring. Serving this bottle today at home, during the meal, without stress. The body is black, brown, troubled not at the extreme like some American stouts., white and brown foam.This one is regular, classical, on the way of a stout, light with a decent note of roasted malt, note of cocoa, smooth, light touch of coffee, decently aromatic, light, a bit watery, basic but it was ok for me.
Cask pull at Hogshead poured a çlear reddish amber with a lasting creamy amber head. Aromas of caramel, earthiness, grassiness, light pine and a hint of citrus. Palate was light to medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of caramel, grassiness, earthiness and pine with a smooth dry moderately bitter lingering grassy caramel finish.
Buying this bottle at the big coop, next to the train station of Biel. Opening and enjoying this bottle, today, free of job, for the dinner. The body is yellow, gold, carbonated, white foam. A typical German beer, really smooth at the palate, wheat, malt, fruity, note of banana, cloves, a bit spicy, a bit sweet, well balanced, alcohol well hidden, touch of hop at the final.
Draft. A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, coffee, bourbon, vanilla, and a bit of chocolate. The flavor is sweet with notes of wood, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, and roasted malt, leading to a dry finish.
Cask conditioned at the Slip Inn, York. Black with tan head. This proved to be a tart, fruity beer, quite boozy in character. Not keen I'm afraid.
Cask conditioned at the Slip Inn, York. Dark chestnut with cream head. This proved to be a very sweet beer, cakey, plummy, sweet cherry in character. Tart notes in the close. It's just okay.
Cask at the Wellington, Birmingham. Poured a mostly clear yellow golden colour with a short-lived, frothy white head. The aroma is grainy malt, light citrus fruits. The flavour is moderate to light bitter and sweet, with a malt, gluey yeast, light citrus, light pepper spice, light hop bitter palate. Medium to light bodied with soft carbonation.
Cask conditioned at the Slip Inn, York. Gold with white head. There is quite a thinnish body to this, biscuity, cereals. There is a light grassy hopped note, hint of citrus, grapefruit. It's fine.
Cask conditioned at the Angel on the Green, York. Pale gold with white head. This proved to be a light, fruity, slightly sweet beer. Maybe a touch insipid. Some citrus, some grassy notes. It's fine.
Cask conditioned at the Swan Inn, York. Gold with white head. This is maybe a little on the bland side, quite a honeyed flavour, some bitterness, drying finish. It's okay.
Cask at the Wellington, Birmingham. Poured a clear yellow golden colour with a lasting frothy white head. The aroma is malt, light grassy citrus. The flavour is moderate to light bitter and sweet, with a smooth, gluey, light piney, citrus palate. Medium to light bodied with soft carbonation.
Cask conditioned at the Swan Inn, York. Gold with white head. This proved to be a light, hoppy, bittering beer. Quite light on the palate but refreshing and citrusy, lemon zesty. Pretty fair.
Cask conditioned at the Golden Ball, York. Gold with white head. There is a pleasant dry bitterness to this. Dryish, lightly perfumed, quite crisp, floral in character. Decent.
Cask conditioned at The Golden Ball, York. Gold with white head. This proved to be quite a hoppy, bright beer, quite citrusy, quite light in character. Pretty fair.
Cask conditioned at the Tank & Paddle, York. Gold with white head. This proved to be quite a light beer, cereal malty notes, grainy then a grassy, leafy hopped note. It's fine.
Cask at the Wellington, Birmingham. Poured a clear dark brown colour with a lasting frothy off-white head. The aroma is roasty malt, piney hops. The flavour is moderate bitter, with a smooth, grassy, piney, light roasty, floral hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Very hoppy. The Cascade totally dominates. Cacao? I don’t think so. Nonetheless, tasty, but more like a black IPA.
Draught (at 5.5% ABV) at the York Tap, York. Hazy yellow straw with white head. This proved to be a crisp, hoppy, quite dry beer from the off. Sharp but thinnish malts, citrus, lemon, grapefruit maybe a little tropical fruit. Decent enough and a new brewery.
Can. Rich nose of caramel, figs, brown sugar, orange, spice, chocolate.  Deep brown with orange, lacy head. Rich flavor, sweet caramel and chocolate, figs and raisins, light bitterness, nice. Not heavy. Medium to full body, prickly finish. My kind of dubbel. Rich and malty, not sugary sweet. Great balance too.
Cask conditioned at The York Tap, York. Black with tan head. This proved to be a big, roasty, quite smooth beer. Notes of coffee and chocolate, sweet with a hint of Christmas spice. A pretty decent beer.
Bottle @ Køge Øldag. Appearance: pours clear dark brown with ok tan soapy head and lacing. Aroma/taste: bread, barley, caramel, light alcohol, syrup, light chocolate, light dried fruit, light fruit, light marzipan, light oak, light smoke, light earthy and nutty notes. Palette: strong malty aroma, average carbonation, full body, medium to notable sweetness, balanced by a medium to notable bitterness, long duration, light sweet finish and an oily texture. Overall: Highly enjoyable
Cask at the Wellington, Birmingham. Poured a clear dark brown, almost black colour with a reddish hue and a lasting frothy tan head. The aroma is roasty malt, light red berry fruits. The flavour is moderate sweet, with a smooth, roasty, red berry fruit, herbal, ginger, light floral, sugary light lactose palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Draft. An unclear golden beer with a lazing yellowish head. The aroma has notes spices, citrus fruits, hops, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of hops, spices, citrus fruits, and malt, leading to a bitter finish.
Draught, half pint. @"Belgian Beer Weekend 2022", Grand Place Brussels (Belgium). 04/09/2022
[#5.350 Global - #190 Belgium - #2 Brasserie Bertinchamps]
Pours orange with a small off-white head. Aroma: fruit extract, bubblegum and spiced malts. Taste: fruit extract again, candy orange and yeast. Sweet and kinda artificial
Next one please!
Draught, half pint. @"Belgian Beer Weekend 2022", Grand Place Brussels (Belgium). 04/09/2022
[#5.349 Global - #189 Belgium - #1 The Brew Society (My Belgian brewery #77)]
Pours golden with a thick white head. Aroma: bubblegum, apple, yeast and DMS. Taste: bread, spiced malts, yeast and floral hops. Long coriander and spicy finish. 
Next one please!
Can, half pint. @"Belgian Beer Weekend 2022", Grand Place Brussels (Belgium). 04/09/2022
[#5.348 Global - #188 Belgium - #1 Brasserie Leopold 7 (My Belgian brewery #76)]
Pours pale yellow, long white head. Spiced malts, lemon peel, cardamom and dill. Long spiced finish.
Next one please!
440ml can. Pours a mild gold with small amounts of white head. Huge  nose full of spice, zest, citrus, and white fruits. Medium body with lower carbonation. Strong white fruits forward with residual sugars and good levels of zest. Really delicious.
Cask conditioned at The York Tap, York. Gold with white head. This proved to be a fruity but quite thinnish beer. Tarty, light, perfumed. It's okay.
750 ml bottle from the cidery. Pours a clearish lightish golden colour. Aroma is vinous apple with earthiness and a little acidity. Flavour has vinous fruitiness, semi dry apple, light acidity and a little earthiness. Nice.
330ml bottle (shop in Germany). Hazy amber color. Coconut cookies, sweet, malty, sweet, creamy in aroma/taste.
440ml can. Cloudy yellow color. Wheaty, mild green banana, wet paper, very fizzy, some tropical notes in aroma/taste. Messy.
500ml bottle. Hazy yellow color. Citrus, sweetish, nice bitterness, touch of lactose in aroma/taste.
500ml bottle. Cloudy orange color. Sweet, citrus, fruity, orange, juicy in aroma/taste.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Clouded pineapple colour with white head. This is a bright, sharp, tangy beer from the off. Citrus notes with a light resinous hint. Some tropical fruits, pineapple and mango. Very pleasant.
440ml can (thanks FatPhil). Cloudy yellow color. Citrus, fruity, juicy, dry, papery, yeasty in aroma/taste.
375ml can (thanks FatPhil). Cloudy dull orange color. Yogurt, peach, lactose, sweet, some ripe mango, tropical in aroma/taste.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Glouded gold with white head. There was quite a spicy, pine like character to this from the start. Tangy grapefruit hints with a lemon zest flavour. Very pleasant.
Can at a tasting. Black, beige head. Lots of ginger in aroma. Sweet, dark, chocolate, vanilla, ginger, caramel flavors. Medium full bodied, oily.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Hazy orange gold with white head. This is a citrusy, fruity hoppy beer from the off. Sweet lemonade notes with orange juice and mango hints. Refreshing and surprisingly light. Coconut in the close. Very pleasant.
Keg at Craft Beer Junction, Bermondsey, 16/09/22.
Hazed golden yellow with an off white cap that veers to a swirl.
Nose is orange pith, grass, light dank chimes, pine needle, melon.
Taste comprises tangerine, ripe melon, floral notes, orange zest, grass.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close spiked with balanced light juice laden hop bitterness.
Decent enough pale.
Can at a tasting. Black, beige head. Chocolate, solvent alcohol aromas. Sweet, sourish berries, chocolate, maple, coffee. Medium full bodied, sticky.
330ml can. Pours a light to mild yellow with strong haze and fluffy white head. Soft tropical fruits at the forward with light sweetness. Medium body with mild carbonation. Thin palate which hides tropical fruits, white fruits, and light residual sugars.
Golden, clear with a medium foamy white head. Aroma of hops, fruits and citrus. Light-med bitter with a mild hop and citrus end. Not bad for an airline beer. Norwegian flight.
330ml bottle (shop in Düsseldorf, Germany). Clear amber color. Sweet, malty, sugary, papery in aroma/taste.
440ml can. Cloudy yellow color. Sweet, lactose, sugary, caramel, too sweet in aroma/taste.
330ml bottle (random shop, Germany). Clear yellow color. Sweet, malty, sugary, bitter in aroma/taste.
Keg. Hazy yellow color. Belgian yeast, sweet, papery, citrus in aroma/taste.
Can at a tasting. Black, beige head. Chocolate, caramel, alcohol aroma. Sweet, chocolate, roasted malt, caramel, peanuts, alcohol. 
 Medium-bodied, sticky.
Bottle at a tasting. Black, beige head. Coffee, nuts, chocolate aromas.
Sweet, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, nuts, almonds. Medium-bodied.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Cloudy orange gold with white head. This proved to be quite an earthy, malty beer, some fruitiness, some leafy hopped notes. Hints of hedgerow fruit along with peach. It's fine.
Bottle at a tasting. Black, beige head. Coffee, chocolate, soy sauce, maple. Sweet, dark chocolate, vanilla, umami, alcohol. Full-bodied, oily.
Keg as "Gbg Lager Official GBG Beer Week 2022". Clear deep amber color. Grainy, barley, sourish, bit farty in aroma/taste.
Keg at Craft Beer Junction, Bermondsey, 16/09/22.
Pitch black with a decent tan cap that dissipates to a swirl.
Nose is chocolate melt, sweet malts, marshmallows, molasses, brown sugars.
Taste comprises chocolate pot, toffee fudge, light spice, dark malts, molasses, walnut whip.
Full bodied, oily feel, semi drying close spiked with a balanced warming kiss of alcohol.
Solid well balanced impy.
(bottle 0,75l from Zichovec brewery e-shop) Overall: Nice. Pleasant sour, earthy, wineous.
Aroma: Sweet, fruity, funky, wine.
Appearance: Clear golden. Minimal white head. 
Taste: Light-medium sweet, funky, fruity, wine, light sour, light bitter. 
Palate: Medium body. Bitter-earthy, light warm finish.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Gold with white head. There is a slightly tarty fruitiness to this from the off, quite bitter and dry. Some citrus, lemon zest. It's okay.
Bottle at a tasting. Black, beige head. Coffee, blueberries, chocolate, vanilla. Sweet, flavors of chocolate, hazelnuts, berries, coffee, cocoa, warming. Full-bodied, oily.
Keg. Cloudy yellow color. Citrus, dry, juicy, papery, old grapefruit skins, watery in aroma/taste.
Keg at Craft Beer Junction, Bermondsey, 16/09/22.
Black with a moderately presented tan covering.
Nose is dark malts, bitter chocolate, orange zest, spice, charr, dried fruit rinds.
Taste comprises mellow roast, dark malts, molasses, chocolate orange, spice, herb, bitter fruit rinds, burnt brown sugars.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a balanced rising boost.
Decent sipper.
Bottle at a tasting. Hazy yellow. Funky, fruity, citrus notes. Sour, fruity, rhubarb, funky, lemony, wood flavors. Medium-bodied, soft carbonation. Great.
Clear golden in the glass and a small bubbly head
Loads of apple in the nose here
Tad sweet, but still quite ok
The flavor felt like apple juice. Mild citric notes
Decent and tasty
[Bottle at Jæren Ølfestival 22 – Pre tasting]
500ml bottle. Pours opaque burgundy with a thin pink head. Aroma is berry syrup, cherries, sweet malt. Taste is light sweet, cherry-flavoured tea, syrup. Light sour finish. Light bodied. More of a soft drink than an N/A beer.
How: Can.
Where: From Alcampo, had at home in Spain.
Appearance: Golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Malt, hops, some fruit.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, hops, some fruit.
440ml can (thanks FatPhil). Clear deep amber color. Flatish, grainy, barley, dusty, fizzy in aroma/taste.
Can at a tasting. Murky pink orange color. Apples and plums aroma. Sweet, tart plums, lemon, apples, vanilla. Medium-bodied.
375ml can (thanks Julius). Clear amber color. Eggy, sweet, plain lager in aroma/taste.
From a 440ml can on 20/9/2022. Pours a milky golden with masses of yeast floaties with a biggish head. Has a bright and sharp citrus fruit nose. Tastes of orange and peach, with a really firm pithy, citrus rind bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Bitter for an oat cream but really bold and interesting. Truly excellent.
500ml can (Albert, Prague). Clear amber color. Grainy, sweet, crisp in aroma/taste.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Dark brown with cream head. There are dark roasty malty flavours to the fore with quite a plummy, fruity character. Cake like notes, fullish. It's fine.
500ml can (Albert, Prague). Hazy red color. Sweet, berries, sourish acidity in aroma/taste.
330ml can. Hazy yellow color. Sweet, malty, caramel, toffee, sugary in aroma/taste.
500ml bottle as "Warrior IPA". Clear deep amber color. Sweet, malty, sugary, citrus, fruity in aroma/taste.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Clouded orange with white head. Lots of orange, citrusy flavours from the off. Tangy and refreshing throughout. Very good.
330ml bottle (thanks Erzengel). Clear black color. Roast, alcohol, chocolate, grainy, burnt in aroma/taste.
330ml can. Clear amber color. Coriander, herbal, yarrow, bitter in aroma/taste.
440ml can. Clear dark amber color. Citrus, malty, yeasty, alcohol, caramel in aroma/taste.
Keg. Cloudy yellow color. Pine needles, yeasty, fruity, juicy, dry in aroma/taste.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Very dark brown with cream head. Sweet chocolate flavours to the fore with this but it was quite thin on the palate. Some boiled malt notes. It's okay.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Gold with white head. Thire is a citrusy character to this from the start, quite tangy, quite hoppy throughout. Light and crisp on the palate. Decent beer.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Dark auburn colour with cream head. This proved to be quite a smooth, malty beer with a berried fruitiness. Some nutty notes, close to a mild really. It's okay.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Gold with white head. This proved to be quite a thinnish beer from the off, some caramel, some fruitiness. It's okay.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Pale gold with white head. It's a touch thin from the off, there is a juicy sweetness, lemonade notes. Becomes fruitier through the beer with a peachy hint. It's fine.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Hazy gold with white head. There is a hoppy fruitiness to this from the off, mango and sweet peach flavours. Refreshing and light on the palate given the ABV. Very pleasant.
Can. Pours a clear golden hue with a medium white head. A sweet citrus nose. Rich sweet hops, resin, really funky deep hops. Tropical notes especially, pungent fruit.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Hazy gold with white head. There is a rich, hoppy fruitiness to this from the off. Peachy, pineapple and mango notes with a crisp citrusy character alongside. Full and very good indeed.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Gold with white head. This is light and citrusy from the start, refreshing with a light pine needle hint in the background. Slightly resinous, some tropical fruit hints. It's a pleasant beer.
Aroma; boozy bread, straw, grainy malts, glue, syrup. Look; thin ring head on clear golden body. Taste; bread, straw, grainy malts, glue, booze, syrup, and finishes somewhat boozy. Feel; okay body and okay co². Overall; meh. [from 33cl bottle, B @ Alko FI last year].
1l PETka from Kralupy. Golden yellow, tall white head, hoppy nose. Light- to medium-bodied, malty with good Saaz hops tuning in soon, resulting in a lovely bitter-sweet overall impression and just that right touch of butter.
1l PETka from Kralupy. Clear golden yellow, mid-suzed white head, hoppy nose with citrus. Light-bodied, shy but god malty flavours with a rather intense hoppy character, citrusy and grapefruit. Good, refreshing light ale.
1l PETka from Kralupy. Hazy amber with a tall head. Hoppy nose. Full-bodied, malty base with just the right sweetness to support the resiny and citrusy hops.
1l PETka from Kralupy. Amber-golden with a tall and creamy white head. Malty with roasty hints and a good, rather fragrant hoppy finish.
Patrick Pub 090922. Orange-purple color with a pinkish head. Aroma is strawberry, passionfruit. Flavor is strawberry, passionfruit, vanilla, tropical fruit, yoghurt. OK beer.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Gold with white head. There was a heavy caramellisation to this from the off, sweet toffee notes, malty biscuit. Vague fruit flavour. Heavy palate. It's okay.
Hazed brown in the glass and a fine head 
Moderate intensity in the aroma 
Mellow sweetness and a soft carbonation level 
Bread, herbal, fruity, mild coffee and some roast in the flavor 
[Can at Jæren Ølfestival 22 – Pre tasting]
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Amber with white head. This proved to be a malty beer from the off, some bready sweetness, some light fruitiness. The fruit develops through the beer, quite peachy in character of the tinned variety. It's fine overall.
Tap @ Hugos w Køge Øldag. Appearance: pours clear dark copper/brown good off-white soapy head and lacing. Aroma/taste: barley, bread, brown sugar, dried fruit, light fruit, raisins, light spices, chocolate and light earthy notes. Palette: Medium malty and yeasty aroma, average carbonation, medium body, average to notable sweetness, somewhat balanced by medium bitterness, average duration, light sweet finish and an oily texture. Overall: Tasteful Belgian
Aroma; roasted malts, black caramel, black chocolate, notes of liquorice. Look; tan blanket head on black body. Taste; roasted malts, black caramel, black chocolate, notes of hopsy liquorice, and finishes with dark hops popping up. Feel; okay body and softish co². Overall; lazy porter. [from 33cl bottle, B @ Alko FI].
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Black with tan head. There is a heavy sweet chocolate flavour to this from the start, tonka bean, sweet vanilla. There is a background coffee note, smooth, milky, silky. Heavy on the palate throughout. It's decent.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Gold with white head. There was a tart fruitiness to this from the off, dry peachy notes with apricot sourness. Thin cereal note, thin malts. Just okay really.
Restrained citrus pine aroma in a light gold pour.  Hop forward balance with a light fruit body and sustained bitter finish.
Aroma; roasted malts, vanilla, coconut, cinnamon, chocolate. Look; beige yellowish low dense head on brown noted black body. Taste; roasted malts, vanilla, clove, coconut, cinnamon, black chocolate, and finishes semi sweet. Feel; nice body and gentle co². Overall; that's a stout enough stout. [from 33cl bottle, B @ Alko Tampere FI].
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival ,22, N.Yorks. Very dark brown with cream head. Dark roasty malts to the fore with a touch of vegetable bitterness. Hints of dark chocolate and also a sweeter fruity note. It's fine.
Aroma; citrus, tropical fruits, herbs, fruit peel, pale malts, yeast. Look; good off white head on cloudy to hazy yellow golden body. Taste; hops, citrus, tropical fruits, ananas, peaches, herbs, fruit peel, pale malts, yeast, and finishes fruity peely. Feel; okay body and normal co². Overall; fresh enough. [from 33cl can, B @ Alko FI].
Pleasant and easy drinkable beer. Very session able
Hazed golden in the glass and a fine head
Looks fine and inviting
Good intensity in the aroma
Balanced sweetness and bitterness.
Also a fine carbonation level
Malty, citric, fruity and some pine in the flavor
[Can from Coop Mega in Trysil, Norway]
Aroma; citric peel, resiny herbs, grapefruit, pale malts, yeast. Look; good off white head on hazy hazy deep golden body, dotty lacing. Taste; hops, citric peel, resin, wood, grapefruit, pale malts, yeast, and finishes hopsy. Feel; okay body and normal co². Overall; yes ipa ale. [from 44cl can, B @ Alko Raksila Oulu FI].
YG  130822. Dark brown color with a beige head. Aroma is bread, caramel, coffee, yeast. Flavor is bread, caramel, coffee, pine, grapefruit, yeast, dried fruit. A little bit carbonated.
YG 130822. Yellow-orange-golden color with a white head. Aroma is pine, grapefruit, fruit, malt. Flavor is pine, grapefruit, fruit, malt, tropical fruits. Easy drinkable beer.
Patricks Pub 090922. Yellow-orange color with a white head. Aroma is pine, grapefruit, citrus. Flavor is pine, grapefruit, citrus, lemon, tropical fruits. Easy drinkable.
From a 16 oz can that simply says HTX IPA Brewed in the 6th Ward.  Anyway, pours hazy yellow with head and lace.  Aroma of musty grains and hops.  Significant carbonation and mouthfeel.  Flavors of pale malt, old melon, grains, light hops.  Overall rich, flavorful, quite tasty.
330ml can. Pours a near clear gold with a few cm of fading head. Aroma is mild beer. Beer is light, mild sweetness, moderate hop bitterness & a hint of cabbage. Below average beer & not one I'd order again & only just finished.
Canned, 440 ml, shared with Miro B. Cloudy orange golden with medium white head. Hoppy, citrus, some grassy notes. Spicy. Bitter finish. Medium bodied.
Fiskåbanen 090922. Golden-orange color with a  white head. Aroma is citrus, pine, grapefruit. Flavor is citrus, pine, grapefruit, alcohol, grass, malt, grain, oranges. OK beer.
Black with a small tan head. Aroma of chocolate, sugar, wood, vanilla, moderate to light added fruit flavors. Fuller bodied, warming, moderate barrel. It's not their best but it's nice.
Draft at Old Chicago. Pour was cloudy golden, white head. Aroma of lemon, medicine, wheat, toasted grain. Taste was sweet, lemon, toasted, bit watery.
From a 16 oz can into a stem glass.  Pours gold with head and lace.  Aroma of sweet malts and light grassy hops.  Significant carbonation and mouthfeel.  Flavors of pale malt, bitter roots, minerals, pine resin, grassy hops.  Overall rich, bold, decent if you like bright, West Coast style IPAs.
Single can from HyVee Ankeny, stamped 6/24/22.
The familiar creamy and chocolately smell of a milk stout right under the tab. Pours brownish-black with a sudsy, ecru head.
Taste has a pretty filling mouthfeel of malt, with some roastiness, of course. Palate is a little less creamy than a milk stout, perhaps, but I get a note of Guinness "sour". Some of this bitterness could be coming from the added roast coffee. That's not always east to separate from a stout roast malt. Leaves some sticky malt on my lip. Alcohol remains in the background and seems to have no inclination to "sneak up" on me.
Can. Pours a clear orange hue with a medium white head. A nice soft and sweet citrus nose. Toast, mild bitterness, clear, resin. Very good.
Can from a Hy-Vee in Des Moines. Pour was black, off white head. Aroma of peanut, roasted, chocolate. Taste was sweet, peanut butter, chocolate, creamy.
Pint can pours with a deep dark sludgy black used motor oil colored body that supports a short lived tiny head of tan foam. The aroma offers up inviting levels of chocolate, Ovaltine, a bit of marshmallow and then faint hints of dark roasted malts and some nuttiness. The taste is straight up chocolate yum. I get chocolate Ovaltine heading straight into slipper sweet malts, booze and dark chocolate. There other notes in here are far below the delicious chocolate onslaught. I get hints of dark roasted to burnt malts sweetened by slick reduced sugars and malts. Toward the finish the big ABV is noticed only by a mild degree of warming as the elixir slips down and gets inside. Great sipper.
Poured from 473mL can (pkg 13/Jul/2022). Murky dull blonde with small white head. Creamy oats, quite juicy citrus hops, subdued dankness. Really nice.
Can from John’s Grocery, Iowa City. Poured hazed amber, off white head. Aroma of caramel, malty, sweet malts. Taste was sweet, caramel, light citrusy spice.
200th Summit City rating. It’s now my most rated brewery. Pours hazy orange. It has a mild, malty aroma. The flavor is sweet malt with some caramel. Minimal hops. It’s okay, but there isn’t much going on here.
Pours orange with a small white head. It has a mild blueberry aroma. The flavor is sweet with some blueberry and bready, grainy malt. Okay.
16 ounce can from Collier’s Liquor Sore in Cape May, NJ. Cloudy orange gold pour. Dense, foamy white head. Bready malt aroma has tropical citrus notes. Soft, creamy mouthfeel leads to strong tangerine and lime flavors. Quite sweet. Some booziness in middle. Sweet juicy finish.
Pours clear gold and has a mild, malty aroma. The flavor is of light, sweet, bready malt and minimal hops. It’s easy drinking and kind of bland.
47,3cl Can @ Star Wines & Spirits, Stamford, CT, USA.
Hazy golden colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is hops, citrus, tropical fruits.
Taste is hops, citrus, mango, pineapple.
Medium body, average carbonation.
47,3cl Can @ Star Wines & Spirits, Stamford, CT, USA.
Hazy golden colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is hops, citrus, tropical fruits.
Taste is hops, citrus, grapefruit, mango.
Medium body, average carbonation.
Pours clear light gold with minimal head. It smells of funky wild Belgian yeast and citrus. The flavor is funky, fruity, oaky, and tart with some malty sweetness. It’s balanced and delicious, an excellent lambic or lambic like beer
Pours amber with a small head. This smells like chili peppers with maybe some caramel malt. The flavor is led by the peppers and they bring some heat. It’s sweet with some underlying caramel and a vague fruitiness that might be mango.
Can LCBO. Clear golden pour. Mild grainy aroma with a bit of sweetness. Taste is similar, some mild grain and cereal, a hint of sweetness. Clean and easy drinking but lacking much character.
Pours mostly clear copper with a lasting white head. It smells of citrus and tropical fruit with hop resin. The flavor is of cherries, citrus, pine,  and caramel. It’s pretty bitter but not the total kick in the teeth I expected at 107ibu. There’s a big malt backbone and overall is very enjoyable.
35,5cl Can @ Star Wines & Spirits, Stamford, CT, USA.
Golden colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is malt, straw.
Taste is malt, sweet, bread, slightly watery.
Medium body, average carbonation.
35,5cl Can @ Star Wines & Spirits, Stamford, CT, USA.
Golden colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is hops, citrus, slightly herbal.
Taste is hops, citrus, herbs, slightly malty.
Medium body, average carbonation.
35,5cl Bottle @ Star Wines & Spirits, Stamford, CT, USA.
Amber colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is malt, straw.
Taste is malt, caramel, bread.
Medium body, average carbonation.
47,3cl Can @ Star Wines & Spirits, Stamford, CT, USA.
Hazy amber colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is hops, citrus, tropical fruits, pine.
Taste is hops, citrus, peach, mango, grass, slightly malty.
Medium body, average carbonation.
A ruddy colored body with a thin head. Aroma is boozy, wood barrel, rye spice, and caramel. Taste is fairly light considering the ABV. Nice notes of wood, caramel, toffee, and spice. Texture is lighter. Enjoyable.
Pours near black with a small, lasting light tan head. The aroma is of chocolate, coffee, and dark roast malt. The flavor is roasty and chocolatey with a full body and a good balance. Very good.
47,3cl Can @ Star Wines & Spirits, Stamford, CT, USA.
Hazy golden colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is hops, citrus, fruits.
Taste is hops, citrus, grapefruit, peach, slightly herbal.
Medium body, average carbonation.
47,3cl Can @ Star Wines & Spirits, Stamford, CT, USA.
Hazy golden colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is hops, citrus, tropical fruits.
Taste is hops, citrus, peach, mango.
Medium body, average carbonation.
47,3cl Can @ Star Wines & Spirits, Stamford, CT, USA.
Hazy golden colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is hops, citrus, grapes.
Taste is hops, citrus, grapes, slightly herbal and tart.
Medium body, average carbonation.
47,3cl Can @ Star Wines & Spirits, Stamford, CT, USA.
Dark amber colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is toasted malt, straw.
Taste is toasted malt, sweet, bread, slightly grassy.
Medium body, average carbonation.
This one is hard to categorize. I could have gone with fruit, but to me the lavender dominates the aroma, flavor, and even the appearance. Anyway, it’s purple. It’s hazy purple and smells like lavender and lemons. The flavor is heavy on the lavender with some underlying lemon and spice. It’s light, sweet, and kind of watery. It’s certainly odd. I didn’t hate it, but it doesn’t work too well.
47,3cl Can @ Star Wines & Spirits, Stamford, CT, USA.
Hazy golden colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is hops, citrus, tropical fruits.
Taste is hops, citrus, grapefruit, mango.
Medium body, average carbonation.
47,3cl Can @ Star Wines & Spirits, Stamford, CT, USA.
Amber colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is malt, straw.
Taste is malt, sweet, grain.
Medium body, average carbonation.
47,3cl Can @ Star Wines & Spirits, Stamford, CT, USA.
Hazy golden colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is malt, slightly hoppy and citrusy.
Taste follows the aroma.
Medium body, average carbonation.
Slightly hazy gold pour with a three finger chunky white head. Aroma of bright citrus and tropical fruit, cracker, spruce and tart fruitiness. Flavor is tropical fruit, bright citrus, light bready notes, sharp non-distinct fruitiness. Medium body, dry, but slightly oily, medium, sharp carbonation. Pretty good overall. Nothing too interesting, but it's definitely solid.
500mL bottle, pours a clear pale golden blonde with a small white head. Aroma brings out a bizarre mix of earthy coffee, oaky wood, and a touch of tart citrus. Flavour is quite tart, with plenty of citrus, which is then cut down by the earthy coffee grounds, and some gentle bugs. That's an odd flavour combo that somehow works very well. Coffee-ish, tart, and buggy finish. Nice stuff.
Aromas of big chocolate toffee cocoa nibs maple syrup tree bark roasted barley oak bourbon and malted barley. Taste is big sticky roasted barley maple syrup tree sap honey aged wort syrup toffee chocolate syrup cocoa nibs oak bourbon barrel wood malted barley corkscrew shoe leather and brown sugar. Overall, seriously tasty stuff. You love to see a great beer that is just beer and not relying on gimmicks and adjuncts.
330ml bottle. Pours a clear dark ruby with a small, creamy, long lasting, pale pink head that leaves curtains of lace. Sweet fruity aroma of caramel malt, cherry, almond and floral hops. Sweet fruity flavour of grainy wheat malt, cherry, light alcohol and floral hops in a dry, slightly tart finish. Medium body with a sticky, creamy, smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. One dimensional, but easy to drink and enjoyable.
On tap at brewery. Number one with a bullet. Hazy reddish brown pour. Creamy tan head. Sweet, toasted malt nose has nutty undertones. Flavor is toasted malt, caramel and mild herbal hops. Soft, sticky mouthfeel. Decent.
16 oz. can from the brewery. Pours a cloudy pinkish orange with a small white head that settles into a ring and small island of film. Peach is the dominant fruit here, followed by orange and lastly cranberry. There's some lemon and grape, as well, with berries, sweet and pale malts, acidity, and plum. Light-medium bodied, with moderate carbonation and a tart, fruity mouthfeel. Another great variant.
375ml bottle brewed in Belgium at 9.5%. Clear gold, hazing up with the whole bottle poured in, with a good-sized, active but fair-duration head. Classic aroma of barn floor meets dried and candied spritzy citrus peels on top of flatbread meets fruitcake malt. Modest carbonation. Mellow straw and barn funkiness. Nice malt breadth and complexity while keeping things light. Lovely and fruity, venturing from orange/lemon and pear to hints of peach and mango; semi-perfumed aftertaste, lightly drying. Pouring all the yeast in thickens the body and rounds things out with candied peel, banana bread, and just a touch of dark baking spice. Very, very good Tripel with Saison characteristics. Yeast out for more of a Saison, yeast in for more of a Tripel. Especially impressive balance in the delivery of sweet flavours wrapped up in a drying finish; you'd never think it was 9.5% ABV either, and in a good way.
On tap at the tasting room in Burien. Hazy golden color.  Light clove Hefeweizen aroma.  Crisp finish.  3.7.  Taste minus 1overall minus 2.
Clear gold pour with a three finger creamy white head that has great retention and leaves nice lacing. Aroma of pine, fruity, floral and citrus hops, caramel and light bready malt
Flavor is pine, pithy citrus, mineral, orange slice candy and a hint of dank. Medium body, slightly syrupy, mostly neutral feel, light to medium carbonation, off dry finish. Pretty good overall.
Juicy, sweet and a little tart. Somewhere between an IPA and a Sour. A nice balance. Easy to drink.
12 ounce can from brewery. Number one with a bullet. Bright yellow gold color. Large pillowy white head. Subtle, bready malt aroma. Flavor upfront is sharp, bitter hops on a bready malt base. Crisp and clean. Peppery hop finish. Easy drinking.
Hazy golden-orange colour with a frothy-bubbly white cap, good stay and some nice creamy-foamy lacing. Aromas are milder, but blended with some grassiness and fruitiness, giving a unique waxy, grainy feel. Wet, juicy, refreshing mouthfeel with some dryness building in the finish. Citrus zest, peel and juices for flavours, with the grassy hops balancing undertones. Not a bad mildly hoppy, fruity, juicy, yet dry IPA.
Victory’s Dry Hopped Series was successful in canning both Prima and Dirt Wolf. Poured at the source in D-Town, Braumeister Pils is dry hopped as well. Citrus burst, which is unusual for a Pilsner, on the nose is quite inviting. Appearance is golden with a soapy head and lacing. Super smooth. Bright and refreshing with a pleasant, hop bite on the finish. Why don’t they can this beer? IDK. Worth stopping at the brewery. 2 liter growler for $10.50! Cheers!
On tap at Cap Tap. Pours Golden with a modest white head and a floral aroma. There is a medium-bodied pale malt flavor with a dry finish.
Pint can.  Pours a copper orange color with a large sandy head.  Nose is quite sweet.. caramel, toffee, fruity esters, banana, and faint wood.  Tastes fairly sweet overall with light earthy notes.  Some modest bitterness in the finish.  More toffee, candied fruit, and brown sugar.
Clear pale gold pour with a two finger creamy to chunky white head that has good retention and leaves decent lacing. Aroma of cereal, honey, pale caramel, spicy and floral hops. Flavor is about the same with some light citrus peel and spicy bitterness and a hint of mineral and salinity to the finish. Decent overall, refreshing and balanced, but no standout notes.
SARAthon 2022. Pours a clear golden color with a white head. Fairly tannic and woody with a good bit of lemon, lime, and grape skin. Some zesty notes, a touch of bread, and some sweet stone fruits. Light malt sweetness in the background along with a hint of vanilla. Maybe a hint of tropical fruit? Some golden raisin, yeast, and grass. Still pretty solid.
Hazy golden-orange colour with a frothy-bubbly white cap, good stay and some nice creamy-foamy lacing. Aromas are milder, but blended with some grassiness and fruitiness, giving a unique waxy, grainy feel. Wet, juicy, refreshing mouthfeel with some dryness building in the finish. Citrus zest, peel and juices for flavours, with the grassy hops balancing undertones. Not a bad mildly hoppy, fruity, juicy, yet dry IPA.
473mL can, pours a cloudy golden yellow with a medium white head. Nose brings out plenty of oaky notes, earthy hops, a touch of citrus, and some pithy tropical fruitiness. Flavour is very juicy, with lots of tropical fruits, bold citrus hops, a touch of earthiness, almost no foeder notes, and minimal pithiness. Vibrant, bright, juicy, and nicely hopped, with some gentle funkiness creeping in at the end. For a double hazy, this manages to avoid the usual traps in the style (chalkiness, murkiness, pithiness) and still packs some hops and vibrant juiciness. Very good.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy deep yellow with a medium sized head. Fruity, dank citrus, grapefruits, melons and creamy.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy golden color with a medium sized head. Dank citrus, grapefruits, some fruitiness and some hop burn and creamy finish.
16oz can shared by Highendtully and consumed on a Mon night at home. Pours a coffee black with really no hint of frothy head. Nose is predominantly coffee with caramel, maple characteristics. Taste is actually well balanced with quality coffee notes and well placed maple syrup elements. Some good chocolate components and finish feels like you just finished a sip of coffee after a giant bite of a pancake. Excellent.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy golden color with a medium sized head. Citrus, floral notes and tropical fruits with a creamy body.
the aroma: fruity, floral, hints of banana, melon, esters, garden sweet fuits, herbs...
the taste: fruity, herbal, notes of banana, apple, toffee, melon, grasses...
the aftertaste: sweet, bitter, dry...
Black body with tan head.  Big malty aroma.  Big malty taste with a bit of booziness and some hop.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy golden color with a medium sized head. Fruity, tropical notes, citrus and pineapples.
Pours hazy orange amber with a one finger, white head.  Aroma is banana, caramel and bread.  Taste is strong banana and caramel, moving to bread and clove.  Finish is banana bread.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy and little dirty golden color with a medium sized head. Citrus, tropical fruitiness, floral, and grapefruits.
19.2 fl oz can from Grocery Outlet. Hazy orange golden pour, thin foamy white head. Fruity aroma, balance of citrus and tropical fruit. Mild fruity, juicy taste, light zesty. Not too exciting, but extremely drinkable.
Orange body with white head.  Citrusy aroma, pineapple and tangerine.  Fruity taste lemon, blueberry, mango tangerine.  Long fruity finish.  Not to sweet/
