fresh can that pours slightly hazy pale yellow with a small white cap offering some retention and lacing. very intricate blend of spices, very far from overwhelming, never can we point out a particular spice (which is awesome and a very rare thing), touch of strawberry sugars, not in a jam mode, lots of citrusy hops but not that hoppy big deal, lemon sqeeze light tartness, spot on tartness in fact, salt. moderate carbonation, light body - oily; tart and spicy lemony finish. incredible strawberry (that stands out) lassi tart hoppy ale, whatever that is.
Aroma is toffee/caramel and mild fruit.  The flavor is fruit/citrus, malts and a slightly sugar sweet/piney hop finish.
Pale amber head with a thin white head and some spots of lacing ….. aroma of bready malts, toasted malts, caramel malts, biscuits, earthy and nutty  … taste is of bready and toasted malts, caramel malts, biscuits, earthy and nutty ….. bitter hoppy bite … finish is of biscuits, bready malts, caramel malts …. Really tasty brew
Canned 8/30/22, drunk 9/19/22.
Heavily hazy-turbid orange juice.  Medium-to-small, white head of low retention.
Big peach nose is well-homogenized with the hops and there's a fruity, "rich" yeast character and juicy tropical fruits on the back-end.  Big biscuit and honey from the malt, nonetheless well-attenuated, it seems.  No alcohol, flaw, resin.
Excellent peach character, similar to Jammy's apricot character.  Juicy, leathery, chewy, lightly/pleasingly acidic and not overbearing, but authentic and integrated with the hops.  Rich, sumptuous malt, moderately sweet but still reasonably attenuated.  Honey, white bread and light watermelon-like yeast character on the finish.  Tropical, peachy, pleasingly bitter/acidic and balanced with no alcohol or flaw.
Can (7/14/22) pour from Candia Road Convenience. It's an opaque light brown with tons of sparkle, finger-width off-white head with excellent retention and thick rings of lacing. Aroma is strong sweet nondescript mix of pineapple, bubblegum, citrus. Taste is strong tropical fruit with late bread. Mouthfeel is medium side of light-to-medium bodied with smooth, frothy texture, average carbonation and finish as taste. Overall, nice and sweet but without a true identity.
Draft at Radio Coffee and Beer. Pours yellow with very little head. Leaves a solid amount of lacing in the glass. It’s absolutely bursting with banana and clove on the nose and tongue. Finished clean. Damn fine example of the style.
Refrigerated 12 oz can, May 13, 2022, poured into a weizen glass.  Hazy golden with small white head.  Aroma is soft wheat, medium body, medium carbonation, and little lacing.  Taste is is soft wheat, orange, and some coriander.
the aroma: fruity, floral, hints of citrus, apple, flowers, herbs, grain...
the taste: caramel and herbal, notes of apple, toffee, flowers, grass hop, citrus peel...
the aftertaste: sweet, bitter, dry...
Clear straw body with a couple fingers of head. Aroma is mild roasted, easy dry grains. Taste is mild sweetness, balanced. Texture is crisp.
9/19/22 - Maumelle, AR - Lake Liquor - 12 oz can. Frosty light golden-orange pour, tight snow-white head sticks around a while. Fruity aroma, Jolly Rancher watermelon flavor candy comes to mind. Nice pucker quality to the flavor, wouldn't pick up the pomegranate if it wasn't on the label and I sure don't know what Lychee Green Tea tastes like. Pick up some apricot sourness, a touch of brininess. Nice spritz to the mouthfeel.
16 oz. Aroma has notes of cantaloupe, pine, bready malt. Pours hazy yellow-orange with a one finger cream white head with great retention. Taste has a light to moderate pithy bitterness and average NEIPA sweetness. Lovely pillowy mouthfeel.
Can (1 pint). Pours gold with off-white head and some lacing. Soft malt and tropical fruit aroma. Soft cracker malt with tropical fruit overtop. Medium body. Medium-length finish.
Hazy orange pour with aroma of orange and pineapple with hints of coconut.  Sweet flavors of orange, coconut, and pineapple with hint of sour. Really nice.
Refrigerated 12 oz can, January 25, 2022, poured into a weizen glass.  Hazy golden with medium white head.  Aroma is wheat esters, medium body, medium carbonation, and little lacing.  Taste is wheat esters and
Pale golden pour with a thin white head and thin bands of lacing …. Aroma of juicy hops, fruity, tropical pineapple, papaya, citrusy grapefruit, sweet orange and chewy caramel malts …. Taste is of juicy fruit, tropical fruits, pineapple, orange, caramel malts, papaya, rindy grapefruit and bitter dry hops …. Finish is of bitter dry hops, tropical fruits, pineapple, papaya, grapefruit and orange … sessionable and tasty
12oz can from Center Market. Pours out lightly cloudy, golden, fine head fades to patchy coverage. Light hoppy aroma with fruity notes. Taste really pops, hoppy, sweet, piney, citrus. Really grabs the palate and let's the bitterness linger. Solid IPA.
Canned 8/29/22, drunk 9/19/22.
Heavily hazy, bronze-pineapple-golden.  Small, off-white head, low retention.
Beautiful apricot character, wow.  Bright, lightly acidic, lightly juicy, fully authentic.  Juicy Julius with heavily fruity yeast and a good mix of honey and biscuit.  Clean, no resin, no pine, no twang, no alcohol, no flaw.
Juicy, almost chewy.  You can practically taste the chewy, succulent, lightly acidic, heavily fruity dried apricot.  Citrus balances alongside well-attenuated cracker and honey-like malts with clean yeast, no resin and ample hop bitterness on the finish.  An excellent adjunct addition to a tried and true beer.
Can from Tavour. Pours clear copper with a moderate off-white head. Aroma is mild roasty malt with a lot of fruit and resin. Doesn't seem tropical tho. Med body at least. It has a lot of resin, not exactly pine, not a touch of citrus. Dry. Bitter. Delicious. I apparently cannot parse this flavor mix, but, very tasty ale. Would definitely do it again.
Pours hazy amber with a one finger, white head.  Aroma is citrus, tropical fruit, caramel and lacto.  Taste is passion fruit, caramel and pomegranate, moving to tart orange and light lemon.  Finish is sweet passion fruit, tart orange and pomegranate.
cans. pours hazy very light yellow with a small white cap offering some retention and lacing. super softly herbal and floral with a tiny lemon splash, almost like pale orange juice, distant white spicy foeder, white peppery grapes, touch of super dry pineapples, squeaky clean yeast action. moderate carbonation, light body - thin but not watery; dry, crisp yet mellow floral-herbal-spicy-citrusy. stunning delicate complexness in all its simplicity. another incredible offering in this already superb series.
Tap taster. Poured clear golden color with an average frothy white head that lasted with very good lacing. Moderate floral balanced aroma.  Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Moderate crisp sweet flavor with a moderate sweet finish of short to medium duration. This soft beer met my expectations.
Aroma is big tropical fruit-citrus and resinous hops.  The flavor is tropical fruit/mangoes, malts and a resinous/spicy hop/slightly sweet finish.
Draft taster. Poured clear bronze color with an average creamy off-white head that was lasting with good lacing. Medium to heavy pumpkin, cinnamon and nutmeg aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture and soft carbonation. Medium pumpkin spice sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. This is a good beer.
A very nice light lager. A touch of corn sweetness, but not much else. Refreshing and pleasant. Tried with Jess at the brewery in 2022.
Jess’s favorite brew during our first visit to the brewery in 2022. Pours like yellow lemonade, but the thick sweet fruitiness is tropical. Very solid.
Canned 8/10/22, drunk 9/19/22.
Heavily hazy, peachy-passion fruit juice with a small, thin, white head.
Smells like passion fruit the way Tree House does it; which is to say, dry, somewhat acidic, funky/earthy.  High mineral, low-to-moderate white wine-like Nelson with no sulfur and little/no pine.  Soft, honey-accented malts seem well-attenuated, with fruity, but clean yeast and no resin or alcohol.
Bitterness still balances easily the softly honey-like malts with well-attenuated malts and a medium to medium-light body overall.  Nelson is full of passion fruit and moderate mineral.  Juicy, pine-accented, no sulfur, low white wine.  Maybe a bit passed its prime here, but it's certainly clean and dry and what hop flavor and passion fruit character there is, is done well.
Liked this stout almost as much as their milk stout. Also quite sweet, but of a darker chocolate variety. Dark brown and deep roasty aroma. Tried with Jess at the brewery in 2022.
Black pour with a deep orange hue, thin beige head and lots of bands of sticky lacing …. Aroma of pine, roasted malts, dank and resinous hops, chocolate, caramel malts, grapefruit and orange …. Taste is of roasted malts, pine, dank and resinous hops, chocolate, rindy grapefruit, orange and caramel malts ….. smooth and creamy mouthfeel …. Rich and medium bodied …. Finish is creamy, roasted and of pine, dank and resinous grapefruit along with chocolate and caramel malts …. This is a great brew, I wish it had more pine, but the flavors are outstanding. Very sessionable and deliciously smooth
Really solid sweet stout. Pours dark brown with a thick molasses and milk chocolate sweetness. Tried with Jess at the brewery in 2022.
A nice IIPA, which for once isn’t hazy. Pours clear dark gold, bold citrus and tropical fruit happiness. Tried with Jess at the brewery during our first visit in 2022.
the aroma: fruity, hoppy, hints of mango, orange, spruce, tangerine, lychee, spicy herbs...
the taste: fruity, hoppy, notes of sweet and bitter orange, tangerine, spruce needles, mango, lychee, kumquat, spicy grasses...
the aftertaste: sweet, bitter, dry...
A very solid hazy IPA. Super juicy, mostly grapefruit and tropical fruit. Smooth mouthfeel pleasant. Tried during my first visit to the brewery in 2022.
Can from Tavour. Pours clear dark amber with a beige head. Aroma is bready malt, but somewhat towards pumpernickel. Sweetish. Med body. Mildly roasty/bready with some floral/grass notes. Not dry, and less than moderately bitter. It's very good tho.
750-ml bottle from rare beer club. good slowly bubbly head, meaty peaty nose, creamy, super peaty boozy sweet malty.
[Can (500ml)] As 'Czechvar Dark Lager'. Pours a deep ruby-brown with a large lasting frothy tan head. Lightly toasted malt aroma along with hints of nuts, honey, coffee and caramel. Malty flavour along with nuts, caramel and coffee again, not too sweet which is nice. Light bitter finish. Light to average bodied. Decent enough, easy to drink.
Solid, as far as American smoked beers go. I’ve not had many good takes on this style, especially when the smoke isn’t buried in roasted malt. This one pours dark red and has a definite smoke aroma - flavor peeks through bready background from beginning to end. Tried with Emma, mom, and dad at the Beer Lounge in 2022.
Definitely tropical fruit and the faintest of floral aroma. Pours clear and gold. Tried it from a cask with Emma, mom, and dad at the Beer Lounge in 2022.
Pours clear straw yellow with a short-lived frothy ivory head. Aroma provides zesty lemon and, of course, honey. Flavor offers the same, with honey sweetness nicely balancing lemony tartness. Texture gives up fair body and fizz. Viva DragonCon.
A solid stout. Pours dark brown with a thick light brown head. Sweet chocolate, some light roasted coffee. Tried with Emma, mom, and dad at the Beer Lounge in 2022.
Crowler thanks to Mo. Pours black with small tan head that lasts. The aroma is chocolate malt, coconut, and vanilla. Slick body, milk chocolate, toasted coconut, sweet, hides alcohol well, very nice.
A dessert beer and disturbingly similar to Neapolitan ice cream. Mostly chocolate, but the vanilla is there. The strawberry is what makes this different. I would’ve call it good, but its accurate. Tried with Emma, mom, and dad at the Beer Lounge in 2022.
Pours thick black with a two finger, dark tan head.  Aroma is cocoa, coconut, roast and vanilla.  Taste is chocolate, moving to vanilla, roast and coconut.  Finish is Mounds bar.
12 oz can from Total Wine. Pours a cloudy yellow-gold color with a small white head and decent retention. Almost no lacing. Faint lime aroma. Grainy lager flavor with the same faint tart lime note in the finish. Highly carbonated. Light body. Not bitter. Very macro taste. Harmless enough. Decent pool beer.
Very cloudy/hazy orange yellow pour. Thick fluffy white head. The aroma is lovely. Bright pink grapefruit, tangerine skin, juicy with a bit of light pine. Lovely and fruity with a really clean, fruity hop flavour. Juicy, fruity, and lightly sweet. Medium bodied. Delicious.
Can picked up from a Beer Republic webshop, Breda, Netherlands and consumed at home Monday 19th September 2022 listening to Ströme - Nr2, we're reheating the Cod Fishcakes with Tomato sauce. Pours hazy gold with a white head. Pithy citrus, lemon, dry, bitter and yet with a little sweetness. Really hoppy, really decent for such a modestly priced beer.
A pretty decent flavored saison. Has a touch of the saison character, mostly banana, but it has a sticky sweet rhubarb finish. Pretty pleasant on a hot day driving home from Unbound in 2022.
the aroma: hoppy, fruity, hints of grapefruit, orange, pine, pomelo, spicy herbs...
the taste: hoppy, fruity, notes of bitter orange, grapefruit, pine needles, lemon peel, spicy grasses...
the aftertaste: bitter, dry...
Tap at Explorium. Oily, burnt caramel aroma. The lime peel is not at all desirable, pretty much kills it. Too sweet, lacks balance. Pretzely Vienna tone, but too thick. A good idea, but poorly executed.
Single from Whole Paycheck in July. Back of the fridge till now(September). 7.3%, no mention of grapefruit on the can.

Pint glass @home. Very soft golden haze that's more like fog. Second pour gets it looking like yeasty endtrails. Thin, frail, eggshell head.

Mostly grapefruit with a bit of apple & hay.

Taste is super mellow earth, juicy pine, salt & barely lingering grapefruit pith. Bittersweet.

Frothy, amble soft bubbles, but very light weight body. ABV feels small. Quiet.

Beach ipa. Okay to good.
Tap at Cox's Yard, Stratford-Upon-Avon. Light amber, clear, well-formed off-white top. This one was quite malty and clean with caramel, orange, light herbal bitterness; drags after a while. It's not very hoppy in a modern context so more of an English IPA but doesn't compare to 'Proper Job' which is a great balance between old and new styles.
Lighter easier mouthfeel, supporting citrus and tropical flavours. Aniversary set.
Pours hazy mango into a tulip. White head with medium retention recedes to hug rim. Mango and papaya aromas. Soft with sweet mango, passion fruit and hot caramel upfront turning to mild pith and peel in the medium length finish.
Tap at Explorium downtown. Body, general feel is correct, but as is almost regular at this point, not really hopped to style. Still drinks more like a beer than most hazy stuff, an enjoyable change of pace. Simcoe works, other hops don't.
Can from Beer52. Semi-hazy gold with nice white top. Aroma of passionfruit, pineapple, mango, some green notes. Taste is also very fruity and tropical, sweet middle and slightly more bitter than your average NEIPA but gives nice balance. Medium bodied but goes down easily, fine carbonation. A fine beer.
Pint, canned 09/13/22. Pours clear golden with a creamy half inch head. Aroma has papaya, spicy banana, coconut, and white grape. Tastes of coconut, green banana, lemon, then touches of white pepper and hay in the finish. Near-medium bodied with a creamy mouthfeel. Dry leaning with a mildly astringent finish. Very interesting flavors, seemingly from an unusual yeast and hop blend.
Black color, small brown head. Aromas of vanilla, alcohol, chocolate, biscuits and slight caramel. Taste of vanilla, alcohol, chocolate, caramel and biscuits.
Funk, clove, coriander, lime, salt. Not awful but that clove/coriander spice is just not a flavor I like, especially in beer and especially if I'm eating tacos.
Unclear golden color, large beige head. Aromas of citrus, yeast, apricot, wheat and floral hints. Taste of citrus, malt, resin, floral hops, yeast and cough drops.
500ml pop-top bottle from the Offie, Leicester and drunk at home. Light gold, clear with visible carbonation and a large white head. Light aroma of sweet grain, lemon zest, floral notes. Sweet tastte, some bready yeast. Light astringent hop of the finish. Heavy carbonation on the lighter oily body. Nothing too fancy about this one, but it's a decent helles.
Unclear pale golden color, medium sized white head. Aromas of citrus, wheat, coriander and lemonade. Taste of lemonade, wheat, alcohol and slight coriander.
Brown color, small beige head. Aromas of roasted malt, wort bread, nuts, hops and slight syrup. Taste of whole grain bread, wort, nuts and slight caramel.
Pours a hazy, lemon-grapefruit yellow, with smallish head. Aroma is very dank, with sharp cheese, sour washcloth, citrus and tropical fruit. Flavor follows. Very mild level of hop bitterness in the finish. Soft mouthfeel.
With Z, pours a thick orange color. Nose is tart mango and passion fruit. Nose is tart mango. Grainy tropical tart finish.
Pale golden color, medium sized beige head. Aromas of citrus, grass, bread and hops. Taste of grass, citrus, hops and malt.
Mahogany color, large beige head. Aromas of bread, caramel, nuts and slight syrup. Taste of malt, nuts, wood, brown sugar, hops and slight smoke.
Tap at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours opaque dark amber, with very fine white foam. Aroma is fruity, figs, though delicate. Body is fairly full, with average carbonation. Taste is fairly sweet, but with a surprisingly dry final.
Tap at Lakefront. Very thin, Pale tan body. Looks like a cider. Drinks very thin and watery, with some underlying seltzer tones. Apple tone as well. Agave flavor comes through, but the overall product is pretty weak.
On tap at the brewery in north Seattle.  Hazy golden color.  Very nice citra and dank thiol rich aroma.   Medium plus oatmeal body.  Strong citric acid finish.  Pretty good.
Pours orange-tinged copper into a nonic. White head with medium retention recedes to hug rim. Dark caramel aromas. Crisp and dry with sweet caramel and mild licorice upfront turning to earthy bark in the lasting finish.
Golden color, small white head. Aromas of bread, butter, hops and minerals. Taste of malt, grass and hops.
On tap at the brewery in north Seattle. Deep pink color. Strong watermelon aroma.  I think I’m being served by the brewer, whole looks like the guy on the cans with a beard nit hat and glasses.  Light sweetness and tartness.  Pretty good.
Pale golden color, small white head. Aromas of malt, grass and minerals. Taste of malt, grass and dough.
Can. Pours a golden orange with an off white orange head and tropical fruit aroma. Taste is sweet up front, lots of mango and tropical fruits with sweet fruit notes into the long, tropical fruit, sweet finish.
A hazed blonde ale with a thin lacing white head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with light tropical fruits, Epsom salts, OK. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with tropical fruits, light acidity, light mineral notes, OK. On tap at brewery.
16 ounce can from The Blue Bottle in Hendersonville.  Orange like pour with some hops and a bit of bitterness. Decent overall.
Can from The Beerhive. Hazy golden body with a few tiny flecks beneath an off-white head. Low carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of lemon, flower stems and orange zest. Flavour of orange, apricot and herbs. Medium body with a smooth mouthfeel. Light fizz. It’s full on and flavoursome, but, for me, lacks drinkability.
Tap at Lakefront. Unfiltered amber-brown body, this beige head. Big coffee in the aroma. Pretty pleasant beer, the coffee and amber malt really merge together well. Smooth brown coffee and brown malts. Really good for the style.
Can from The Beerhive. Dark brown body with a beige head that holds well. Good lacing. Aroma of coffee beans, hazelnut and a hint of green pepper. Flavour follows the aroma. Medium body with a frothy mouthfeel. Soft fizz. A tasty coffee beer with an intense aroma.
Canned, 440 ml shared with Miro B. Hazy yellow, white head. Fruity, hoppy, bitterish finish. Bit watery.
2019 whiskey barrel, 15.2%. Cloudy deep amber color.  Fantastic toasted oak barrel aroma of vanilla and coconut.  Alcohol prominent, but well balanced with the brown sugar sweetness.  Excellent.
Pours a largely clear, dark brown, the color of tea, with smallish head. Aroma is grass, malt, some hops. Flavor is grass, malt, hops. Smooth, crisp, clean mouthfeel.
A hazed blonde ipa with a thin lacing white. In aroma, sweet fruity biscuit malt with citrusy floral hops, tropical fruit, pleasant. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with tropical fruits, very nice. On tap at brewery.
Tap at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours dark red, towards plum, with fine cream foam. Aroma is intensely fruity, some oxidation and quite an alcoholic feeling, a little excessive. Body and carbonation are average. Taste is rather sweet, like a classic Belgian, with a little hint of acidity. Final is fairly long, sweet and fruity.
On tap at the brewery in west woodland. High clarity light golden color.  Light sulphurous lager yeast aroma.  Light corn sweetness.  Well done to style.
Cloudy golden with medium white head. Hoppy, bit tropical, citrus. Bitterish finish. Easy drinkable.
Very slightly hazy pale gold with a frothy white head and just a touch of stewed fruit on the nose. Very crisp with soft bitterness which sweetens out to a dry fruity finish
On tap at the Oktoberfest 2022. Quite a rich reddish gold (clearly darker than the Augustiner one). Malty sweet and balanced with a decent bitter note. Good.
Cask Handpump at Swan With Two Necks, Macclesfield 02/05/2017 Some fruit aroma. Pillowy white head. Amber coloured and fruity with a hint of bitterness in a dry malt finish.
16oz can from market in Rockaway Beach. Pale, hazy golden, small foamy head. Light citrusy, malty aroma. Taste is coming off as fruity pils, but it's ice cold and I'm drinking from the can.
Cask at Drunken Duck, Vicenza. Pours amber with medium white head. Malty, biscuit, some grassy notes. Bitter finish. Medium bodied. Good.
440ml can from Morrisons. Hazy orange with a fluffy white head. Aroma is orange, maybe a little pine, flavour is sweet but bitter citrus, a touch of caramel
--Bottled, from Systembolaget. -- Hazy pale golden, rich firm head. Spicy, grassy nose. Mid dry with light to medium body and crisp, rounded mouthfeel. Intense spicy grassy hops on solid, yet slender bready, grainy, aromatic malt. Long bitter finish. Hoppy and pilsnerish - punching well above it's size.
Hazy pale gold with a small bubbly white head and a soft, fruity aroma. Has a sharpish kick of grapefruit bitterness up front and a long, dry finish with mellow fruity notes
On tap at the brewery in West Woodlands, WA. Beautiful straw color, almost clear.  Nice light coriander and orange peel notes.  Medium plus wheat body and creamy mouthfeel.  Wit is a great style.
330ml bottle. Clear dark brown with a thin beige head. Aroma of sweet toffee and caramel. Taste of toffee, caramel, dark fruits, light chocolate and coffee notes, biscuit. Light-medium bodied. Nice one.
Draft at Tradesman's. Foggy pale yellow. Slim soft foam. No lace. Slightly hoppier than most but not particularly dank or bitter, just a bit grassy. Cornmeal crackers with a bit of moss. Soft and mild but also well balanced. Does not have the typical clean Lager finish but that's not a bad thing. Quaffable.
A golden ipa with a thin very thin white head. In aroma, nice biscuit malt with resinous hops, light mineral notes, pleasant. In mouth, a nice biscuit malt with resinous hops, light mineral notes, treacle, pleasant. On tap at brewery.
Grapefruit juice and coconut milk colored pour. Juice and spices with a bitter berry palate.
On tap at the brewery in West Woodlands, WA.  High clarity light golden color.   Very nice strong fresh green hop aroma.  Huge dense white foam.  Well done!
On tap at Valhalla Zagreb. Dark brown coloured, medium sized beige head, light chocolate in the nose. Light roasted malt, chocolate, some caramel, touch of wood with dry bitterish roasty finish. Not bad.
Gold pour. Thin foam. Even lace. Weed, hops, malt, and lemon grass.  Weed palate. Medium bodied. Medium carbonation.
--Sample, thanks oh6gdx! -- Hazy golden, mid sized head. Citric blood grape aroma. Tart and citric with medium to full body and rounded mouthfeel. Some loafy malt, puckering citric acid and bloodgrape juice. No bitterness. OK-ish, but extremely one dimensional.
Red pour. No foam. Sour Raspberry and blackberry flavor. Raspberry finish. No carbonation.
Fruit nose. Gold pour. Thin foam. Grapefruit flavor with a pear and citrus palate. Medium carbonation. 
On tap at the brewery in West Woodland, WA.  Light pinkish hue.  Medium acidity. Lots of fresh cherry flavor.  Nice Brett L aroma.  Really well done.
On Tap at 1st Berries, Beans & Beer Festival, Crewe Heritage Centre 29/04/2017 Massive fruit aroma. Small white head. Amber golden coloured hazy in appearance hoppy and very fruity mango flavour with a hint of dryness in a crisp and bitter malt finish.
Sour grapefruit flavor.  Milky pour and light bodied. Light carbonation. Grapefruit palate.
A lightly hazed golden ipa with a thin lacing white head. In aroma, nice biscuit malt with resinous hops, light citrus pulp, nice and smooth. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity biscuit malt with resinous floral hops, grapefruit pulp, light citrus, pleasant. On tap at brewery.
Black pour. Thin creamy foam. Molasses nose. Chocolate and cocoa flavor with a coffee finish. No carbonation.
Bottle 0.75l. Cloudy, gold colored. AROMA- citrusy, Šumavské jahůdky candies, herbal leaves. FLAVOR- neutral to dry, moderately bitter, citrusy, apple, apricot, peach, meadow grass, herbal leaves, oaty. Medium bodied.
Drinkable.
Orange pour. Thin foam. Honey nose. Sweet honey flavor with a malt presence. Malt and Honey Wheat palate.
--Sample, thanks oh6gdx! -- The palest hint of golden, coarse minimal head. Mostly water in the aroma - perhaps some breadcrumbs. Lightly sweet with hints of wort in an ocean filled with water. No bitterness. Makes tap water feel full bodied.
Slighy hazy golden orange pour. Thin foam. Sweet nose sweet white grape flavor. Taste  of white grape juice. Sweet palate  
(can, from lcbo) Beatiful amber colour, slight pine flavour and aroma, but well balanced. Not normally much of a lager drinker, but had to check this one out, as I love amber ales, and was pleasantly surprised. Would love to have this at t
he cottage.
Pinkish gold pour. Thin foam clear pour. Malt flavor with a pecan finish. Dry palate.
Pink hazy pour. Thick creamy foam. Even lace. Sour flavor of guava and tropical fruits. Grapefruit palate. 

Half-litre can: BB 9th June 2023. Bought in a 'night shop' while staying in Cochem last week, drank at home on 19th September 2022. Cheap supermarket Pils and it shows! Decent enough look, bright, clean and clear light golden body, white head that tried to stay (but failed). Mini grainy front to the nose and taste, but not enough to get excited about. It's pretty poor to be honest.
330ml bottle from Tartarus online shop.  Black.  Aroma of burnt orange, smoked wood chips, vanilla, burnt bread and molasses.  Smooth.  Loads of burnt flavours and some smokiness in the mix as well.  This is really tasty.
On tap at the brewery.  Nice Brett aroma of apricot and pineapple.  High clarity light golden color. Medium body.  Light acidity.  Well done.
440ml can from Morrisons. Gluten Free. Slightly hazy golden colour, bubbly white foam head leaving lacing and aroma of fruity orange citrus. Taste is sweetish, malt, caramel, orangey, citrusy, pine, with hoppy bitterness. Medium bodied soft carbonation, dry bitter finish. Nicely drinkable.
Green gold pour. Thin foam. Hops and malt presence but not so strong. Some funk palate
Pours a hazy, golden pineapple color, with smallish head. Aroma is stone fruit, citrus, tropical fruit. Flavor follows, with other floral notes. Lightly sweet with a moderate level of hoppy bitterness in the finish. Soft mouthfeel.
Half-litre can, drank at home on 19th September 2022 while watching the Queen's funeral on TV (after some Sherry, Port and wine). Clean and clear golden body, white topping. Decent enough Helles, slightly malty, very slightly hoppy; aroma understated and mostly not anything. OK, it was wet and thirst quenching, but lacked depth, flavour and 'oomph'.
Draft at Tradesman's. Murky yellow/orange with soft white foam. Feels like a Session NEIPA. Modestly juicy. Medium-light body. Strong tropical citrus. Honey tangerines. Pineapple. Mango. Cantaloupe. Mild pine dankness. Slight earthiness but not overly complex.
On Tap at 1st Berries, Beans & Beer Festival, Crewe Heritage Centre 29/04/2017 Vanilla aroma. Tiny white head. Dark coloured smooth on the palate and fruity with a hint of dryness in a crisp vanilla and chocolate malt finish.
Choc A Bloc Stout. ABV 8.1%  black pour.   tan creamy foam. Cocoa nose. Chocolate Molasses and vanilla caramel. Vanilla palate.
Deep dark brown, verging on black, with a tan foam that settles to a thin lace. Treacle and a little coffee on the nose, then sweet and lightly burnt-bitter and hoppy, more treacle and touches of coffee and cola, rich and heavy yet with a lightness in the mid-body. A little sticky-sweet on the finish, lifted by the cola and a hint of dark fruit. Good. Thanks, Jan!
Black pour. Thin foam. Creamy head.   Coffee cocoa vanilla with dark unsweetened cocoa  palate.
--Canned, from Systembolaget. -- Murky orange colour, rihcbut brief head. Somewhat buttery mango aroma. Sweetish with medium body and clean mouthfeel. Mango and notes of metal. Mostly pointless beer in a mostly hopeless style.
clear dark gold colour, medium sized off-white head; aroma of pear, peach, grainy, hay and some floral notes; taste is the same with some hoppy bitterness; not among the best Belgian ales, but at least drinkable
Hazy pour. Grapefruit  with some citrus flavor.  Grapefruit palate. Some pith and peel.  
Hazy light gold pour. Thin foam. Spice and banana nose. Even lace. Sweet banana flavor with a kick of spice. A total banana palate.
Clean grass nose. Clear yellow, medium snow white head. Sweet grass initially, plastic and chemical notes bring up the rear, however. Light body, easy carbonation.
--Sample, thanks oh6gdx! -- Black, small head. Chocolatey nose with some coffee. Mid sweet with light body and rounded mouthfeel. Lots of coffee some dark chocolte, notes of caramel. Fairly low bitterness. Harmonious and likeable.
Gold pour. Thin foam.  Lemongrass, citrus zest, floral, and carbon flavor. Citrus palate. Easy carbonation
Crystal clear golden with a very slight copper tinge, and a thin foamy white head. Pale and lightly toasty nose with lots of blood orange citrus and a gentle bit of fruit candy. Crisp dry body with a little blood orange citrusiness and a subtle bit of orange candy. Otherwise clean and crushable.
On Tap at 1st Berries, Beans & Beer Festival, Crewe Heritage Centre 29/04/2017 Fruity aroma. Beige head. Black a little rich on the palate and hoppy with a mint flavour. A hint of bitterness in a dry roast finish.
Can: Poured a pitch-black color stout with a large dark brown foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of floral coffee notes with some black chocolate notes is quite enticing. Taste is a nice mix of floral coffee notes with some roasted notes and black chocolate notes with light bitterness. Body is quite full with good carbonation. Solid coffee stout.
Hazy pale yellow-orange body, thin clumping cream head. Aroma citrus (pink grapefruit and tangerine). Body tart, creamy, and juicy, with pineapple, citrus, and a modest earthy-piny bitterness. Balanced; on the dry side.
--Sample, thanks oh6gdx! Dark rown, small head. Generous aroma of caramel and coffee. Mid sweet withmedium to full body and rounded mouthfeel. Lots of caramel, lots of coffee. Not at all complex, but balanced and pleasant.
Copper body, medium to thick cream head. Aroma toasty with notes of brown sugar. Body cerealy and fruity with toasted sugars. Well-balanced.
On Tap at 1st Berries, Beans & Beer Festival, Crewe Heritage Centre 29/04/2017 Light golden coloured hazy in appearance hoppy and fruity lime flavour. Slightly sour with a hint of dryness in a salty finish.
Deep sanguine red-brown body, thick cream head leaving curtains of lacing. Aroma and body characterized by toasted cereal (Cheerios), spice, pine, and brown sugar. Nicely hopped, well-balanced, and rich. A standout.
(Bottle) Pale golden colour with frothy, white head. Fruity, floral nose with notes of citrus, lemon, elderflower, roses, honey and white bread. Fruity, floral, tart taste with citrus, elderflower, roses, red-currant, honey and a dry and tart finish with low (hardly any) bitterness. Light body, dry. Tasty and refreshing. Very nice.
On Tap at 1st Berries, Beans & Beer Festival, Crewe Heritage Centre 29/04/2017 Big fruit aroma. Tiny white head. Amber coloured cloudy in appearance and very fruity peach flavour with a little sourness. A hint of dryness in a slightly salty finish.
330ml bottle from Beer Necessities, Bristol.  Really dark amber.  Aroma is really complex.  There’s dried fruit, spices, dates, fudge, sultanas, brown sugar, sweet grains and cherries.  Really full flavoured.  Quite a nice spicy edge to it.  Lovely sweet flavours balanced with an edge of bitterness, like orange peal.  Bloody delicious.
--Canned, from Systembolaget. -- Hazy golden, small head. Aroma of tangerine and cooked vegetables. Mid dry with light to medium body and clean, rounded mouthfeel. Lychee and tangerine, soe disturbing cabbage. Mid bitter finish
440ml can. Hazy, dark yellow-ish, golden colour with average to huge, thick, frothy to creamy, osteoporosing, minimally lacing, white head. Sweet-ish, slightly sugary, pale malty and citrusy fruity, hoppy aroma, notes of mandarine and orange, some zesty and leafy aspects, waxy overtones. Taste is sweet-ish, sugary, pale malty, bitter, zesty, slightly citrusy fruity hoppy and yeasty, peppery spicy, notes of bitter orange, grapefruit peel.
Watery texture, dry palate, medium, mildly prickly carbonation.
Disharmonious, unbalanced, predominant zesty bitterness - meh!
Enjoyed: Poured from a bottle into trappist glass.
Appearance: Blurry ocher/orange colour, creamy small head with nice lacing. 
Aroma: Malt, grains, dusty, hops.
Palate: Light body, gentle carbonation.
Taste: Malt, grains, cloves, yeast, gently bitter aftertaste.
Overall impression: Easy, drinkable, unobtrusive/pleasant, but still nothing remarkable).
--Sample, thanks oh6gdx! -- Hazy pale amber, coarse head. Perfmy nse with dried apricots. Mid sweet with ligt body and clean mouthfeel. Fruity with apricots and crackers. Long bitter finish.
.33 bottle. Hazy pale gold, low, creamy, stable, white head, nice lacing. Aroma flowers, slightly fruity, grapes, biscuits. Taste rather dry, on the thin side. Carbonation medium to low. Bitterness medium, grassy, herbal. Aftertaste biscuits, white fruit, grapes, flowers. Nice. Different from what one might expect from a lager.
Pours a hazy, grapefruit juice color, with minimal head. Aroma is dank, with some green onion/sharp cheese, along with the citrus and tropical fruit. Flavor is citrus and tropical fruit, with a dank note, grass, onion. A touch of sweetness with a very mild level of hop bitterness at the finish. Soft mouthfeel. Good...
9.9.2022: From tap at Zürich Beer Festival, 8.5% ABV. Very hazy dark yellow color with a white head. The aroma is hoppy with some orange, tangerine, mango, some papaya, some litchi, some biscuity malt, some dank notes and onions. Medium to full body with a medium-light to medium sweetness and a light to medium-light bitterness. The flavor is similar to the smell, hoppy with sweet tropical fruits, sweet orange, sweet citrus fruits, mango, overripe stone fruits and bitter herbs. Overall pretty good.

Cask - The Kings Head, Norwich. Clear amber with a loose, bubbly white to off-white head. Classic malty bitter. Mid-fruits, yeast, caramel, biscuit. Soft carbonation, oily mouthfeel, light to medium body, gentle malty finish.
9.9.2022: From tap at Zürich Beer Festival, 8.5% ABV. Very hazy dark yellow color with a white head. The aroma is hoppy with dank hops, onions, garlic, some diesel up front followed by tart tangerine, orange, some mango, some white grapes, ripe pineapple and sweet tropical notes - nice smell. Medium to medium-full pillowy body with a medium-light to medium sweetness and a light to medium bitterness. The flavor starts with sweet citrus fruits and sweet biscuity malt immediately followed by dank hop notes - sweet citrus fruits, mango, white grapes, melon, bitter herbal notes. Finishes with a light residual lightly sweetish malt presence, a light to medium hop bitterness and a light hop burn.

Beautiful beer. A yellowish orange pour with a nice white head. Smells and tastes of Tropicana and stone fruits. Beautiful.
Pours a dark orange with a creamy white head. Seth’s of citrus. Tastes of tropical fruits and OJ. Super smooth.
# 3208; 9/2022. 
Chocolate, dark fruits aroma. Hazy brown body; persistant tany head. Caramel, licorice, dried plums, cherries in chocolate, spicy, light alcohol warmth. Interesting, stronger mild. 0,5 l, bottle, beer shop, Newark on Trent (East Midland, England).
Copenhagen 19/9 2022. 37,5 cl bottle from Kihoskh, Sønder Boulevard, Kbh. V. Grumpy Demonic Goat-Lady zapping a Crimson drink on the label.

Pours opaque, murky Burgundy with an off-white head. Stable. Settles as 0,3 cm thick layer of foam struggling to cover the surface of the beer. Substantial lacing. 

Aroma is fairly intensewith an aggressive and sharp sourness mellowed bit by a light fruity sweetness and some wooden complexity. Sour gooseberries, sour cherries and a touch of vinegar. Sweet grapes and old wine barrel. 

Light carbonation. Sightly thick, oily, soft, smooth, lightly tingling texture. 

Flavor is intense with light sweetness followed by strong tart sourness. Aftertaste is sour with subtle sweet undertone. Lingers for a bit. Finish is bone-dry with an acerbic bite.

Fine sour take on a Flanders Red with a subtle touch of wood and fruit.
--Sample, thanks oh6gdx! -- Hazy deep golden, minimal head. Aroma of apricot and tomato. Mid sweet with ligyt to medium body and clean, rounded mouthfeel. Apricot and lychee. Low bitterness.
Poured a deep purple color with a medium sized pink head. Blackberries, vanilla, and tart berries.
16 oz from Bottle Joy. Aroma has notes of cantaloupe, peach, strawberry, chalky candy. Pours hazy golden with a two finger cream white head with excellent retention; some sediment floating around. Taste has a moderate pithy bitterness. Almost five months old and still tastes great.
9.9.2022: From tap at Zürich Beer Festival, 8.5% ABV. Very hazy dark yellow color with a white head. The aroma is fruity, hoppy and dank with some diesel, citrus fruits, sweeter citrus fruits, tangerine, some mango, some overripe peaches, vineyard peaches and some biscuity malt. Medium to medium-full body with a pillowy body with a medium to medium-light sweetness and a light to medium bitterness. The flavor starts with sweet tropical fruits, sweet ripe citrus fruits, ripe orange, ripe red grapefruit, mango, some melon and biscuity malt. Finishes with hints of sweet oats and a light to medium-light hoppy bitterness. Not overly complex but pretty decent.

16oz can. Poured a smoothie looking lighter ruby color with a thin sized head. All berries show with the cranberries up front. Tart finish.
Can bought at Twisted Crow, Basingstoke. Aroma is sweet - caramel, candi sugar and nuts. Followed by cocao. Hazy-opaque Toffee brown. Thick fluffy foamy off-white head. Medium bitter- grainy. Citrus edge. Followed by underlying caramel and nougat. Bitterness is in throughout (as is spice). Light-medium bodied. Thin but lifted by uber fizzy carbonation. A spicy brown. Nice.
It pours red with a large, very long lasting white head. I smell Belgian yeast, dried fruit & hints of leather & wet leaves. This is an extraordinarily complex, robust & delicious beer. I taste ginger, honey, nutmeg, cinnamon, orchard fruit along with hints of leather. What a wonderful & well crafted beer this is. It's a great deal different from any triple I've ever had. But I suppose that's why the Belgians say they don't brew to style. Strongly recommended.
Can, 7.9%. Hazy dark yellow with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop, citrus, spicy and grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, citrus, medium sweet, spicy, grapefruit and medium bitter.
500ml bottle, gift from my cousin. Pours hazy yellow with a white foamy head. Aromas & tastes of banana, cloves & light wheat. Moderate body. Light bitter finish. Somewhat disappointing but fairly enjoyable
16oz can. Poured a lighter hazy golden color with an averaged sized head. Citrus, floral, grapefruits, and piney.
440ml can. Hazy golden, white head. Aroma of pine, pineapple, citrus fruits. Taste is piney, with pineapple, orange, grapefruit, a little pithy. Medium bodied. Decent.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy / murky orange color with a medium sized head. Juicy, dank citrus, oranges, fruity, and tropical sweetness.
.33 bottle. Clear pale gold, thick, creamy, stable white head, decent lacing. Aroma malty, bready, grassy. Taste full, sweetish, bready. Carbonation medium to low. Bitterness medium, herbal. Aftertaste bready, malty, herbal, biscuits. Not bad.
9.9.2022: From tap at Zürich Beer Festival, 6% ABV. Hazy light orange color with a white head. The aroma is hoppy with pretty much resin, pine, dank notes, a light woody touch, some grapefruit, bread, some caramel, hints of stone fruits and sweet onion. Medium to medium-full body with a light to medium-light sweetness and a medium bitterness. The flavor is hoppy with resin, pine, bitter grapefruit, hints of stone fruits, bread, some caramel and toasted bread. Dries out towards the finish. Finishes with a resinous medium hoppy bitterness. Pretty decent with a nice bitterness.

16oz can. Poured a hazy golden color with a medium sized head. Fruits, tropical juice, and citrus.
16oz can. Poured a light hazy golden color with a medium sized head. Tropical fruits, citrus, juicy and some melons.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy orange color with a medium sized head. Citrus, grapefruit, tropical, juicy and fruity.
16oz can. Poured a hazy golden / orange color with a medium sized head. Citrus, tropical and piney.
Can. Color: Lightly hazy golden, white head. Aroma: Brandy, hoppy, citrus. Taste: Hoppy, citrus notes, slightly overwhelming Brandy. Bit boozy. Nice combination. Refreshing with a boozy twist. Medium body, just below average carbonation. Nice.
Tollgate Walnut Traditional Stout 4.9%. Blackish brown, chocolate malt aroma, full bodied, dark malt, chocolate, vanilla, spices. Gorgeous Stout from Ashby-de-la-Zouch, Derbyshire 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿
Got this can from Giant in Lancaster PA. Clear pale yellah.  Nice non artificial fruit nose. Initial taste is not as sweet as expected, almost comes across like a lo-cal seltzer. Yes, typical dull fruit beer taste but its a little more civilized than the average fruit beer. Lots of good carbonation and its not as badnor sweet as I thought it would be. Was expecting a sweet soda like malt beverage bomb but this is more like your above average fruit beer, quite enjoyable IMHO. The pom is detectable but not sure about the agave. Good overall session and a finish that don't leave you regretting. Yes, much better than expected.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy deep golden to orange color with a medium sized head. Tropical mangoes, citrus, grapefruits, and juiciness.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy golden color with a medium sized head. Tropical fruits, melons, juiciness, and some grassiness in the finish.
Undated can, freshly acquired from 12 Percent, drunk 9/19/22.
Clear, light peach.  Small, off-white head showing low retention.
Smells like a helles.  Clean, with good mineral and light hopping alongside soft honey-like malt and a touch of vanilla.  Peppery hop on the finish balances easily.  No alcohol noted.
Soft and malty with good attenuation and rich honey, sourdough and biscuit being balanced by liberal hopping that adds black pepper, fresh herbs and such with plentiful, spicy, lingering bitterness.  Clean and well-presented flavors. Maybe a touch lighter-bodied, lower-malted than I'd prefer, but it's certainly a very nitpicky gripe.
440 ml can, from Vinmonopolet Kvadrat. ABV is 7.0%. Pitch black colour, large to moderate tan head. Aroma of molasses / dark syrup, ginger, custard, chocolate, vanilla, pastry / bakery. The flavour is medium sweet, not quite as extreme as I feared, with the same elements as the aroma, also fruity notes of prunes. Low bitterness.
A hazed amber ale with a thin white head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with light mineral notes, faint mango, OK. In mouth, sweet fruity malt with light mango, mineral notes, light Epsom salts, OK. On tap at brewery.
A hazed golden ale with a thin lacing white head. In aroma, nice biscuit malt with resinous grassy hops, light cereals, pleasant. In mouth, a nice biscuit malt with grassy resinous hops, light grapefruit pulp, light cereals, pleasant. On tap at brewery.
Black colour with a large creamy tan head.
Aroma: roasted malt, chocolate, cacao, coffee, hint of vanilla, coconut, some spices. 
Taste: roasted malt, coffee, some cacao, some coconut, hint of vanilla.
Full body.
C: hazy orange
P: tropical fruit, pineapple, grapefruit, light tangerine, red pear, apple blossom, peach skin, fruity sweetness, light hoppy grassy notes, touch of cantaloupe
P: juicy, frothy, pear, hoppy grassy notes, fresh pineapple, dash of rose water, pasted honey, floral soap, minty finish, spearmint lingers on the palate with a bit of a numbing tobacco sensation on the palate.
Very fruity aroma. Sweet on initial taste, then sour/tart. Lovely purple colour.
Large white foamy head on a hazy vivid golden coloured body.
Zesty citra aroma.
Medium bodied, soft over the tongue with a lively sharp back.
Zesty citra, light malt, white wine & pithy pine tastes with a bitter finish.
Nice & refreshing.
500ml can. Hazy, pale yellow-ish, bright golden colour with average, frothy, osteoporosing, minimally lacing, white head. Grassy and citrusy fruity, hoppy aroma, oaty malty background, notes of lemon, lemongrass, some melon, pear, resin, pine, spruce, a light herbal touch as well, whiffs of basil, lemon balm. Taste is grassy, piney and slightly citrusy fruity, minimally herbal hoppy, oaty malty basis with subtle residual sweetness, hints of pine, pine needles, spruce, resin, lemon, lemongrass, some melon, pineapple, a touch of basil, lemon balm.
Slightly creamy and oily, still watery texture, smooth and soft palate, fine to very fine, prickly carbonation.
Decent complexity, well crafted - very good.
It pours nearly opaque black with mahogany highlights; the head is beige, foamy, and dissipates quickly. The aroma has notes of: cracker, burnt sugar, black coffee, and molasses. The taste is light sweet that finishes medium bitter. The palate is medium bodied, with little carbonation; the mouthfeel is slightly creamy, with a medium bitter finish. Overall, a very crush-able stout with a slight dessert flair.
Bottle. A gift from Totnes. The person not the place. Clear dark amber. Slim off white foam. Nose has sweet toasty bready malt. Hint of the treacle addition. Taste is similarly sweet with just a light fruity bitterness. Smooth and easy drinking. Fine carbonation. Light dry and fruity bitter finish.
A hazed golden ale with a thin lacing white head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with resinous floral hops, citrus pulp, light tropical fruits, well done. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity biscuit malt with resinous floral hops, grapefruit pulp, light tropical fruits, classic. On tap at brewery.
4 pack canned 8/30/22, drunk 9/10-9/19/22.
Heavily hazy, tangerine-peach-golden with a small, off-white head with moderate-to-low retention.
Heavy, heavy sulfur and mineral that seems to be quite Riwaka-endemic.  It's Nelson-redolent, but seems to heavily lean in to that aspect and less the white wine character that Nelson is also known for.  Clean, with crackery, lightly biscuity malt and light tangerine and orange juice on the finish.  No alcohol, resin or flaw noted.
Soft, near creamy, wit big juiciness and tons of tangerine, mango, papaya and heavy mineral, light sulfur.  Kind of a round, almost saccharine finish, though with lingering papaya tanginess.  The creamy, somewhat sluggish texture is a bit problematic.  Just a bit too heavy on the palate, even if there's no resin/twang/alcohol.
2022-09-17. Lightly hazy dark orange body, small beige head. 3+ Aroma is lightly green, muddled citrus.  Flavour is lightly bitter throughout, lightly resiny, muddled citrus and green hops. Average bodied palate, good carbonation. 3+ Decent. 7/3-4/7/3/15 Can from All My Friends, Bloomfield.
0,33 l can, 25 ct on sale at Zimmermann Sonderposten a few weeks ago. BB 14.10.2022. Cloudy mahagony with a more than one finger pale beige head in the glass. Looks really good. Sweet malty smell. Taste starts toasted malty and sweet. Too sweet. Some nuts and dark caramel. But synthetic. Taste can´t convince. Low carbonated. Low bitterness.
2022-09-17. Very lightly hazy pinkish body, quick white head. Aroma is mild, muted raspberry, light funky vegetal touches. Flavour is a bit thin, dilute, muted raspberry.  Light bodied palate, moderate carbonation. Just okay. 6/3/5/3/12 Can from Brauwerk Hoffman, Ottawa.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy yellow color with an averaged sized head. Citrus, floral, and some fruits.
Can from the brewery online shop. 
Appearance - cloudy to murky yellow. Big fluffy white head. 
Nose - pineapple, melon and papaya. Resinous edge. 
Taste - pineapple and citrus, probably grapefruit, so Lilt. 
Palate - medium bodied, tangy middle and finish. Good linger. 
Overall - lovely stuff.
2022-09-17. Crisp yellow body, small white head. 3+ Aroma is quite mild while chilled, light hops, pale malt. Flavour is similarly mild, very lightly bitter, muted grassy hops and pale malt. Average bodied palate, good carbonation. Okay, quaffable but overly mild. 6/3/6/3/13 Can from Brauwerk Hoffman, Ottawa.
A golden helles with a very thin white head. In aroma, nice crisp biscuit malt with grassy German hops, light mineral notes, pleasant. In mouth, a nice biscuit malt with grassy German hops, light mineral notes, light cereals, pleasant. On tap at brewery.
2022-09-17. Crisp yellow body, small white head. 3+ Aroma is mild, muted pale malt. Flavour is mild, pale malt, light vegetal touch in the finish. Average bodied palate, good carbonation. Just okay. 6/3/5/3/12 Can from Brauwerk Hoffman, Ottawa.
Pale blond colour with light haze and lasting head. Fresh pale malts in the aroma. Reminds me a bit of warm wort. That maltiness is there in the flavour too. Most alcohol free beers fail at this point with a stale finish, this one not though. There's light zesty citrusy notes and some soft, juicy notes too. Mandarin, peach. Great job.
2022-09-15. Lightly hazy orange body, modest off white head. 3+ aroma is pleasant with an interesting toasty biscuity malt quality. Flavour is similar, malty base with lightly toasty malt and cereal undercurrents. Lightly bitter finish. Average plus bodied palate, good carbonation. Enjoyable. 7/3/7/3/14 Can from Braumeister, Ottawa.
2022-09-14. Lightly hazy yellow body, modest white head. 3+ Aroma is relatively mild, light notes of grass and wheat. Flavour is moderately bitter throughout, grassy hops, light cereal wheat undertones. 7+ Finishes mdoerately bitter. Average bodied palate, effervescent carbonation. Tasty, very quaffable. 7/3/7+/3/16+ Can from Brauwerk Hoffman, Ottawa.
2020 vintage bottle. Poured a deep amberish color with a thin sized off white head. Vanilla, caramel, bourbon, dark fruits, smooth and alc hidden.
2022-09-11. Very lightly hazy golden orange body, modest white head. 3+ Aroma of burnt musty cereal grains.  Flavour is similar, sweetish pale malt gives way to a lightly earthy ashy phenolic quality that feels like it may not be intentional. Light alcohol. Average bodied palate, moderate carbonation. Not sure if it's flawed or as intended, but very much not to my own taste. 6/3/5/3/11 Can from Broken Stick, Ottawa.
2022-09-11. Murky dark pastel yellow body, moderate white head. 3+ Aroma of mild citrus, light hop haze. Lightly sweet? Flavour is lightly bitter, notes of coconut and hop haze? Smooth average plus  bodied palate, moderate carbonation. Okay. Hop profile is not entirely to my taste.  7/3/7/3/15 Can from Laketown, Perth.
# 3207; 9/2022. 
Sweet, caramel, fruity aroma. Clear brown body, tany head. Sweet, caramel, licorice, cola-like, watery. Bad dark lager. 0,5 l, bottle, shop with East European food, Lincoln (Lincolnshire, England).
750ml bottle from Cat in the Glass. Season 2021. Hazy sandy gold colour, white foam head that quickly dissipates to a thin rim and aroma of fruity pear. Taste is sweet, pear, fleshy, skins, grapey, with some acidity and drying woody tannin. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, very dry tannic finish. Nicely drinkable.
2022-09-11. Hazy orange body gets murky towards the bottom of the can, some chunky sediment, moderate white head and lace. 3- Aroma is mild, citrusy hops, light hop haze. Flavour is moderately bitter throughout, muddled citrus. Tea like undertones as it warms up? Average bodied palate, soft carbonation. 7/2-3/7/3/14 Can ordered from Dog House, Petawawa.
Bottle online from Beers Of Europe.
Pours a murky amber/orange colour with a large thick foamy off white head. Aroma is very unusual and fruity with stoney fruits, some melon and notes of candy. Taste is again very fruity with more stoney fruits, apricots and peaches, more melon, some floral, tangerines, marmalade, tea and peppery spice. Slight orange pith on a hoppy finish. Full body, low carbonation and smooth slightly oily mouthfeel. Very good unique tasting beer which got better and better with each sip.
Can bought at Twisted Crow, Basingstoke. Aroma has perfumed dark fruits and liquorice. Dark. Cola tint. Thick foamy beige head that attempts to escape the glass and throttle me, which is what I suspect my wife wants to do as I am forcing her to watch Beer Masters. Light-medium bitter. Mocha. Spice. Light liquorice. A fruity edge. Medium bodied. Oily. Soft-fizzy carbonation. Long slightly astringent finish. Easy drinking. Enjoyable.
330ml bottle from Will.  Hazy purple.  Aroma of loads of sour cherry, plum skins and redcurrant.  Crisp, and very sour.  The cherry really comes through up front and then there’s a nice plummy linger.
Can. Fridge lurker. Clear dark brown. Very decent beige foam. Nose has lightly ashy notes. Milk chocolate milkshake. Touch of sweet vine fruit. Taste is sweet and lightly vinous. Lots of flavour here. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Fine carbonation. Semi sweet finish. Mighty impressive for the ABV.
can at home... deep red brown... massive tan head... soft herbal toffee malts nose.. soft sweet caramel toffee fruit.. Light metalic... something little medical... the medical builds and ruibs this6.. kind of acetone
500 ml can. Unclear golden with a big fluffy head. Hoppy notes, slightly metallic, zesty citrussy notes, grass, hay. Hoppy bitterness. Medium bodied, oily texture, lively carbonated, hoppy bitter finish. Nice Czech Pilsner!
On tap at the Dartmouth Arms, London on 19th September 2022. Pale yellow gold with shallow white foam and scant lacing. Lemony citrus aroma. Zesty citrus and pithy fruits in-mouth with grassy hints. A lasting citrus finish. Light to medium bodied with a zingy mouthfeel.

(Can) Amber colour with frothy, tan head. Fruity, hoppy nose with mango, orange marmalade, honey and red berries (red-currant, cranberries). Slightly perfumy. Fruity, hoppy taste with notes of mango, orange peel, apricots, honey and a balanced citric bitterness in the finish. Medium body, quite sweet. Fairly uncomplicated and a bit sweet, but quite tasty. Nice one.
Bottle onine from the brewery, sometime ago! Pours jet black with a dissipating tan cap. Aroma: dark chocolate, cacao, cinnamon. Taste: Moderate to heavy sweet & light to moderate bitter, cacao dominates, also some cinnamon. The chilli has faded. Medium to full body with light carbonation, warming finish. Nice but was possibly better a little fresher.

Tap at the Paulaner Brewpub, Munich, 19th September 2022.  Pours clear and golden orange. Aroma is straw and grass, hay and malts.  Taste is straw and fresh grass, malts and grains, mellow, it’s really very decent.
Can bought at Twisted Crow, Basingstoke. Aroma has coffee, cream and chocolate. Opaque cola brown. Thin creamy beige head. Medium bitter with a sweet streak. Gains sweetness. Coffee. Liquorice. Molasses. Develops underlying vanilla and a yeasty edge. Medium-heavy bodied. Oily. Soft-fizzy carbonation. Long finish. Enjoyable flavoursome Balt.
Can from the brewery online shop. 
Appearance - golden and clear with a large creamy white head.
Nose - sweetcorn, malt and just a suggestion of citrus. 
Taste - lemon zest and in a creamy way. Bready backdrop. 
Palate - light bodied, creamy middle and with a nicely tapered linger. 
Overall - this is a good reproduction of a Munich classic.
44cl can as “Brussels Beer Project Kiwi NZEIPA” from the brewery.
F: medium, white, not long lasting.
C: straw, milky hazy.
A: orange, pine resin, tangerine, yellow tropical fruits, pineapple, mango.
T: medium malty base, a lot of fruits, citrus, tropical fruits, pine resin, spicy, grapes touch, dry on the palate, medium carbonation, good balanced, enjoyed for sure.
opalescent orange colour, large, though not too stable off-white head; aroma of bready, canned apple, some pear, soy sauce, floral honey and yeasty notes; taste is malt dominant with the same notes as can be felt in the aroma and some spicy-peppery notes; not that bad
Bottle 50 cl. Golden color, clear, weak foam. Aroma: sweet, apples, clean, slightly soaked apple. Taste is more interesting, sour, a little sweetness, apples, fresh and soaked, clean, not bad.
Can bought at Twisted Crow, Basingstoke. Aroma combines woody resin with stone fruit and citrus. Opaque, slightly hazy gold. Foamy white head. Medium-heavy bitter. More resinous than the aroma suggested it would be. It has a juicy tropical edge. Develops fruit sugar sweetness into the finish. However the bitterness identifies as the fat lady, closing the show. Light-medium bodied. Slick. Soft carbonation. Long dry finish. Enjoyable enough.
19th September 2022Can. Hazy orange gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and smooth and semi dry, decent fine minerally carbonation. Light malts, a light creamy sweetness. Yes, good punchy Clementine that is accentuated by the light but requisite saline vibe. The passion fruit ramps up on the back end but never gets over sharp. Light crisp finish with a light but pleasing savoury vibe. Very good fruity Gose. Doesn't have the intensity of the best imperial fruity goses but it's not trying to be. One of the better passion fruit beers in recent years and with some decent Clementine too boot.
A burgundy red ale with a thin lacing rosey white head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with loads of grape Smash, light acidity, light Brett, very nice. In mouth, a nice rich grape must with light Brett, light lactic notes, very nice and rich. On tap at brewery.
Tap at the Paulaner Brauhaus, 19th September 22.  Pours a dark orange and full on haze.  Aroma is  banana and clove, spice,  yeast and light aromatic citrus, it’s full and really good
33cl bottle from SPAR @ Le Lioran Galerie Marchande Sumene in Laveissière, France. F: medium, tanned, good retention.
C: dark coppery to brown, light hazy.
A: malty, bready, caramel, leaves, dried fruits.
T: full malty base, caramel, herbal, dried fruits, bit toast, dry on the palate, bit vinous, medium carbonation, very nice balanced beer yet not tripel but Brown Ale – Imperial. 
Bottle online from Beers Of Europe.
Pours a very very dark chestnut brown colour with a medium sized thick creamy beige head. Aromas of caramel, nuts, chocolate and roasted malts. Taste has dark fruits, caramel, chocolate, nuts, brown bread, roasted malts and some ashy notes on the finish. Full body, low carbonation and smooth mouthfeel. Nice old fashioned winter beer.
Pours clear golden with white lasting head. Aroma is mostly malty with notes of corn, grain, starch and some metallic bitterness. Taste is mild and follows the aroma with grainy maltiness and bit metallic grassy touch of hops. Just another macro lager, a simple thirst quencher ncher. (Poured from a 440ml can, bb 30 apr 2023)
Can from Rheged. Pours a hazy gold with a big frothy white head. Fresh citrus nose. Clean citrus flavours abound, I suspect there's a fair amount of NZ hops in there. Quite light in body, making it really refreshing. Nice beer!
C: clear gold
N: oxidized, light DMS, cooked corn, malt
P: oxidized, nutty, canned corn, malt, hay, lightly herbal. Pity the faults messed this up.
Slightly golden pour with flat, white head. Aroma of frozen waffles. Flavor is doughy and very watery. Swallow has almost no hop aftertaste. Not terrible but, goddamnit, Lakefront can do better than this. Bottle.
SARAthon 2022. Pours a light golden/yellow color with some white foam. This was a bit more tart and acidic than I expected, but still enjoyable. Lots of grape, stone fruit, citrus, and even some tropical fruit notes. Get a bunch of pineapple, passion fruit, lime, and grapefruit. A touch of sweet melon in there along with apricot. Maybe some lacto/yogurt funk as well. Fairly dry and tart, but surprisingly light and quite refreshing.

Alone at home. Amber colored beer with small white head and no carbonation. Herby fruited aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is sweet herby yeasty.
SARAthon 2022. Pours a muddy dark brown with a short-lived khaki head. The cacao comes through fairly well, otherwise it's kind of muddled. Roasted malt, a bit of tart fruit, berry, and an odd salinity or even brine quality. Kind of has an olive thing going on. Decently tart with some sour berry and balsamic notes. Rather dry and tannic. A bit of a leathery funk to it as well. Just kind of a weird beer.
clear darker golden colour, medium sized creamy, slightly ecru-ish white head; aroma of apple, pear, some grape, grainy, floral and slight herbal notes; taste is malty-syrupy, fruity and alcoholic-spicy notes; rather like a strong pale lager than an Belgian stron ale: has no 'body' for this ABV....disappointing
16oz can. Poured a cloudy golden color with an averaged sized head. Dank citrus, grapefruits, floral notes, and some fruitiness.
Cotswold Lion Best in Show 4.2%. Amber, caramel malt aroma, medium bodied, caramel malt, biscuit, earthy, bitter finish. Pleasant Bitter from Leckhampton Hill, Gloucestershire 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿
A golden saison with a thin lacing white head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with light fruity esters, light Brett, light Epsom salts, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with fruity esters, light peaches, light Brett, light horseblanket, very nice and smooth. On tap at brewery.
19th September 2022Can. Hazy orange gold beer, tidy bubbly pale cream colour head. Smooth palate, mildly dry, decent fine minerally carbonation. Fluffy pale malts, a light creamy sweetness. The hops bring smooth sweet pine and floral fruity citrussy with Zappa providing it's zany purple skittles vibe. A touch of spice in the finish. The El Dorado may be contributing to the floralness here and because I know it's here I can taste a little Sakura on the back end. Pinch of spice on the finish. A bit of a hodge podge but an entertaining one.
Fruity flavors are well blended together.  Flavors are light and somewhat weak but still good.  Decent beer.
19/9/2022. Bottle bought direct from the brewery. Pours very dark brown with a frothy tan coloured head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, cocoa, caramel, roasted malts, dark fruits. Sweet milky chocolate taste, light roasted bitterness. Moderate body, slightly oily, a little too fizzy for my liking. Nicely done.
Rating #8000: 0.75 l bottle from 'Beerdome', bottled in 2019. Clear, golden amber with a medium large, foamy, quickly collapsing, white head. Slightly sweetish, sourish, quite fruity and gently funky aroma of overripe lemon, gooseberry, oak, horse blanket and traces of vinegar. Minimally sweet, gently sour, quite fruity and funky taste of overripe lemon, oak, gooseberry, hints of rhubarb, horse blanket and grapefruit, followed by a medium long, quite tart, rather woody-dry finish. Medium body, gently astringent and quite effervescent mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Lovely, extremely well-balanced Geuze, a typical Boon masterpiece. Super refreshing and fruity, dry but with a balanced sourness, very elegant. Frank Boon's apogee and another milestone for me.
SARAthon 2022. Pours an opaque red/amber color with some off-white foam. Really big on the berry character. Tons of raspberry but also get a mild vinous note of currant and red grape. Some tart lime, lemon, and berry. Good mix of sweetness and acidity. Just a touch of earthy and woody funk, some tannic fruit skin/seeds and oak, and a bit of yeast. Enjoyable.
Hazy gold with a bubbly white head and a wheaty, banana bubblegum nose. Sooft and smooth with a fruity sweetness and some subtle hoppy bitterness
12oz bottle. Poured a near black color with a small sized tan head. Coffee, maple, brown sugary sweetness, woody, chocolate, fudgy and roast.
Near black with a frothy tan head and roasted malt on the nose, and a hint of liquorice. Roasted malt, chocolate and that hint of liquorice carry through to the taste with a dry bitterness
Can from HOTM. Light golden hazed with a foamy white head. Aroma and taste are citrus sweet to slight bitter. Crisp body and slightly thin.
SARAthon 2022. Pours a lightly hazed golden-orange color with some white foam. Tart lemon and stone fruit up front with a bit of white grape. Some melon, honey, and a bit of a damp funk. A general/vague "spice" character that I can't quite explain. Fairly grassy as it warms, maybe even a bit herbal. Not bad overall.
Nice looking clear golden ale with a frothy white head and biscuits on the nose. Biscuit malt to the fore, crisp and fresh and a touch of fruit
16oz can. Poured a deep brown / near black with a medium sized tan head. Peanut butter, chocolate, marshmallow, vanilla, and creaminess from the lactose.
Delicious! Well-balanced carbonation, classic Marzen flavor, amber in presentation.  One of my favorite local Marzens. If you can't afford a flight for Oktoberfest, this will take you there for a fraction of the cost
Clear deep gold/pale amber with a frothy/creamy white head and floral hops and malt on the nose. Smooth and lots of bitterness, some malt and a hint of fruit, with a dry finish
SARAthon 2022. Pours a mostly clear golden color with a white head. There's a fair amount of pepper to this and it's actually somewhat spicy (in a black pepper sort of way). Some wood, grass, and floral notes to it as well. A little bit earthy, too. Mild tannins and a general dryness to the finish. Kind of an odd mix of tartness and spice, but not bad, actually.
Bottle: (Courtesy of MoritzF!): Golden, clear, small and stable white foamy layer, mild sweetish citrussy-fruity nose with grainy-dusty traces underneath; even milder sweetish-sourish ( not caused by infection) flavour with a cryptic bitterness, light bodied, pretty soft; short fruity-grainy finish. Great… but only by Sauerland standards! At least drinkable…
Lovely looking golden ale with a creamy white head and malt and citrus in the nose, and a hint of pine. Smooth and creamy, it’s a lovely blend of toffee malt and orange citrus, some pine and a dry bitter hopped finish
16oz can. Poured  cloudy golden color with a medium sized head. Citrus, fruity, and floral notes.
Aroma; citric stuff, spicy herbs, floral notes, pale malts, yeast. Look; attempts to off white head on veiled deep golden body. Taste; citric stuff, spicy herbs, floral resin, pale malts, grain, yeast, and finishes bitter. Feel; okay body and normal co². Overall; ya ale. [from 33cl bottle, B @ Systembolaget Sweden].
Hazy deep pink with a bubbly white head and creamy milk chocolate and cherry on the nose. Spritzy, fruity and chocolatey with a touch of tartness, indeed it mimics Black Forest Gateau quite well
SARAthon 2022. Pours a hazy pink color with a pinkish-white head. Kind of buttery, particularly on the finish. Some sweet and tart berry, lemon, bread, and yeast. Kind of a zesty and tannic quality to the finish with some mild tartness. Light in body with moderate carbonation. Would be enjoyable if not for the butter. Oh well.
16oz can. Poured a black color with a smaller sized tan head. Roast, roasted coffee, some vanilla, wood / oakiness, chocolate, and bourbon notes.
Aroma; spices, herbs, lemongrass, anised n minted malts, yeast. Look; attempts to off white head on veiled deep golden body. Taste; herbs, strawy hops, dusty peel, yeast, grain, malts, and finishes in some herbs. Feel; okay body and normal co². Overall; soso. [from 33cl bottle, B @ Systembolaget Sweden].
19th September 2022Can. Hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate starts smooth but quickly develops a fine minerally crispness. Light pale malts bring a very pleasing light creamy sweetness. Some bold hopping here for a lager. Crisp pine into bright citrus with a great undertone of tropical fruits. Crisp piney fruity finish. A cracking and refreshing beer but I think it has fallen in to the trap of disguising it's lager nature by the amount of hops that have gone in here. Comes over as a nice crisp bright IPA.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy / murky golden color with a medium sized head. Definitely peachy with tropical fruits / mangoes, juicy , and crushable. Fresh peaches.
Bottle. Cloudy amber, white lace. Banana, light sugar, some mash, some spice.
Keg at Prince of Wales in Farnborough. Bright yellow aroma, light tea notes, lots of citrus, a little yeast in finish. Not quite what I was expecting but refreshing.
440 ml can, as Vocation Special Edition Toucan Tropic DDH IPA, from Vinmonopolet Kvadrat. ABV is 6.7%. Moderately hazy yellow colour, moderate to small white head. Moderate aroma of tropical fruits and citrus. The flavour has a lot more going on, distinct notes of various tropical fruits, also citrus, yellow stonefruits and pine needles. Moderate sweetness, very well balanced and enjoyable.
Cask at the Prince of Wales in Farnborough. Floral aroma, amber pour, nice balance of earthy hop and some bready malt. Solid session beer.
Aroma; spices, soap, grain, malts, basement. Look; off white head on veiled amber body. Taste; herbs, gooseberry peel, mint hops, yeast, grain, malts, and finishes in some weird herbs. Feel; okay body and normal co². Overall; meh. [from 33cl bottle, B @ Systembolaget Sweden].
SARAthon 2022. Pours black with a small tan head. Really nice barrel character on this with bourbon, oak, vanilla, and a touch of warming spices. Sweet molasses, graham cracker and toffee along with a touch of bitterness from dark chocolate, cacao, and roasted malts. Good full body with a low, smooth carbonation. It's got a bit of warmth to it, but not overly boozy despite its high boost level.
12oz can. Poured a near black color with a small sized tan head. Citrus, some orange is there, coffee, chocolate, and a thicker body.
Crowler, from the brewery. Pours clear reddish copper with very small frothy off-white head, caramel-malt aroma, adequate carbonation, medium bitter caramelized malt taste, thin watery body, longish finish. Not too bad.
Cask at Prince of Wales in Farnborough. Mid brown pour, earthy hop, some rye spice, hint of nettles. Decent session beer.
A light yeasty and light sweet smell of corn.
The small white fizzy head disappears rather fast. The body is cloudy and light orange. The taste is light bitter with a touch of citrus. The body is light and dry with a lively carbonation.
Bottle from GBBF 2022. Dark brown opaque ale with a thin tan brown head. Nose is dark fruits, fig, prune, plum, roasted malts, candy sugar, dark chocolate. On the palate is dark fruits dominating. Prune, plum, fig, and sweet candy sugar. Roasted and dark chocolate notes come through a bit later. Boozy, sweet and fruity.
Bottle picked up from a large Eurospar/Interspar, Bregenz, Austria, consumed at home Monday 19th September 2022 listening to Ströme - Nr2, we're reheating the Cod Fishcakes with Tomato sauce. Pours hazy yellow/gold with a white head. Honey aroma and flavours, a little malty but a little bit sweet. Not getting much else from this but it's not a bad beer.
Can, from the brewery. Pours hazy dark yellow with small foamy light beige head, citrus-juniper aroma, adequate carbonation, medium bitter taste with mango, citrus, faint juniper flavor, thin smooth body, long medium bitter finish. Well balanced and flavorful.
16oz can. Poured a cloudy golden color with a medium sized head. Tropical, pineapples, fruity, and citrus. Juicy.
Can from the brewery shop. Pours hazy yellow gold with a thick, rocky white head. Aromas of light citrus and bread. Taste is more of the same. Thin finish.
19/9/2022. Bottle bought direct from the brewery. My RateBeer brewery #4200. Pours clear golden with a small frothy white head. Aroma is citrus, flowers, grass, orange, gooseberry. Medium sweetness, nicely balanced bitterness. Moderate body, slightly oily, average carbonation. Easy drinking ISA.
Aroma; mint, perfume, pepperminted malts, grain. Look; off white head on pale straw golden body. Taste; soap, lemongrassy mint hops, yeast, and finishes in the membrane, with mint in the grain, all in all insane. Feel; okay body and normal co². Overall; meh. [from 33cl bottle, B @ Systembolaget Sweden].
Can from Appellation Wines. 
Appearance - deep orange with a big creamy off-white head. 
Nose - big lime note, straight off. Then salt and coriander. 
Taste - luscios lime and tropical. Still salty but coriander more muted. 
Palate - medium bodied with a tangy middle and finish. 
Overall - lovely stuff.
12oz bottle. Poured a near black with a thin sized head. Chocolate, vanilla, fudgy, roasted coffee and marshmallows.
SARAthon 2022. Milky golden beer with a white head. Super tropical hop aroma with lots of pineapple and mango. Zesty citrus notes of lemon, grapefruit, and tangerine. A slight cantaloupe note as well. Some bready malt in there as a base and providing a bit of sweetness. No real bitterness to speak of other than some mild pithy citrus notes. Pretty nice offering.
Aroma; sawdust, straw, mild malts, grain, attic. Look; neverending expanding off white fluffy head on veiled golden body. Taste; semi sour fruit, yeast, and finishes a bit sour. Feel; okay body and normal co². Overall; bad. [from 33cl bottle, #423, B @ Systembolaget Sweden].
SARAthon 2022. Pours a clear golden color with a white head. Has a nice bit of citrus and herbal hop character along with fresh flowers and grass. Bready malt, biscuit, and a touch of corn flakes. Light to moderate bitterness on the finish and fairly dry. Nice and clean with pretty minimal esters. Easy drinking and solid lager.
Keg. Pitch black color. Roast, port wine, plums, woody, alcohol, sugary in aroma/taste.
Can.  Pours a hazy orange colour with a tight fluffy white head, plenty of hops especially orange in the aroma, the taste is medium bitterness with a dry fruity bitter finish.
SARAthon 2022. Pours a bright golden color with a finger of white foam. Bread, biscuit, and yeast up front on this one give a nice malty base. Some grassy hops, fresh flowers, and a hint of citrus. Mild apple esters in the background and a light bitterness on the finish. Enjoyable and easy drinking offering.
Crowler, from the brewery. Pours cloudy lemon yellow with foamy whitish head, citrus-pineapple aroma, adequate carbonation, medium bitter citrus peel-pineapple taste, thin body, long citrus peel finish. Decent NEIPA.
Bottle picked up from Sulzberger Bierhaus Pffafenhofen an der Ilm and consumed at home Sunday 18th September 2022 listening to Hifi Sean - Ft, we're cooking Slow Roasted Shoulder of Lamb, Harissa from Simply Raymond. Pours hazy yellow with a large white head. Good moutheel, fruity with the usual banana on show, however backed up with a punchy hoppiness, mostly citrus but also a dash of tropical on this occasion. Good beer.
330ml bottle (thanks Erzengel). Cloudy orange color. Sweet, malty, caramel, very fizzy in aroma/taste.
330ml bottle (random shop, Liechtenstein) as "Blanche". Hazy yellow color. Medicinal, sweet, coriander, fizzy in aroma/taste.
Bottle at home, from an online peddler, 19/09/22.
Pitch black with a decent tan covering that dissipates to a swirl. 
Nose is dried fruits, raisins, chocolate, molasses, mellow barrel, brown sugar melt.
Taste comprises chocolate, dark malts, light spice, hint of coconut, bourbon nip, fruit cake, dates, toffee.
Full bodied, fine massaging carbonation, semi drying close spiked with a balanced rising boost kissed with bourbon. 
Solid sipper.
Draught at Centre St: pours clear gold white head. Aroma is grassy, clean malts. Taste is lightly bitter. Bright and crisp. light tropical notes.
500ml can. Clear amber color. Grainy, sweet, malty, fizzy, crisp in aroma/taste.
Bottle, golden color with medium head. Lemongrass, honeycomb, fresh rose, raw wheat, vanilla, house funk, and tart minerals. Soft mouthfeel with light acidity. The honey is a little too intense on the nose for me, but the flavor is bright lemon citrus. An easy drinking rustic saison.
B3. Bottle conditioning since 7/15/20. Orange red color with small to medium white head. Notes are candy cherry, perfumey and slightly sharp raspberry, sweet tarts, minerals, vinegar, and fruit punch. Acidity is more aggressive than I like for my Hill juice, but that seems to be the norm these days.
First time in cans. 8/31/22. Lemon biscuits, ash, grassy hops, toast, pepper, and florals. Medium bodied with a crisp finish. Overall, it’s a little too bitter/spicy for me, but can still crush the shit out of it. Thanks for the scoop Keith.
330ml bottle - Pours a clear dark reddish brown colour with a small frothy beige head. The aroma is chocolatey, sweet malts, caramel and sweet dried fruits. A sweet malty and  chocolate taste, cocoa powder, caramel, bourbon and dark fruit flavours with a alcohol and subtle chilli in a warming finish.
330ml bottle (thanks Erzengel). Clear amber color. Grainy, sourish, damp, papery, fizzy, sourish in aroma/taste.
330ml bottle (thanks Erzengel). Clear golden color. Grainy, sweet, sugary, fizzy, sourish, saison wibes in aroma/taste.
500ml swing-top bottle from Hop Lords, Worcester. Pours clear pale gold with a foamy white cap. Aroma: predominantly grassy, some caramel. Taste: light to moderate sweet & light bitter, sweet grains, grassy. Light body with foamy carbonation. Simple but fine.

19/9/2022. Bottle from Beers of Europe. 4.8% abv. Pours clear pale golden with a small frothy white head. Aroma of citrus, grain, light malt, grass. Medium sweetness, light bitterness. Light to moderate body, quite watery, average carbonation. Easy drinking and inoffensive.
