13th September 2022Hazy deep amber brown beer, small pale tan head. Esters on the nose. Palate starts smooth but develops a good fine minerally crispness. Smooth malts, a light creamy sweetness, good ripe caramel and a little toffee. Ripe fruits, prune and fig into some spicy over ripe plummy fruits and some more estery fruits. Light semi dry finish.  A bit estery for a barleywine as in very estery, but somehow, it kinda works here. Like someone made a barleywine from a Quad. Dunno! But it's tasty and drinkable. Little brandy in there.
500ml can. Hazy orange color. Sweet, alcohol, sugary, lactose in aroma/taste.
500ml bottle. Cloudy bright orange color. Sour, keefir, yogurt, fruity, berries in aroma/taste.
440ml can. Hazy yellow color. Citrus, fruity, juicy, tropical in aroma/taste.
Keg. Pitch black color. Sweet, toffee, alcohol, chocolate, cocoa in aroma/taste.
9th August 2022Purchased before the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Gimme a shout boys, when you get rid of your psychopath dictator and I will start buying yer beers again! Almost clear deep brown amber beer, a short lived and short tan head. Fair bit of rich bourbon on the snout, a touch of solvent. Smooth palate, mildly dry, reasonable fine carbonation. Smooth malts, a little creamy sweetness, fair bit of dark caramel a d a touch of brown sugar. Big big bourbon, mostly a rounded bourbon despite its welly. Touches of dank wood, oak induced vanilla and some sherry. Finishes smooth and slightly warming and leaves a sticky residue on the lips. Good fun - massively BBA BW.
Great notes of spruce tip. Crisp and tasty. An amazing sprucetip IPA. perfect for winter weather.
29th August 2022A light haze on this gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and smooth but develops good fine crispy carbonation on the back end. Fairly dry to boot. Elderflower is well presented, floral and a little sweet. Mild citrus from the UK Cascade. Good floral funk adds to the mix but there is also something quite sharp on the back end which reduces drinkability. Well it does unless you are one of these antacid swallowing sour heads. A little lemon acid then. Light dry finish. Very nearly a very good beer, they just let it run to too sharp.
Pale gold with a frothy, white head. Typical Helles aroma in part: metals, grains and yeasty white bread, but not quite entirely. There’s a herbal spice on top that keeps it interesting. That’s pretty much the highlight though. Taste is mildly bitter and bland and a watery palate. Balanced carbonation. Drinkable.
Like a warhead in a glass. This is by  farm my favorite sour. Hits the glands in the back of your throat and gets the glands in your ears tingling.  Dies down sweeter that the start but leaves you wanting more!
Tap at Hopdog, 19th September 22.  Pours a light chestnut brown, lovely white frothy head.  Aroma is malty, mellow.  Taste is malty, light caramel, good depth and complexity, bittersweet, some grass. Good
Very similar to Amarillo version in appearance, milky yellow ipa with a thin lacing white head. In aroma, sweet fruity biscuit malt with resinous floral hops, light tropical fruits, light hay notes, OK. In mouth, sweet fruity malt biscuit malt with resinous floral hops, tropical fruit, light mango, more fruity. On tap at brewery.
7th September 2022Hazy amber brown beer, short lived bubbly tan head. Fairly light palate, mildly dry, the carbonation is there, just, flirting with flat is this beer. Smooth caramel malts, not that sweet. Wet wood in the mid. Rounded cognac, ripe and fruity on the back. A kind of nothing finish. Like the barrelling here but the barleywine backbone is both fairly flat and lacks any depth whatsoever.
A milky yellow ipa with a thin lacing white head. In aroma, sweet fruity biscuit malt with resinous citrus hops, cereals, pleasant. In mouth, sweet fruity biscuit malt with resinous floral hops, grapefruit pulp, orange pulp, light tropical fruits, OK. On tap at brewery.
Copenhagen 19/9 2022. 33 cl chubby bottle from Meny, Østerfælled Torv, Kbh. Ø. D’Achouffe’s usual old Christmas Elves collecting huge cherries on the label. 

Pours clear maroon with a red hue and a mid-sized off-white head. Settles as 1 cm thick layer of foam covering the surface of the beer. Substantial lacing. 

Aroma is medium intense with a sweet sugary scent of fruit mingling with light tart notes. Ripe cherries, white sugar and marzipan. Unripe sour gooseberries peeking in. 

Medium strong carbonation. Slightly thick, oily, soft, lightly tingling texture. 

Flavor is fairly intense with a strong sugary sweetness followed by a light tart sourness. Aftertaste is sweetened fruit. Lingers for a while. Finish is sugary and sticky. 

For people that like their beer sweet with sugar on top.
SARAthon 2022. Pours a clear orange color with a white head. This doesn't really do much for me. Smells quite caramel forward and is quite malty. Some grapefruit, pine, orange rind, and lots of woody herbs. Fairly bitter and heavy. Kind of a sticky sap thing going on as well. Not a big fan and an odd offering from Sante.
Can from HOTM. Clear golden colour with a white head. Aroma and taste are corn sweet. And malty. Crisp sweet body. Light.
On tap in Munich. Classic golden lager with a nice voluminous head. Nice sweet bready malt, clean, light touch of bitterness, just enough to be super quaffable. Very solid.
Aroma: Roasted malt and red berries. 
Flavour: Sweet roasted malt with fruity sweetness and some bitterness. Light notes of whiskey and oak. Aftertaste is sweet and lightly bitter. 
Colour: Black with an offwhite head. 
From: Bottle @ Vild Med Vin webshop.
Can @ Home. Pours a clear golden color with a white head. Super citrusy aroma with tons of zesty lemon, grapefruit, and orange. A touch of strawberry in there, even. Some melon, grass, and a fair amount of bread. Finish is a little bit husky and astringent, but overall still pretty nice. Good west coast IPA with plenty of citrus hop character.
Alone at home. Red brown colored beer with small white head and no carbonation visible. Malty sugar sweet aroma. Full slight sparkling palate. Finish is sweet malty sweet.
26th August 2022Can. Very hazy yellow gold beer, good size pale cream colour head. Light palate, semi dry, decent fine minerally carbonation. Light malts, a thin and quite sweet creamy delivery. The hops are spicy and piney with a little savoury green skunk. Decent citrus, orangey and with a touch of peel. Little kiwi hop lime. Something vaguely exotic on the back end that must be Zappa, but that is the only disappointment here, Zappa gone through on stilts. Finishes crisp and semi dry and hop spicy. Goes down easy.
A lightly hazed golden ipa with a thin lacing white head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with light banana esters, cloves, light resinous hops, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity biscuit malt with light fruity esters, banana, light cloves, pleasant and smooth. On tap at brewery
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow colour with a medium fluffy white head, the aroma is hops with some fruit, the taste is medium bitterness with a dry bitter finish.
Can from the brewery shop. Pours clear golden with a thick white head. Aromas of light peach and citrus. Taste is citrus, malt, light peach again. Light bitter finish. Probably just small giant / rrr with extracts added.
Bottle @ Mike's House. Pours a lightly cloudy straw color with some white foam. Really nice lemon, grass, straw, and stone fruit notes here. Get a touch of white grape, golden apple, and even a hint of tropical fruit like passion fruit and pineapple. Fairly light in body but well done overall. Nice mild tartness on the finish and a touch of bready malt sweetness in there. Enjoyed this one.
27th August 2022Can. Hazy orange gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate starts smooth but quickly gets minerally crisp. Light malts, a nice light creamy sweetness. The duo of hops bring a mild savoury skunk and smooth pine. Looking for HBC 586 ripe tropical fruits and you really don't have to look hard at all. Soft passion fruit underneath, probs would not have picked it up if I didn't know Strata was here. Crisp finish. A light but richly hoppy dipa that is very easy drinking.
Tap at Hopdog, Munich, 19th September 2022.  Pours a chestnut brown.  Aroma is caramel and malts.  Taste is bitter caramel and burnt sugar, very tasty
Can, from the brewery. Pours extremely hazy dark yellow with small frothy light beige head, citrus-mango aroma, adequate carbonation, medium bitter unripe mango-citrus peel taste, somewhat thick body, long medium bitter finish. A nice brew!
355 ml can, from Vinmonopolet Kvadrat. ABV is 7.0%. Hazy yellow colour, moderate white head. Moderate aroma of citrus (incl. some orange marmalade) and piney hops. The flavour is grapefruity and quite bitter. Not bad at all, but a bit one-dimensional.
Bottle @ Mike's House. Pours a cloudy amber/copper color with an off-white head. A huge stone fruit aroma, particularly the peach. Some oak, vanilla, and a lot of lemon. There's a slight char to it that is reminiscent of grilled stone fruit. Has a decent mix of sweetness from the fruit and acidity, but still tends toward the highly acidic side which isn't my favorite.
Draught at Kafe U Krtka. Hazy, straw colored. AROMA- yeasty, malty, bubble gum, hay, spicy, coriander, flowery. FLAVOR- neutral, moderately bitter, creamy, citrusy, spicy, coriander, hay, apple, bubble gum, vanilla. Medium bodied.
Very tasty.
21st August 2022A light haze on this rich gold beer, tidy pale cream colour head. Smooth and semi dry palate, reasonable fine carbonation. Smooth malts, a little creamy sweetness. Some Belgian spicy yeast in the mid. The red wine barrel is nicely done. Vanilla oak pairs well with the malts and the red wine is both mellow and rich. Light semi dry finish. I was a bit underwhelmed to start with but this one gradually seduced, it's a mellow tripel with rounded barrelling and it goes down easy.
Pours a slightly hazy, pale straw color, with big head. Aroma is grass, straw, hops, some malt. Flavor follows. Crisp, clean mouthfeel with moderate bitterness in the finish.
A golden lager with a thin lacing white head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with grainy cereals character, light mineral notes, light grassy hops, OK. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity biscuit malt with grassy German hops, light mineral notes, light fruity esters, pleasant. On tap at brewery.
Bottle @ Mike's House. Pours a clear golden color with a tall white head. Reminds me a lot of Boon Black Label, which I'm not going to complain about. Super funky and dry with lots of earth, mushroom, and damp funk. Wood, yeast, and grass in there as well as some tangy citrus fruits like lemon and orange. Perhaps a hint of apple in there, too. Really nice balance of funk and acidity on this. Well done and glad to have a few more bottles.
On Tap at 1st Berries, Beans & Beer Festival, Crewe Heritage Centre 29/04/2017 Big hop aroma. Small white head. Amber coloured a little hazy in appearance hoppy and fruity with a tropical mango flavour. Hints of dryness and bitterness in a slightly roasted malt finish.
Can from Appellation Wines. 
Appearance - reddish pink and murky, a bit like watermeon flesh. Creamy pinky-white head.  
Nose - big raspberry note with funky edges. 
Taste - again dominated by raspberry. You can find the gooseberry if you search though. Again funky/tart edge to it. 
Palate - medium bodied, creamy middle and tart finish with good linger. 
Overall - very nice.
16th August 2022Almost clear reddish deep amber beer, small pale tan head. Smooth palate, semi dry, decent fine carbonation. The malts are light but have a decent depth of caramel with touches of cream and unsweet toffee. The Amarone barrelling brings a nice ripe red wine fruitiness that has a vague touch of port about it, goes well with the malt base. A little barrell dankness on the back end and a touch of alcohol spice. Overall all this a pretty decent and drinkable barleywine.
33cl can. A slightly hazy orange brown beer with a beige head. Aroma of sweet caramelized malt, nuts, spicy hops. Taste of sweet caramelized malt, nuts, grains.
Bottle @ Mike's House. Pours a hazed pinkish-orange color with a white head. Strong raspberry aroma and flavor as you would expect. Quite intense on the acidity, though. Mild raspberry jam sweetness before a ton of lemon juice and sour berry come through. Kind of a seedy quality as well as some oak, mushroom, and a light herbal funk come through. Solid fruit character, but would be better if it was not so aggressively sour.
33cl can. A hazy yellow golden beer with a white head. Aroma of tart yellow fruits, yeast, some salt. Taste of sour yellow fruits, citrus, zest.
Bottle @ Mike's House. Pours a clear pale yellow color with white foam. Huge juicy peach aroma and flavor on this. Really nice balance of sweet stone fruit and tartness of lemon, lime, green grape, and yogurt. Strong mineral notes to it, some fruit skin tannins, and a touch of grass/straw. Fairly light in body but good carbonation and crisp. Dry and tangy on the finish.
Can, from the brewery. Pours opaque dark brown with a large spongy tan head, mocha aroma, low carbonation, sweetish mocha taste with underlying alcohol flavor, smooth thick body, long sweetish finish. Sweet but satisfying.
13th August 2022Can. Hazy orange beer, small pale cream colour head. Smooth and slightly viscous, reasonable fine carbonation. Smooth malts, a light creamy sweetness. The Azacca delivery here falls slightly short for me. Plenty of hop fruit in the form of ripe orange and a little orange peel. Touch of mandarin. A vague smoky note. Smooth pine. Smooth finish. Far from unpleasant but lacks hop brightness and brings none of the Azacca lemony pizzaz.
Can. Pours a hazy orange colour with a fluffy white head, plenty of fruit especially citrus with hints of wheat, the taste is medium bitterness with a dry bitter finish.
16 fl.oz can. A hazy yellow golden beer with a white head. Aroma of sweet yellow fruits, apricot, oat malt. Taste of juicy hops, yellow fruits, mango, apricot, yeast.
44cl can. A clear golden beer with a white head. Aroma of mild sweet pale malt, grains, some biscuit. Taste of mild sweet pale malt, straw, hints of grains.
Aroma : Strong in toffee malt & hoppy piney resin.  Taste : body is on the lighter side of medium. Slight oily texture. Moderate to high bitter hoppy piney taste upfront. Strong malty toffee background. Not outstanding but still a solid IPA none the less
Tap at Hopdog, Munich, 19th September 2022.  Pours a chestnut brown beer.  Aroma is light smoke and caramel.  Taste is Smokey, light meat, caramel, malty.  Really tasty
Best known today for flavoured Mexican lager and abasement towards macro suitors, here Stone asks us to recall when they were tiresomely self-aggrandizing but on occasion made _very_ good beer. Can. Amber with a cream head. Rich toasty aroma with building pine, butterscotch and kumquat.Sweet, slightly toasty, some overt alcohol. Oily. Sweetness gradually reined with kumquat, pine, strong bitterness, hints of spices. Probably just shades the 25th Anniversary IIIPA.
Bottle @ Mike's House. Pours a pale yellow color with a small white head. Huge pear on this, which I quite enjoyed. Some white wine, oak, and tangy lemon zest and juice. A really nice fruit character and a touch of warming winter spice and white pepper to it as well. Some subtle malt sweetness along with juicy pear. Finish is perhaps a touch on the Smarties side of things, but I still enjoyed the beer overall.
Cask Handpump at Hops Belgian Style Cafe Bar, Crewe 29/04/2017 Hoppy aroma. Small white head. Light golden coloured and a little hazy in appearance. Hoppy and slightly pale with a citrus fruit flavour. A hint of dryness in a bitter malt finish.
Can, from the brewery. Faintly cloudy reddish brown with foamy tan head that flops down immediately, woodsy acidic aroma, medium carbonation, sour woodsy malt taste, thin body, long sour finish. Interesting brew.
31st July 2022Can. Pours a hazy carrot colour and doesn't throw a head. Nose of briny fruity carrot. Palate is light and fairly smooth, decent fine minerally carbonation on the back end. Bonkers gose! All elements are obvious and somehow meld together. Floral but slightly tart lemon into soft carrot and well integrated vanilla. The blood orange sits slightly behind. A nice level of Gose brine runs throughout and keeps the sweeter elements in check and is very obvious on the semi dry finish. Tasty! Drinkable! Bonkers!
16th July 2022Can. Hazy orange gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and mildly dry, decent fine minerally carbonation.  Light malts, a thin creamy sweetness, nicely positioned for this brew. Bought this because I thought it was a single hop Ahtanum. Mildly pithy orange and mandarin with a trace of mango. Smooth pine overlay. Touch of candyish fruits. Light semi dry finish brings a modest hop spice nibble. Crisp and bright and refreshing.
Aroma; straw, grass, fruits, caramel malts, apricot peel. Look; off white head on veiled blonde golden body, field lacing. Taste; straw, grass, fruits, caramel malts, nutty notes, and finishes balanced. Feel; okay body and normal co². Overall; very nice blonde. I think it was 5.5%. [15cl (as 6.5% abv) from tap @ Agenturet Tromsø].
Bottle from DogTap. It pours very pale almost greenish gold with a tiny white head. The taste is somehow sweet, sour and savoury, tangy crunchy apple, definite sake / rice pudding, melon, white wine, grain husk and hay. The taste is fairly sweet upfront, juicy, tangy, crunchy, sherbet, sweet white grape, green apple skin, limeade, white grape, melon, savoury, splash of sake, rice pudding, hit of acidity and light umami with a dry finish. Average body and fine, prickly carbonation. Quite interesting stuff.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Almost clear gold beer, small white head. Light palate, mildly dry, very mild carbonation. Thin malts, a little creamy sweetness. Smooth pine. Modest ripe citrus. Light semi dry finish. A mixed bag. Nothing to dislike but nothing to rave about either.
Bottle from the brewery online shop. Pours milky yellow with a thick white head. Aromas of light straw and honeydew melon. Taste is grassy, light lemon and light spice. Dry finish.
Tap at Hopdog, Munich, 19th September 22.  Pours a honey colour.  Aroma is straw and hay, with caramel and honey.  Taste is smooth, bittersweet, tasty, honey notes, fresh grass, cracking stuff
C: deep berry red, frothy pink head
N: very berry, lactose, berry milkshake, redcurrant, blackcurrant, blackberries, pinch of cinnamon & brown sugar, lightly tangy & sour
P: med bodied, low to med carbonation, sour, very fruity, lots of black and redcurrant, blackberries, gelato, blackberry seeds, tangy, very fruity sour mouth-puckering finish with light rock salt. Cinnamon and especially the maple syrup not traceable. Overall a very tasty sour.
3rd August 2022GBBF Day 2. Cask. Opaque dark brown beer, a very short pale tan head. Palate is light and semi dry, decent fine carbonation. Good dark malts, smooth dark chocolate, trace of milk chocolate. Smooth pine. Light semi dry finish.
Draught @ the brewery. Murky brown with reddish tint against the light, large spongy beige head, faint caramel aroma, medium carbonation, sweetish caramel taste with roasty, spicy flavor, thin body, longish finish. Not bad.
3rd August 2022GBBF Day 2. Cask. Light haze on this yellowish gold beer, small bubbly pale cream colour head. Smooth palate, mildly dry, decent fine minerally carbonation. Light malts, sweet. Very floral hops. Light pine. Light crisp citrus. Dry finish. A good floral lager.
Bottle at home, from an online peddler, 19/09/22.
Mahogany brown with a decent beige cap that veers edgewards. 
Nose is dried fruit rinds, toasted brown sugars, vinous, sherry hint, fruit cake.
Taste comprises toffee, dried fruit rinds, dates, sticky toffee pudding, molasses, brown sugar melt, oak, booze tunes.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a balanced rising boost. 
Solid well balanced barley wine is life.
3rd August 2022GBBF Day 2. Cask. Slightly muddy looking reddish brown beer, small bubbly pale tan head. Light palate, semi dry, decent fine carbonation. Fairly wishy washy malts for a brown, mild earthyness. Trace of malt cream. Mild fruits. Fairly light dry finish. Okay.
On tap at The Rusty Bucket, Eltham. 
Hazy orange pour with a white head. 
Peach, mango, papaya & sweet citrus. Flavours of peach, mango, pineapple, papaya. Sweet fruity number. Nice.
Can, from the brewery. Pours clear light amber with very small frothy whitish head, light pumpkin aroma, high carbonation, mildly astringent, lightly pumpkin flavored, thin body, longish finish. Not very remarkable.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. A light haze on this gold beer, small bubbly pale cream colour head. Palate is light and semi dry, decent fine carbonation. Light thin malts, a nice light creamy sweetness. Smooth pine, mildly sherbet and candy citric fruits. Light finish. Nice multi layered fruits, complex lager.
Spotty beige head on a dark copper coloured body.
Malt, toffee & fruity aroma.
Medium bodied, smooth with a tingle on the back.
Malt, liquorice, toffee, peppery & orange tastes with a tangy fruity finish.
Tasty.
Can: Poured a black color stout with a medium size light brown foamy head with OK retention and light lacing. Aroma of light coffee notes with light roasted malt. Taste is a mix of light coffee notes with some light roasted malt notes with some black chocolate notes. Body is too thin for style with good carbonation. OK coffee stout with a thin body and some more coffee flavors would have been welcomed.
Very pleasant dark brown appearance. This surprised me as I was expecting something much lighter. On top of this it was surprisingly malty, another surprise. Quite powerful considering its strength and a good take on a very traditional German style.
Cask at The Rusty Bucket, Eltham. 
Gold pour with a white head. 
Aromas of grapefruit, lemon drops, touch of lime. Bitter citrusy taste. Long bitter finish.
Bottle. Pours a dark gold colour with a fluffy white head, light hop aroma with hints of citrus, the taste is medium bitterness, with a dry bitter finish.
On tap at The Rusty Bucket, Eltham. 
Dark brown pour with a beige head. 
Aromas of liquorice toffee, coffee, dark chocolate, touch of dark fruits. Tast is very similar. Sweet malty finish.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Almost opaque dark brown black beer, small bubbly tan head. Airy palate, semi dry, reasonable fine carbonation. The dark malts are dry but contain a good amount of lacto coffee cappuccino and a little espresso. Light semi dry finish. Nice coffee beer, a tad dry.
Bottle. Pours a dark gold colour with a tight white head, light hop aroma with some fruit, taste is medium bitterness with a dry bitter finish.
On tap at The Rusty Bucket, Eltham. 
Amber pour with a white head. 
Nose is apricot jam, orange marmalade, peach. Taste is pithy orange, apricot, grapefruit, dried fruit. Long hoppy finish.
Golden and pored with a small head. Pleasant medium body. Very typical of this excellent style  but far sweeter than I expected. Label was a bit faint-looked like they had run out of ink-but apart from this minor criticism this was a lovely beer. On top of this its a new brewery for me.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Light haze on this gold beer, small white head.. Smooth palate, very mild carbonation. Good sweet malts into a very floral and slightly honeyish mandarin and tangerine. Light semi dry finish. Nice, quite floral but nice.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Almost clear gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Light creamy malts, trace of smoke. Decent tangerine and floral orange hops. Smooth pine. Mild tropical fruits and a little spice. Nice.
On tap at The Rusty Bucket, Eltham. 
Cloudy gold pour with a white head. 
Nose is mango, papaya, orange toffee, pineapple. Taste is zesty orange, peach, nectarine, pink grapefruit, . Piney, zesty finish.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Light haze on this gold beer, small bubbly pale cream colour head. Smooth palate, semi dry, decent fine carbonation. Light malts, a light creamy sweetness. Not sure what hops this has been brewers with but they bring a lovely light floral lemon. A little lemon sherbet on the back end. Great cask lager, exceptional actually. So difficult to deliver good lager in cask.
Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours clear purple with a thick pink head. Aromas of blackcurrant and black cherry, faint sour notes. Taste is sharp sour, blackcurrant, blackcurrant leaf. Sharp bitter finish. Nice.
Can. Pours a hazy orange colour with a fluffy white head, plenty of hops and fruit in the aroma, the taste is medium bitterness with a soft fruity finish.
On tap at The Rusty Bucket, Eltham. 
Hazy gold pour with a white head. 
Big citrusy nose, touch of apricot ,peach. Taste is grapefruit, melon, white grape, pear. Fruit laden aftertaste.
Can from Appellation Wines. Pours clear yellow gold with a thin white head. Aromas of light tropical fruit and bread. Taste is light corn and tinned peach. Thin finish.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Light palate, semi dry, decent fine carbonation. Thin malts, a ripe creamy sweetness
 Light pine. Fair amount of hop spice. Ripe citrus,  some floral lemon. Light finish. Pretty good for a West Coaster!
On tap at the Afterthought Taproom in Lombard, IL., dispensed to house stemware, showing a clear, deep burgundy color, with a slight, pink tinge to the off-white froth, with ribbons & spots of lacing. The nose was funk, dark berry, red wine grape, floral hints, and compatible sweetness. A little less than medium bodied, the taste was as the aroma notes, with nice spritz to the effervescence, lemony tartness & tanginess, skins & berries, dryness, some vinous character, with slight earthy bitterness.
Draught at Centre St: pours pale for a dunkel. Light pale brown. Aroma is lightly toasty, pretzels. Taste is mild, light bitterness, toast. Fine.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Hazy deep gold beer, small white head. Smooth and slightly viscous palate, reasonable fine carbonation. Sweet creamy malts. Sweet esters. A little ripe fruits. Light semi dry finish. Okay.
Draught at source: pours hazy pale yellow with white head. Aroma is strawberry and floral notes. Weak strawberry taste but drinkable.
Bronze and clear with no head. Powerful and the barrel ageing is really
reflected in the taste. With the strength comes a pleasant non threatening flavour which is easy to drink. Sometimes barley wines can be a bit flat but this one is far from that. Another good one from this brewery.
Can, 0.473l. Aroma of passion fruit, mango, citrus and grape skin. Pours hazy dark golden color with large soapy off-white head and average sparkling appearance. Taste starts ripe tropical fruity and citrusy, following is resinous, bready and medicinal, mouthfeel is warm and mild spicy, while finish is moderate bitter. Medium to full body, oily texture and lively carbonation in palate. Phantastic hoppy…
Aroma; many fermented fruits, syrup malts, straw, apple peel. Look; dense off white head on misty deep golden body, spot lacing. Taste; yeasty fruits, pharmacy, syrup malts, perfumed herbs, and finishes herbal n perfumed. Feel; okay body and normal co². Overall; specially perfumed hops.  [15cl from tap @ Agenturet Tromsø].
Draught at source: pours muddy brown with a whitish head. Aroma is a very sugary cake. Sweet, light bitterness. Too much pastry like notes. Vanilla notes in there too.
On tap at The Rusty Bucket, Eltham. Hazy gold pour with a white head. 
Aromas of tropical fruit, peach,nectarine, tangerine. Flavours of peach, nectarine, mango,  pink grapefruit, passionfruit. Sweet fruity mouthfeel. Good stuff.
Hazy yellow and a noticeably thick texture. Loads of fruity flavours are 
present to a point that they become overpowering. Still not too bad, and a new brewery for me.
Keg at Mother Arch ii, 16/09/22.
Lightly hazed golden orange with a good sized white cap that stays for the show 
Nose is melon, bread dough, soft malts, papaya, melon, mixed tropical fruits. 
Taste comprises orange peel, melon, faint pine, grass, airy malts, papaya, mandarin.
Medium bodied, fine massaging carbonation, semi drying close splashes with balanced juicy hop bitterness. 
Solid well rounded pale.
Can from Beer 52 – drank at home.  Pours a hazy golden amber with minimal offwhite head.  Aroma has oranges, marmalade and a hint of ginger.  In the mouth the initial sensation is pine, herbs and alcoholic strength.  Bitter oranges follow quickly along with  traditional hops and traces of grapefruit.  Finish has some citrus but the alcohol softens this.  Very nice and dangerously drinkable – more of a DIPA than a pale ale though.

Can from The Star & Garter, Bromley. 
Black pour with a tan head. Nose is Bounty bar, sweet tobacco, liquorice. Taste is sweet tobacco, liquorice toffee, dark chocolate Bounty bar, cocoa. Oodles of underlying bitterness in the close.
Draft. A hazy amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of malt, caramel, hops, and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw, malt, caramel, and hops, leading to a bitter finish.
Orange appearance that is slightly hazy. Citrus flavours dominate and there's  a medium body. Also a slightly bitter edge which makes it stand out but apart from this its pretty bland. Left no lacing. Another new brewery for me.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Light haze on this gold beer, small bubbly white head. Light palate, fairly dry, reasonable fine carbonation. Thin but sweet malts, a good creamy sweetness. Floral fruits. Very floral. Sweet fruits on the back end which is fairly dry.
Can at The Barrel & Horn, Bromley. 
Hazy yellow/ gold pour with a white head. Aromas of  passionfruit, peach, mango pineapple. Taste is sweet citrus, peach, tropical fruit. Sweet fruity action. Very tasty.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Hazy gold beer, small bubbly pale cream colour head. Smooth and fairly dry pale, decent fine carbonation. Thin pale malts, a good creamy sweetness. Smooth pine into sweet but slightly tangy ripe citrus. A fairly dry finish. Fine, nothing to get excited about.
Translucent slightly hazy straw body, medium cream head. Aroma spicy and perfumy with pine and pineapple. Body extremely floral with a piny, slightly acidic bite. Solid but unremarkable.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Light haze on this gold beer, small bubbly pale cream colour head. Light palate, semi dry, decent fine carbonation. Light sweet malts, a fairy sweet creamy sweetness. Good floral hops, sweet pine and sweet floralness. Mildly perfumed. Nice lager, different, layered.
Deep hazy (not cloudy) body, thick cream head. Aroma sweet with candied oranges and hints of alcohol. Body sweet and oily, with lots of candied fruit (oranges, berries), some underlying dankness, and an odd grapiness. This was a miss for me.
Can online from Cork & Cask Edinburgh. Pours almost clear chestnut amber with a beige cap. Aroma: caramel, toffee, raisins, berries. Taste:  light to moderate sweet & bitter, caramel dominates, also toffee, dried fruit esters, berries. Medium body with fine carbonation. Really enjoyed this. 

2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Opaque dark brown beer, small bubbly tan head. Smooth palate, decent fine carbonation. Smooth dark malts, very good chocolate malts. Dunno about agave but very smooth mint. Ends up massively After Eight pseudo minty. Very pleasing and easy drinking.
On tap at Drunken Duck Vicenza. Black with tan head. Roasty, chocolate, coffee, smooth. Medium sweetness and body.
Above average stout. Roasted malt with a semi-sweet chocolate note. Medium weight a dark brown.
Draught at source: pours copper with large head, but I think I had a bad tap. Aroma is toffee and biscuit. Taste is a little off as it was in the ass end of the keg.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Light haze on this gold beer, small bubbly pale cream colour head. Palate is smooth and semi dry, decent fine carbonation. Light smooth creamy malts. Lively ripe citrus fruits. A little pine. Light semi dry finish. Tasty enough.
Deep murky purple body, quickly dissipating pink-purple head. Aromma sweet berries and cinnamon pastry. Body is thick, sweet, and tart, loaded with berries with a nice complement of cinnamon and toasted bread. Yum.
Average pale ale with a good hoppy balance. Light body with a golden color. Easy to drink.
Solid smoothie sour. Tart with good blueberry notes. Nice color and weight.
On tap at the Afterthought Brewing Taproom in Lombard, IL., dispensed to house stemware, showing a fairly clear, orangey/gold color, with a healthy layer of soft white froth, and ribbons of lacing. The nose was slight funk, a wheat-like malt presence, with a touch of dried fruit, citrus peel, and slight witbier spice. Medium bodied, the taste was as the aroma notes, adding lemony & earthy tartness & tanginess, lively effervescence, and some dryness to the finish. A nicely rustic, Wit & Saison hybrid.
Bronze with a small head .Powerful and full bodied. Smooth and dangerously easy to drink considering its high strength. Quite sweet and left a lingering after taste. I was surprised to see that this was only my second rating from this fairly well known brewery.
Draught at Dumbo: pours deep gold with white head. Grainy with hints of caramel. Taste us somewhat crisp, light bitterness, herbs, not too sweet.
Can.  It poured a golden color with a white head.  The aroma was of hops, citrus and florals.  The taste was similar to the aroma with more hops, citrus, florals, tropical fruits, pine with medium carbonation and a nice semi bitter aftertaste.  Not bad.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Hazy amber beer, small bubbly pale cream colour head. Palate is light and quite dry, decent fine carbonation. Smooth blueberry supports the mildly tart lime. Some very light caramel on the dry finish. Tasty enough but quite dry.
Mentioned as Grapefruit Cold IPA. Hazy color and medium weight. Definite citrus notes.
Above average coffee blonde. Good roasted bean aroma. Slightly bitter and grainy.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Muddy brown beer, tiny tan head. Smooth palate, semi dry, reasonable fine carbonation. Soft rich dark malts, sourish. Creamy dark malts on the back end, sourish chocolate. A mess to be frank, well on cask anyway...
On tap at The Barrel & Horn, Bromley. 
Hazy blood orange pour with a white head. Nose is peach, mango, papaya, apricot jam. Taste is pineapple, peach, mango, nectarine, sweet citrus. Sweet fruity foretaste with a splash of  bitterness in the aftertaste. Very nice.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Gold with white head. This is a crisp, malty bitter style beer from the off. Touches of apricot and lemon. It refreshing and fine.
2nd August 2022GBBF Day 1. Cask. Just a light haze on this burnished gold beer, small bubbly pale cream colour head. Palate is light and semi dry, good fine carbonation. Thinnish malts, mildly sweet. Decent orange peel. A little esters. Perfumey pine. Dry hop spicy finish. Neither Idaho or Lemondrop to the fore for me and that is a real disappointment.
Hazy yellow and poured with a massive head. This  took some time to dissipate. Fruity medium body. This brewery usually produces some interesting beers  but this is not one of them. Dont get me wrong, its a pleasant drink with some nice fruity flavours floating around. But so similar to so many others Think the giveaway is that its in partnership with Deya who produce a lot of taste similar beers .Disappointing bit still superior to a lot of others.
Bottle (MilkHead). Just reddish brown with a dense beige head. Intriguing aroma of crackery funk, spices, wormwood? Medium bodied, alive, spritzy. Briefly sweet with some dark sugars or stewed fruit, then herbal and woody notes come through. Like that insistent bitterness - presumably a combination of rye, hop and wood. The foxing is part of the charm but it wouldn't matter if the beer weren't tasty.
On tap as a pint serving at the newly reopened Butterfield Taproom in the Wheaton, IL. Whole Foods Market, showing a fairly clear, deep amber color, with a nice array of rising effervescence, a persistently sudsy layer of tan froth, and clinging ribbons & spots of lacing. The nose was malty, with a hearty Munich scent, and a mildly sweet combination of caramel & honey. Medium bodied, the taste was similar notes, with lively carbonation, finishing with a lightly grassy and mellow grain-like bitterness. A nice cross between Euro & American styles. Very flavorful & drinkable.
Cask conditioned at York Beer Festival '22, N.Yorks. Clouded amber with white head. This proved to be quite a fusty beer, fruity, peachy. Obviously made before they closed for good. It's okay.
Draught at Dumbo: pours opaque haze with white head. Aroma is floral and fruity. Taste is sweet, light bitterness. Bright and tangy. Good.
Hazy double IPA by La Source, pint from tap there (during the BXL Beerfest afterparty).  Snow white, moussy, shred-lacing, slowly breaking head on a cloudy yolk-yellow blonde beer with vaguely greenish tinge.  Aroma of dried lemon zest, pomelo juice, green mango, Conference pear, lemonbread, unripe banana, green onions, lemonbalm and a subtle ‘dank’ sweaty note.  Crisp, ‘green-fruity’ onset, green melon and unripe banana, crisp carbonation, supple yet sometimes slightly powdery mouthfeel (not that this bothers me in this kind of beers).  Soggy cracker-like malt core under primarily green and citric hop aromas, pomelo, green onion, lemongrass and lime zest notes, providing a pleasantly drying and spicy, grassy bitterness as well, more so than is typically the case in a NEDIPA.  The alcohol warms a little bit but remains generally well hidden – an important point for me especially in this type of beers.  Dry for a NEDIPA, but very decent, typical reliable Source quality I would argue.
Deliberately ‘amplified’ version of Cuvée de Mortagne (making use of champagne yeast to ‘spike’ the alcohol) aged in specific sherry barrels; from tap at BXL Beerfest, cheers Glenn!  No head at all (not even a ring of bubbles), cloudy dark mahogany brown robe with burgundy tinge, looking a bit ‘muddy’.  Very intense, beguiling bouquet of caramel liqueur, sweet sherry and lots of it, cashew nut purée, hazelnut oil, yellow raisins, madera sauce, brown rum, vanilla-scenting oak wood, tawny port, ripe banana and a vague ‘wild’ hint of farmland somewhere.  Densely sweet onset, candied cherries, yellow raisins and fried figs, flat carb, full and vinous to almost slightly syrupy body; ‘banana pulp’, cooked pear and candied fig notes over a hazelnutty, caramelly malt body, residual dark sugariness versus tannic and very vanilla-scenting woodiness in the end – followed by spicy notes and warming, port-, rum- and obviously sherry-like alcohol.  Barleywine-esque interpretation of what was originally intended as a quadrupel, but has evolved in its very own idiomatic way after so many years and so many mutations; in any case one of the more memorable beers of the festival, with a drinkability that is very clearly disproportionate with the hefty amount of alcohol it contains – I am not sure if I ever had a beer of this strength that hides is alcohol this well and made me think it was only half as strong.  Delicious.
Rum barrel aged Canadian stout with seven spices; sampled at BXL Beerfest.  Yellowish mocha-beige, moussy, stable head, ink black robe.  Intensely spiced aroma, clove, cinnamon, anise and allspice upfront, far less obvious but still noticeable cardamom, nutmeg, ginger and vanilla, very clear rum as well, unsugared black chocolate, burnt toast, wet wood, black coffee, dried prunes, paraffin, ‘Borstbollen’ and Christmas cake.  Dense, dryish onset, hints of dried fig and dried blueberry, lively carbonated for style with full, oily body; rich smooth maltiness shifting between sweet toffee and bitter black chocolate and roasted coffee bitterness, under an enormous amount of ethereal, warming and inevitably astringent ‘wintery’ spiciness, further enhanced by the spicy character of the rum, which also adds a warming afterglow.  Again it is the clove, allspice, cinnamon and anise which are very prominent; nutmeg, cardamom and ginger are less clearly distinguishable and vanilla is all but lost in this spicy violence.  Technically a perfectly fine barrel aged stout, ruined by a complete and near-fatal overdose of spices, not my personal cup of tea but some will certainly enjoy this.
Bottle.  It poured an amber color with a white head.  The aroma was of malts, grains, and hops.  The taste was similar to the aroma with more malts, grains, hops, caramel, some spices with medium carbonation and a nice mellow aftertaste.  Interesting.
Brown. Label on the label said that it was 4 per cent not 3.8. Slightly nutty flavour with a medium body. A good traditional bitter. Pleasant but nothing to get too excited about.
On tap at The Barrel & Horn, Bromley. 
Cloudy orange pour with a white head. 
Rich sweet fruit aromas- mango, pineapple,  peach, nectarine,  sweet citrus. Taste is peach, mango, nectarine, papaya, passionfruit, oodles of sweet fruit. Long bittersweet finish.
Keg at Bristol Craft Beer Festival 2022. Pours clear pale straw with a white cap. Light, clean, bread, biscuit malts, some lemon. Light to moderate sweet & light bitter. Light body with soft carbonation
Sample.  It poured a hazy dark orange color with a white head.  The aroma was of cinnamon, nutmeg and pumpkin.  The taste was similar to the aroma with more cinnamon, nutmeg, pumpkin, caramel, malts with medium carbonation and a nice mellow aftertaste.  Good stuff.
On tap at The Barrel & Horn, Bromley. 
Hazy orange pour with a white head. 
Mango, peach & apricot jam aromas. Taste is very similar to the above. Tart, fruit laden finish.
Smells of sweet mattress a very nice beer a nice malty taste followed by a slight happy taste
On tap at the newly reopened Butterfield Taproom in the Wheaton, IL. Whole Foods Market, served to a tulip/goblet, showing a darkest brown color, with light amber highlighting, a presentable layer of tan froth, and foamy spots of lacing. The nose was malty, toast, roast, and mild peat, with some caramel & toffee sweetness. Better than medium bodied, the taste was as the aroma notes, with decent carbonation that possessed a bit of seltzer-like spritz, and moderate, roasted bitterness. A hearty, nicely drinkable brew.
Draught at Dumbo: pours golden yellow with white head. Light Belgian yeast and modest grain. Taste low bitterness, low sweetness. Easy.
On tap at The Star & Garter, Bromley. 
Black pour with a tan head. Cocoa, vanilla, cappuccino, liquorice & dark chocolate aromas. Rich warming taste of cocoa,chocolate cake,  raisin, cappuccino, vanilla. Uber warming alcohol infusion. Warm sweet boozy finish. Luvverly!
On tap.  It poured a hazy golden color with a white head.  The aroma was of hops, citrus and florals.  The taste was similar to the aroma with more hops, citrus, florals, tropical fruits, pine with medium carbonation and a nice bitter sweet aftertaste.  Tasty.
Keg at The Star & Garter, Bromley. Golden orange pour with a white head. 
Nose is toffee, orange marmalade, touch of sweet spice. Bretty taste, splash of bitter orange, apricot,  sweet malt. Warm, spicy mouthfeel. Lots of bitter orange in the close.
On tap.  It poured a hazy golden color with a white head.  The aroma was of mangoes, wheat and malts.  The taste was similar to the aroma with more mangoes, wheat, malts, tropical fruits, citrus with medium carbonation and a nice refreshing aftertaste.  Not bad.
On tap at The Star & Garter, Bromley. 
Hazy claret coloured pour with a light pink head. Nutty old nose, marshmallow, red fruits & digestive biscuit in thete too. Cherry drops, peanut butter and marshmallow taste. Nutty red fruit action.
A 750ml corked and caged bottle, 1999 vintage, bottle no. 05590, with a notched best before date of December 2005. Poured into a 3 Fonteinen gueuze glass. It was a clear bright copper orange colour with no head and no lacing. Aromas tart, funky, barnyard, musty, damp wood, apple, citrus, orange, vinegar, with maybe some berry notes. Tastes tart, sour, apple, apple cider vinegar, mixed berries, lemon juice. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Overall this was interesting, and I probably want to say, past it’s prime, although unfortunately I don’t really have a reference point since this is the first one I’ve tried. But there was still some nice flavours going on. Worth a try, especially for those that enjoy gueuze like I do.
On tap at The Star & Garter, Bromley. Hazy gold pour with a white head. Earthy, bitter citrusy nose. Grapefruit & lemon zest flavours. Zesty bitter finish. Tidy, tasty brew.
Draught at Dumbo: pours hazy with white head. Aroma is ambiguous citrus. Sessionable. Low sweetness. Some light bitterness. Smooth.
On tap at The Star & Garter, Bromley. 
Hazy yellow pour with a white head. 
Fresh minty nose, splash of lime and zesty lemon in the background. Citrus and fresh mint heavy flavours, vanilla & chocolate most certainly there too. Very refreshing, could probably clean your teeth & keep your breath fresh too.
Can sourced from Ales and Brews and drunk at home (18/09/2022) - hazy golden pour with a white head. Vibrant fruity aroma and taste some white grape and gooseberry, citrus lemon and orange notes, light peachy, sweet malty backbone, piney hoppy finish. Good stuff.
440ml can from Vineyard, Belfast. Brought back to Jersey by a friend. Pours cloudy yellow with a good sized white foamy head. Aromas & tastes of passion fruit, peach, pineapple, orange, melon, pine, biscuit & hints of pepper. Medium body. Dry light bitter finish. Outstanding NEIPA & surprising to see the low ratings here
330ml bottle. Hazy yellow color. Leather, herbal, yeasty, bit sourish in aroma/taste.
Can sourced from Ales and Brews and drunk at home (18/09/2022) - hazed yellow with a white head. Tropical and citrus fruity medley offered here, getting some mango and cantaloupe, peach and some citrus juicy satsuma, sweetish malty backing, resinous light bitter hoppy finish. Alright.
330ml can. Clear dark amber color. Sweet, malty, citrus, grapefruit, some bread in aroma/taste.
330ml can. Pitch black color. Roast, chocolate, booze, alcohol, cocoa, bitter in aroma/taste.
330ml can. Pitch black color. Toffee, roast, chocolate, alcohol, woody, dry in aroma/taste.
Can picked up at Pulpwine and drunk at home (18/09/2022) - hazed up yellow with a white head. Juicy fruity aroma and taste with lots of mango and papaya, tangerine and some peachy notes, sweet malty support, piney light balanced hoppy close. Tasty gear.
330ml can. Pitch black color. Roast, chocolate, alcohol, sweet toffee in aroma/taste.
Draught at Dumbo: pours clear gold with wjite head. Grainy and a little bit grassy. Clean with bitter finish.
Cask at The Star & Garter, Bromley. Hazy orange pour with a white head. 
Nose is most certainly tangerine and melon, splash of peach, mango. Very citrusy taste, splosh of peach. Fruity citrusy finish.
Can picked up at Pulpwine and drunk at home (18/09/2022) - deep reddish purple with a pink head. Tart fruity with prominent blackcurrant, tangy dark berry fruits, undercurrents of some light vanilla sweetness seeping through, sour fruity dense mouthfeel and body, getting a pinch of salt into the tart lingering fruity close. Very nice.
Draught in Dumbo: pours clear gold. Aroma is grainy and vegetal sort of. Taste is sweet and lightly bitter.
On tap at The Lock & Barrel, Bromley. Hazy gold pour with a white head. 
Nose is pineapple, sweet citrus, peach, mango. Taste is mango, apricot, peach, grapefruit, pineapple. Light hit op bitter hops in the close.
Bottle online from Beers Of Europe.
Pours a clear golden copper colour with a medium sized throthy off white head. Aromas of toffee, caramel, biscuits and floral. Taste has more toffee and caramel, bread, biscuits and a touch more floral. Malty with light earthy hops on the finish. Medium body, fairly low carbonation and smooth slightly oily mouthfeel. Good flavour for a low abv beer.
Can sourced from Ales and Brews and drunk at home (17/09/2022) - opaque golden yellow with a creamy like white head. Intense bold fruity with the nelson shinning here with lots of crushed gooseberry and sweet white grape, tropical and citrus fruity backing, soft dense sweet malts, glimmer of mosaic blueberry into the robust hoppy finish. Gorgeous.
330ml bottle from La Buena Pinta, Madrid. Pours black with an off white head. Aromas & tastes of cocoa, lactose, oats, strawberries & hops. Medium body. Light bitter finish. Highly enjoyable
Tap at Holiday Inn Calais. Pours a clear gold colour with a tight white head, light malt aroma, the taste is medium bitterness with a dry bitter finish.
Can. Deep gold with a white head. Quite malty aroma with toast and breadcrust; spices and grass. Pretty much how it tastes too - much more like a Czech lager than a Kiwi pils - no real fruit from the Nelson Sauvin, all spicy/ grassy punch. And it works fine. Sweetish with some richness but firmly bitter in the end. Good.
Can picked up at Pulpwine and drunk at home (17/09/2022) - hazy golden orange with a white head. Sweet juicy fruity with notes of peach and mango, some tangerine, citrus peel, hop spice bite, sweet malty backing, bitter edged hoppy close.
Cask at The Lock & Barrel, Bromley. Reddish amber pour with a white head. 
Malts, dried fruit & toffee aromas. Nuts,dried fruit & toffee flavours. Long malty bitter finish.
330ml bottle (shop, Hamburg). Pitch black color. Smoked bbq sauce, sweet, tomatoes, sugary, no maple found in aroma/taste.
Can sourced from Ales and Brews and drunk at home (17/09/2022) - hazy golden orange with a white head. Sweet fruity with lots of grapefruit and orange, peachy notes, sweet malty backing, medium body, piney bitter hoppy close. Good stuff.
Can sourced from Ales and Brews and drunk at home (17/09/2022) - hazed up golden pour with a white head. Vibrant medley of tropical and citrus fruit offered, some tender juicy satsuma segments, some mango and pineapple chunks, sweet malty support, pine needles, balanced to medium bitter hoppy close. Very nice.
Can from The Rusty Bucket, Eltham. Black pour with a tan head. 
Nose is dark fruits, cinnamon, cola, light coffee notes. Taste is cola, cinnamon, liquorice. Cola- liquorice concoction. Interesting but not expressively tasty.
Can sourced from Ales and Brews and drunk at home (16/09/2022) - very hazy yellow with a nice white head. Punchy bold fruity aroma and taste, lots of citrus grapefruit and lemon, some pineapple and cantaloupe, juicy fruity, sweet creamy malts, lingering hoppy finish. Very nice.
330ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Clear amber color. Malty, grainy, barley, citrus, watery in aroma/taste.
Can sourced from Ales and Brews and drunk at home (16/09/2022) - hazy golden pour with a white head. Intense layers of stonefruit with succulent juicy nectarine, mango and fleshy peach, hop spice, zesty citrus peel, sweet creamy malty backbone, assertive hoppy finish. Lovely stuff, really brings out the best of Galaxy.
330ml bottle (thanks Erzengel). Clear dark copper color. Very bretty, sweet, sugary, caramel, hoppy in aroma/taste.
330ml bottle from Darts Farm. Pours brown with a tiny off white head. Aromas & tastes of seaweed & hints of smoke. Moderate body. Dry light bitter finish. Somewhat disappointing, lacking in depth.
Can picked up at Pulpwine and drunk at home (16/09/2022) - hazy golden pour with a white head. Juicy fruity with lots of red grapefruit, tangelo and marmalade shred, zesty citrus peel and pithy rind, set upon a soft pillowy malty backing, light idaho back tea nuance into the piney balanced hoppy finish. Goes down a treat, lovely.
440ml can (freebie from Hamburg). Pitch black color. Sweet, massive peanuts, sugary, toffee in aroma/taste.
Cask at JDWs in Surbiton. Dark pour, lots of caramel malt, light chocolate, some smoke
Can sourced from Ales and Brews and drunk at home (15/09/2022) - totally opaque yellow with a creamy white head. Intense fruity with a punchy cross section of tropical and citrus fruit, some sweetshop pineapple cubes, grapefruit and motueka induced lime across the palate, big dense substantial sweet creamy smooth malty backbone, robust hoppy finish. Gorgeous.
Cask at JDWs in Surbiton. Dark brown pour, caramel sweetness, hint of chocolate. Solid beer.
Can sourced from Ales and Brews and drunk at home (15/09/2022) - hazed yellow with a lively white head. Juicy fruity with with notes of grapefruit and pineapple, more citrus notes of satsuma and pomelo coming in, soft creamy sweet malty layer of support, piney resinous balanced bitter hoppy finish. Tasty.
Keg. Hazy blond with a tall, lasting white head. Citrus and stone fruits, fresh herbs, clean malts, some pine. Light and fresh and quaffable. Medium carbonation and moderate length and intensity zesty bitterness.
Draught at Dumbo: pours gold with white head. Clean light grainy. Taste is lightly bready, low sweetness, super clean.
Keg. Clear ruddy amber with a lasting off-white head. Spicy red fruits, rye, fresh herbs, caramel, biscuit. Mid-weight, medium carbonation and a moderate length and intensity spicy, bready, resin bitterness to finish.
Draught at Dumbo: pours opaque with white head. Aroma is oniony and citrusy. Scallion and light bitterness in taste.
Can from Ocado. Black pour with a tan head. Nose is chocolate caramel, cocoa, toffee. Taste is coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa. Very nice aftertaste, bumps up the score somewhat.
Can from The Rusty Bucket, Eltham. Amber pour with a white head. Nose is orange marmalade, tropical fruits, apricot jam. Taste is exceedingly similar to the above. Jammy bitter fruity finish. Most enjoyable.
Keg. Hazy golden yellow with a tall and lasting, fluffy white head. Aromas of citrus, banana, clove, wheat. Light and refreshing with a mid-palate fullness. Medium carbonation a spicy, aromatic finish of moderate length.
Cask at JDWs in Surbiton. Going pour, lots of citrus, zest, biscuity malt, a little yeasty. Solid beer.
330ml bottle (thanks Erzengel). Clear golden color. Sweet, malty, bready, mild hops in aroma/taste.
Tap Holiday Inn Calais. Pours a clear gold colour with a tight white head, light hop aroma, the taste is medium bitterness with a dry bitter finish.
An amber beer, a head is medium and blond. Aroma has fruitness, fructose, spicyness. Taste has fruitness, apricot, peach, some spicyness. Medium bodied. Slightly messy.
375ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Clear deep amber color. Acidic, sour, lots of pepper, rhubarb juice in aroma/taste.
Can from The Rusty Bucket, Eltham. Hazy golden orange pour with a white head. Aromas of tropical fruit, sweet citrus, pineapple. Taste is awash with tropical & citrus fruits, a light back note of kiwifruit. Zesty, fruit laden finish. Very nice.
Cask at JDWs in Surbiton. Malty, fairly sweet, full body, bit of citrus. OK beer.
440ml can (thanks FatPhil). Cloudy orange color. Citrus, lactose, fruity, juicy, malty in aroma/taste.
At DUMBO: sort of hazy with white head. Aroma is grapefruit. Taste is fairly dry and citrusy. 
Can picked up at Kihoskh and drunk at home (11/09/2022) - hazed up yellow with a nice healthy white head. Intense juicy fruity with loads of stonefruit giving succulent mango and nectarine, fleshy peach, some strata induced berry chiming in, dense sweet creamy malty body and mouthfeel, touch of spring onion, lingering solid hoppy close. Beautiful.
Tap @ the Molen. Amber color Walnut and dried fruit in the aroma. Sweet. Burning alcohol, bitter walnuts. Dried fruit and pear. Decent but not outstanding.
375ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Clear yellow color. Acidic, sour, battery acid, woody, raw grape skins in aroma/taste.
Can from The Rusty Bucket, Eltham. Amber pour with a white head. Nose is toffee, pine, citrus. Taste is grapefruit, zesty lemon, lots of piney bitter hops in the close.
330ml bottle (thanks Erzengel). Clear dark copper color. Grainy, barley, mild hops, bready, brett in aroma/taste.
How: Draught.
Where: MBCC 2022.
Appearance: Hazy light red colour with a white head.
Aroma: Malt, fruit, tart, sour, yeast.
Body: Medium body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Fruit, tart, sour, malt, funk.
Can at a tasting. Murky orange color. Passion fruit, tropical aromas. Sour, passion fruit, apples, lemon, pineapple flavors. Medium-bodied, smooth, thick.
330ml bottle (Beershop, Köln). Misty golden color. Grainy, barley, dusty, mild hops in aroma/taste.
Can picked up at Kihoskh and drunk at home (11/09/2022) - opaque yellow with a white head. Vibrant punchy juicy fruity with waves of grapefruit and mango, lychee, sweet malty support, assertive dank hoppy finish. Beautiful, really comes together well and drinks well below its 8%abv
Can at a tasting. Cloudy yellow. Fruity, onion, piney hops. Sweet, fruity, orange, lemon, grassy, bitter. Medium-bodied, smooth.
Cask at The Park Tavern, Eltham. Copper coloured pour with a beige head. Herby bitter nose, malts aplenty. Dried fruit, malts & hops in the taste. Good easy going sessionable brew.
Funky white grape nose. Milky peach colored, thin head. Malt and papaya. Medium body, moderate carbonation.
Can from OH Centre: pours hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is mango, pineapple, some citrus. Taste is sweet and smooth. Both OH and RB styles come through. Excellent.
Can at a tasting. Cloudy yellow. Fruity hops, vanilla, some onion. Sweet, vanilla, fruity hops, some grapefruit. Medium-bodied.
Can picked up at Kihoskh and drunk at home (11/09/2022) - hazd golden yellow with a white head. Juicy fruity aroma and taste, lots of mango and cantaloupe, some pineapple and a splash of lemon and some nice zesty citrus rind, semi sweet malty backing, piney solid hoppy finish. Lovely drop.
Can: Poured a hazy/cloudy orangey color ale with a small foamy head with light retention and light lacing. Aroma of citrus hops undertones with some juicy notes, some residual sugar notes and warming fusel notes. Taste is also a mix of citrusy hops notes with some juicy hops undertones and some warming fusel notes with somewhat overwhelming residual sugar notes. Body is full with good carbonation. Though style to master and this example lacks cohesion and shows too much fusle notes.
Weed nose. Clear amber, thin head. Lilly, weed. Medium body, easy carbonation. Dankest beer I've had from DFH. Very good.
500ml bottle (random shop, Poland). Clear golden color. Sweet, malty, hop extract, jammy in aroma/taste.
Can picked up at the Social Beer Shop and drunk at home (10/09/2022) - hazed yellow with a white head. Lots of nelson goodness with crushed gooseberry and tender juicy white grape, some Idaho red grapefruit and marmalade and light black tea accents, pine needles, hop spice bite, robust balanced bitter hoppy finish. Tasty gear.
Can at a tasting. Hazy pink color. Lactic, citrus, lemon zest aromas. Berries, lemon, lactic, tart flavor. Light bodied.
Charred oak, subtle cocoa nose. Cola black, medium tan head. Charred oak, smoke, burnt ends. Medium body, easy carbonation.
Can picked up at the Social Beer Shop and drunk at home (10/09/2022) - hazy golden yellow with a white head. Dense sweet juicy fruity, sweet shop fruit salad chewits and pineapple cubes, notes of lemon and pomelo, big sweet soft substantial malty backbone, vibrant fruity and assertive hoppy finish. Lovely.
Can at a tasting. Cloudy yellow. Fruity aromas. Sweetish, fruity, citrus, orange peel, vegetal, vanilla. Medium-bodied, smooth.
Red currant, unripe tart blackberry nose. Ruby red, headless. Tart blackberry. Light body, easy carbonation, tannic.
How: Draught.
Where: MBCC 2022.
Appearance: Hazy yellow colour with a white head.
Aroma: Malt, tropical fruit, hops.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, tropical fruit, hops.
Mild white grape nose, lemongrass. Hazy gold, thin head. Hay, white grape highlights. Medium body, soft carbonation.
Keg at Cloudwater, Bermondsey.  Hazy yellow.  Aroma of grapes, citrus and big funk.  Crisp and full of funky apple notes.
How: Draught.
Where: MBCC 2022.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Tart, tropical fruit, malt, sour, apricots, yeast, vanilla.
Body: Medium body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Tart, tropical fruit, malt, sour, apricots, yeast, vanilla.
Can: Poured a hazy/cloudy dark yellow color ale with a large whote foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of citrusy hops notes with some hops floral undertones and light source favors. Taste is also a mix of huge floral hops undertones with some juicy citrus hops notes, faint residual sugar and subtle spruce tips notes. Body is full with good carbonation. Enjoyable NEIPA but spruce notes could have been more dominant.
How: Draught.
Where: MBCC 2022.
Appearance: Hazy yellow colour with a white head.
Aroma: Tropical fruit, grapefruit, citrus, malt, hops.
Body: Full body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Tropical fruit, grapefruit, citrus, malt, hops.
Cumquat and starfruit nose. Milky golden, thin head. Tart cumquat, grapefruit. Light body, easy carbonation.
330ml can. Very dark brown color. Sweet, boozy, bready, raisins, alcohol, woody, burnt toffee in aroma/taste.
Keg at Beer Central Festival, Tea Works, Birmingham 17/09/2022. Pours murky yellow gold with a white cap. Ripe stone fruits, black tea, pineapple juice, some herbal notes too. Medium body with fine carbonation. Decent
Tap at BierCAB. Unclear yellow color with white head. Aroma is crackery malts, mild noble hops, some earthiness. Taste is grassy, some biscuits, dry finish, very clean. Almost boring in its cleanliness, but very nice!
Tap. Hazy pale yellow color with white head. Aroma is a bit cheesy hops, biscuits, yeast, a bit doughy. Taste is the same. Silky mouthfeel with fine-bubbled carbonation. Not bad, but a little bit cheesy.
Wood, tobacco nose, not strong. Cola brown, thin tan head. Tobacco. Light body, easy carbonation.
Tap. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is exotic fruits, mild yeast, proteins too. Taste is the same, nice smoothness. Very solid!
Tap. Hazy amber-orange color with off-white head. Aroma is earthy, grapefruit, resinous. Taste is the same, mild but nice bitterness, smooth mouthfeel. Alright.
Dishwater, malt nose. Cloudy golden, thin head. Fairly flavorless, mild dishwater. Medium body, easy carbonation.
Can. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is grassy, a bit strawy, standard Pale Ale, but not bad. Taste is the same, mild bitterness. Solid.
Can 440ml (BB: 08/03/2023) - purchased from a whisky shop in Edinburgh back in July;
Look: jet black with a bubbly dark tan coloured head. Moderate carbonation.
Aroma: chocolate, coffee, caramel, port, raisin, roasty/smokey
Body: medium end of thin
Taste: chocolate, coffee, caramel, vanilla, whisky, peat, oak, some bitterness, not overly sweet
Overall: a delightful peat flavoured imperial. Classic and balanced. Drunk as a toast to Elizabeth II on the day of her burial.
Pronounced pecan, graham cracker nose. Cloudy bronze, medium head. Pecan, dry. Medium body, easy carbonation.
Can at a tasting. Hazy red. Vanilla, candy, raspberry. Sweet, yoghurt, vanilla, raspberry, lactose. Medium-bodied.
Bottle thanks to my bro. It pours opaque darkest brown to black with a small khaki head. The aroma is rich roasted malt, bitter - sweet, chocolate ice cream, great depth of smoke, sweet, sticky, bonfire embers, peated whisky, medicinal, dark chocolate, rocky road, umami, dried fruits, liquorice, toasted marshmallow and old smokey Scottish pub circa 1990. The taste is slick, oily, toothy, bitter - sweet, chocolate sauce, rich roasted malt, a whole lot of of smoked vibes, warming, medicinal, peated whisky, 
bonfire, BBQ, dark chocolate, rocky road,  vanilla cake frosting, meaty, spice and some warming booze with a slick, smokey finish. Fulsome body, average carbonation and oily mouth feel. Flavourful and moreish. Good depth.
Bottle thanks to my bro. It pours opaque darkest brown to black with a small khaki head. The aroma is rich roasted malt, bitter - sweet, chocolate ice cream, great depth of smoke, sweet, sticky, bonfire embers, peated whisky, medicinal, dark chocolate, rocky road, umami, dried fruits, liquorice, toasted marshmallow and old smokey Scottish pub circa 1990. The taste is slick, oily, toothy, bitter - sweet, chocolate sauce, rich roasted malt, a whole lot of of smoked vibes, warming, medicinal, peated whisky, 
bonfire, BBQ, dark chocolate, rocky road,  vanilla cake frosting, meaty, spice and some warming booze with a slick, smokey finish. Fulsome body, average carbonation and oily mouth feel. Flavourful and moreish. Good depth.
Lime aroma, very mild. Cloudy golden, headless. Lemon, biscuit finish. Light body, easy carbonation.
Can at a tasting. Cloudy yellow, creamy head. Fruity, citric aroma. Sweet, fruity hops, onion, grassy. Medium-bodied.
Can via Beer 52 sub. Pours unclear dark brown towards black with a beige tan cap. Aroma toasted grains, chocolate, light coffee. Taste: light to moderate sweet & bitter, oats, roasted malts, chocolate coffee hints. Medium body with moderate carbonation.
Can at a tasting. Hazy pink color. Lactic, raspberry, vanilla aromas.
Sweetish, tart, vanilla, raspberry, lactose. Medium-bodied, smooth.
Hazy bronze appearance with a small head and medium body. Came in their trademark, rather unique one point can. Plenty of fruity flavours but apart from this like a lot of others .Rating number 94 as I slowly move to the magic century.
Can at a tasting. Cloudy yellow, creamy head. Fruity, lactic aromas. Sour, lactic, lemon, mango, zesty. Light-bodied, dry.
Aromas of almond, chocolate and vanilla, with a nice citrus bite on the tongue. Enjoyable.
Cask at Thomas Botfield (JDW), Telford - as Burton Bridge Festival Ale, 5.5%. Pours clear amber chestnut with a white head. Aroma: malt, caramel, apple pie, toffee apple. Taste: light sweet & light to moderate bitter, malt, caramel, apple pie, lightly warming dry-ish finish. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Sadly not in the best condition served here I think
Can 47,3 cl. Pours an opaque black with a ceamy, light brown head. Sweet and intense hazelnut aroma with an almond edge. Rich and rather sweet - flavor wise perhaps more peanut than hazelnut. Sweet, faint roast and plenty of vanilla with little bitterness. I suspect this gets cloying rather quickly, but delish in small doses. 190922
Can at a tasting. Cloudy yellow, huge head. Fruity, citrus aromas. Sweet, fruity, grassy, green, grapes notes. Over carbonated.
Can at a tasting. Cloudy yellow. Vegetal, fruity hops. Sweet, vegetal, fruity, grassy, grapefruit, citrus.  Medium-bodied, smooth.
Can from Tidens Farver @ Home. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of light malt, rich fruity hops, tropical fruit peach, pineapple, citrus. Flavor is sweet, light bitter, litttle malt, rich hoppy, juicy tropical fruit, citrus. Medium body, average carbonation, sweet and light bitter finish. Smooth and easy going. 180922
0,44l can from local K-market. Pours hazy golden with white head. Hefe with nice hoppiness. Banana and citrus, medium body. Not bad at all.
Can 47,3 cl. Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Faint citrusy nose, somewhat yeasty. Fairly solid, sweet fruitiness with good tropical hop notes. Subdued bitterness. 190922
Aroma of roasted nuts. Cola brown, medium tan head. Walnut. Medium body, easy carbonation.
Charred oak, baker's chocolate aroma, not strong. Black, thin tan head. Tootsie roll, tobacco. Medium body, soft carbonation.
Unripe berry, grain husk nose. Cloudy pink, medium head. Unripe berry, slight banana, pomegranate. Medium body, easy carbonation.
Orange appearance and pored quite flat. Not a lot of flavour and hardly any body. Disappointing and one to swerve. On the plus side it was a new brewery for me.
Golden, clear appearance with a small head. A bit lively upon opening.
Slightly sweet but overall quite well rounded. Far from being an aggressive beer but not as bland as it could have been. Not very original but it is a new brewery for me.
Can 35,5 cl. Pours an almost clear pink with a creamy, pinkish head. Lactic tartness blending in with delicious strawberry notes. Light body, lightly sweet strawberry initially and then a very vague tartness. Ends dry. Lovely aperitif beer. 190922
Bottle at home, picked up fromMother Arch ii, 19/09/22.
Moderately hazed golden orange with a just off white head that dissipates to a swirl. 
Nose is mellow citric flesh, bitter orange, tangerine, citric tinged straw, light breads.
Taste comprises orange zest, grass, lemon rind, light pine nip, toasted malts, tabgerine.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close splashed with balanced ightjuicy hop bitterness.
Tidy pale.
Black and pored with a small head. Medium body. Pleasant slightly malty flavour but apart from this there are no defining flavours. on the plus side its a new brewery for me.
Can 35,5 cl. Pours a hazy amber with an off-white head. Faint aroma, a hint of biscuity malts. Rich, malty body - caramelly and biscuity with a somewhat bitter finish. 190922
Ginger and pear nose. Hazy yellow, thin head. White grape, cheerios, pear. Light body, easy carbonation.
Can 35,5 cl. Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Fruity, orangey hop aroma. Sweet fruity body, somewhat oxidized. Some bittering hops in the finish. 190922
750mL bottled December 2021, drunk 9/18/22.
Clear blonde-golden with a medium-sized, white head showing moderate-to-low retention.
Pretty big lemon and rosemary nose, the lemon being most prominent.  Some mineral and light ester/phenol from the yeast underneath, alongside cracker and rustic grain-like malt notes.  Clean and with no alcohol, yet I can't get a very good sense of the actual base beer on account of the strong adjunct presence.  This must have been brutally overdone when fresh given that it's still so strong and dominant at 9 months old.
The taste is enjoyably full of lemon and rosemary with balancing sweet malt and good attenuation.  Light-to-medium bodied with soft mineral and light baked bread.  The lemon just sticks to the palate and never lets go throughout the course of the glass.  It's fruitier than it is acidic, thankfully, but that plus the rosemary equals I'm not even sure what the base beer is.  Is this a saison? A belgian golden? A sour?  I guess there's light tartness, but even that is obscured, somewhat, by the lemon peel.
Strong dandelion bouquet. Clear yellow, thin head. Lilly, lemongrass. Light body, easy carbonation.
Golden clear appearance and pored with a small head. Soon  became no head. Medium body and slightly sweet with a gentle bitter end. Surprised me because it was more complex than I expected. A new brewery for me.
Can 35,5 cl. Pours a hazy yellow with a small, white head. Citrusy nose, a little dusty. Medium body, slightly sweet fruitiness and great tropical hop accents - pineapple comes to mind. Subdued bitterness. 190922
No aroma. Clear yellow, thin head. Hay, light honey, light wood. Light body, easy carbonation.
A dark brown-red beer, a head is medium and beige. Aroma has breasyness, some caramel and dried fruits. Taste has richness of maltyness, some breadyness and dried fruits, even some liquorice. Medium+ bodied, smooth. This is good beer, balanced, smooth, malty.
Lemon-lime nose. Shimmering yellow, thin head. Light citrus, lime zest. Light body, easy carbonation.
Bread nose. Cloudy golden, medium head. Honey, bread, grass. Some fusel notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, warm.
0,473l can from Beer Republic. Pours hazy golden with white head. Lemon mostly, some citrus. Sour and hoppy.
Bottle poured a hazy gold with a small lasting white head. Aromas of straw, pepper, yeast, citrus and light grassiness. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of straw, pepper and light mustiness with a crisp dry lingering peppery finish.
Dandelion, lilly bouquet. Hazy amber, medium head, good lacing. Dandelion and lilly. Medium body, easy carbonation.
Bottle picked up at Misty Bottle, Isle of Skye. It pours darkest brown to black with a small beige head. The aroma is warming, roasty, warming smoke, bonfire, slightly medicinal, peated whisky, dark chocolate, dried fruits, gateaux, vanilla cake frosting and fruit cake. The taste is dry, bitter - sweet, rich roasted malt, smoked action, peated whisky, toothy, chewy, dark chocolate, medicinal, chocolate cookies, brownies, light umami, touch savoury, saline, liquorice, spice and a touch of umami with a dry, toasty finish. Medium+ body and fine carbonation. Plenty of flavour given the abv. Fun stuff.
Tap at Lowenbrau Keller, 19th September 2022.  Pours a dark hazy brown.  Aroma is banana and nutty, yeast.  Taste is full, light caramel and yeast, wheat and banana, light nuts.  Good and refreshing
Pounder can poured a cloudy yellow with a small lasting off white head. Aromas of bread, peach, orange zest, light yeast and a hint of earthiness. Palate was medium bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of bread, peach, tropical fruit and earthiness with a crisp dry lingering bitter finish.
Can poured a hazy gold with a small lasting white head. Aromas of wheat, yeast, light clove and a hint of banana. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of wheat, yeast, clove and a hint of banana with a crisp dry lingering clove finish.
Describes itself as a breakfast stout. Think the rest of the day would be in a haze if you drank  this for breakfast. Black and poured  with no head. Chocolate flavours are  there but don't dominate. The bottle label is clever but a bit scary. A nice powerful beer and a new brewery for   myself.
Babyfood strawberry, banana aroma. Muddy pink, headless, pulpy. Babyfood banana, strawberry, yeast. Full body, soft carbonation.
Can poured a hazy gold with a lingering ring of white foam. Aromas of wheat, lemon zest, light yeast and a hint of funk. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of wheat, lemon zest and light yeast with a crisp dry tart lingering citrus finish.
Black with no head .Powerful and full bodied. Has that lovely barrel aged tang that is so hard to define, but so easy to drink. Left a strong aftertaste. Classy art work on the can for a classy beer .Definitely a Saturday night special.
Grapefruit, stone fruit, pineapple and biscuit aromas. A pleasant bitterness but nothing too memorable. Lacks a little guts.
Potting soil, moss, caramel, lemongrass nose. Cloudy amber, thick head. Guava and almond, mossy overtones. Medium body, easy carbonation. Earthy, fruity, extraordinarily distinctive.
Oat, lemongrass, tea nose. Cloudy amber, thick sticky head. Lemongrass, orange peel, pencil shavings. Medium body, easy carbonation.
500ml bottle. Pours opaque brown with a tall off-white head. Aroma is pine, tea, apricots. Taste is medium sweet, pine, apricots, caramel. Medium bitter finish. Light to medium bodied.
6/9/2022. Can shared by SHIG, cheers. Pours slightly hazy pale golden with a small frothy white head. Aroma of citrus, grass, white grape, rubber, grain, herbs and wet leaves. Medium sweetness, moderate bitterness and body. Slightly oily, quite fizzy. Okay.
9/9/2022. Bottle shared by SHIG, cheers. Pours slightly hazy pale orange gold with a small bubbly white head. Aroma is funky farmhouse, sour citrus, malty, yeasty, bready, slightly mucky. Medium sweetness, moderate sour. Moderate body, watery, average carbonation. Interesting.
9/9/2022. Bottle shared by SHIG, cheers. Pours vibrant ruby red with a small bubbly pinkish white head. Aroma of berries, flowers, hedgerow fruits. Moderate sweetness, light bitterness, nice bit of tart. Moderate body, average carbonation. Bitter finish. Pretty decent.
Aromas of lemon, lime, pine, biscuit and a tiny vanilla. A solid, bready, biscuity backbone with the lemony aftertaste. A solid pale ale.
16/9/2022. Bottle shared by SHIG, cheers. Pours very dark brown with a maroon tint and minimal head. Aroma is woody, dark fruits, raisins, grape, toffee, slight meaty notes. Moderate sweetness and bitterness with light sourness. Medium body, oily, average carbonation. Tangy tart woody finish. Enjoyed this.
14/9/2022. Bottle shared by danlo, cheers Ed! Pours clear pale gold with minimal head. Aroma of sweet apple, vanilla, caramel, slight funky edge. Medium sweetness, touch of tart. Light body, watery, quite fizzy. Not bad.
1/9/2022. Can shared by SHIG, cheers. Pours black with a small short lasting bubbly beige head. Aroma of cocoa, chocolate, dark fruits, caramel, molasses. Medium to heavy sweetness, light roasted bitterness. Quite full bodied, oily and slick, soft carbonation. Enjoyable.
14/9/2022. Bottle shared by danlo, cheers Ed! Pours clear pale golden with a small bubbly white head. Aroma of sweet apple, peach, apricot, white grape. Medium sweetness, light bitterness, touch tart. Moderate body, oily, average carbonation. Sugary sharp finish. Nicely done.
13/9/2022. Bottle shared by SHIG, cheers. Pours black with a small frothy beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, wood, whiskey, liquorice, coffee. Light sweetness, quite heavy bitterness. Full body, smooth, soft carbonation. Flavoursome sipper.
330ml bottle picked up at Drygate. It pours darkest brown with a deep tan head. The aroma is rich roasted malt, charred vibes, bitter - sweet character, big hit of espresso, dark roasted malt, cacao nibs, dark chocolate, chocolate covered coffee bean and toast. The taste is rich roasted malt, bitter - sweet, charred, toasty, dark chocolate, cacao nibs, touch of umami, liquorice, loads of lovely coffee, dark roast, espresso cake and a touch of alcohol with a roasty coffee finish. Fulsome body and moderate foamy carbonation. Good depth of flavour and robust. Very nice stuff.
15/9/2022. Bottle shared by SHIG, cheers. Pours clear dark gold with a small bubbly off-white head. Aroma of citrus, stone fruits, melon, light cocoa, malt, yeast, slight perfumed edge. Medium sweetness, moderate bitterness and body. Oily, average carbonation. It's okay.
Can, small stable thick bubbly head, cloudy lightish but intense orange colour, aroma and flavor is a blend of peach and green leaves with some coconut mainly in the flavor, medium mellow green leaves bitterness. Very nice.
1/9/2022. Bottle shared by SHIG, cheers. Pours clear amber/orange with a small bubbly off-white head. Aroma of cherry, stone fruits, biscuit, hint of soy. Medium sweetness, light bitterness. Medium body, oily sticky mouthfeel, average carbonation. Rich, tangy, sweet and sour finish. Quite enjoyable.
9/9/2022. Can shared by Matt, cheers. Pours slightly hazy pale orange gold with a small bubbly off-white head. Aroma is hoppy, dank, bready malts, orange, flowers, pine. Moderate sweetness, medium bitterness, light spicy edge. Medium body, oily, soft carbonation. Slightly abrasive bitter finish, but a good warming sipper.
7/9/2022. Bottle shared by danlo, cheers Ed. Pours clear very pale bubbly gold. Aroma of apple, citrus, gin, flowers, hint of passion fruit. Medium sweetness, light bitterness, light sour. Moderate body, oily watery, spritzy carbonation. Dry and tart finish. Not bad.
14/9/2022. Bottle shared by SHIG, cheers. Pours clear pale gold with a small frothy white head. Aroma is sweet baked apple, body, whiskey, bready, caramel, biscuit, solvent, raisins. Medium sweetness, touch of tart. Medium body, oily, average to soft carbonation. Complex grower. Enjoyed this.
